loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit (10 kg of apples, 4 loads of bananas, 3 baskets of oranges, 1 basket of papayas, one basket of pineapples and one flat of oranges).

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 43 años, es una mujer alegre y con muchas ganas de progresar, convive con su pareja y es madre de cuatro hijos. La actividad que realiza Flor es la crianza y venta de reses, en donde los tiene agrupados en un caserío llamado Utiquinios, que esta ubicado a 4 horas surcando por el río Ucayali. En este terreno se queda su conviviente por espacio de 15 días cuidando a las vacas, mientras que ella estando en la ciudad se encarga de la venta del ganado y envío de alimentos hacia el caserío. Lleva en esta actividad alrededor de 10 años y lo que le gusta de este trabajoi es que le permite tener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de la casa y dar una educación adecuada a sus hijos. Considera muy rentable este negocio, porque al comprar los animales los consigue a un bajo precio y en etapa de desarrollo, al cabo de un tiempo luego de haber sido alimentados y obtenido un peso adecuado son vendidos en la feria gandera de su localidad a un precio alto. Este sería su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para invertir en su negocio, asimismo se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará alambres para el cerco de su terreno, pues una parte de su cerco se encuentra en mal estado lo que provocaría que se escape una vaca.
texts.en:
Flor, age 43, is a cheerful woman who greatly desires to make progress. She lives with her partner and is the mother of four children. Flor raises and sells cattle. Her herd is kept in the village of Utiquinios, which is located four hours downstream from the start of the Ucayali River. Her partner leaves for a period of 15 days in order to take care of the cattle. Meanwhile, Flor stays in the city and is in charge of selling the cattle and having feed sent to the village. She has been in this line of work for approximately 10 years. Flor enjoys this job because it has enabled her to have an income for taking care of the household expenses and providing an adequate education for her children. She considers this business to be profitable because she buys the animals at a low price while they have yet to develop. Once the animals have been fed and have reached a suitable weight, then they are sold at the local livestock fair at a higher price.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Flor hopes to have everyone’s support so that she can invest in her business. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her payments. The amount she requested will be used to buy barbed wire for enclosing her land. Part of her fence is in bad condition, which would allow the cattle to escape.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire for enclosing the land where her cattle are kept.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde hace más de 12 años. Comenzó vendiendo refrescos en su vivienda, aprovechando la ubicación pues tiene varios lugares que son muy transitados la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando variedad en sus refrescos. Aprendió este negocio con esfuerzo propio, su esposo y sus hijos le brindaron apoyo con esta actividad. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de bolsas, azúcar, pajillas, frutas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Martha has been selling soft drinks for more than 12 years. She began selling soft drinks from her home in order to take advantage of this location. Most of her customers come from very busy places and are always requesting a variety of soft drinks. Martha learned this business through her own efforts and her husband and children assist her with this activity.

This loan will be used to buy bags, sugar, straws, fruit, and other products.

loans.use: to buy bags, sugar, straws, fruit, and other products for making and selling soft drinks.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 29 MAI 2001. Il est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Fatou M qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est  responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'aumenter son capital et de mieux développer  son activité de vente de légumes.

Les profits lui permettront d'assister son époux pour le scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
This loan group was created on May 29, 2001.  It is made up of 15 women who live in the same village.  Their main activity is trade. 

Madame Fatou M, who is to the right of the photo and has her hand raised, is the leader of the group.  She is 63 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children.   She also cares for two other children entrusted to her by their parents.  

She sells vegetables.  She has a lot of experience in this line of work after having done it for several years. 

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and to develop her business of selling vegetables.  

The profits will allow her to help her husband with the children’s  educational and healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es: Edinson de 32 años, es soltero y vive con su mamá Aydé. Ambos habitan una casa propia que también es el local de su negocio. Hace 2 años Edinson tiene un restaurante, en las mañanas vende ceviches y al medio día ofrece comida. Con la ayuda de su mamá atiende el local y se ahorra en el pago de terceros. “Son alrededor de 30 a 40 personas que comen aquí, en horas punta, por eso lo considero rentable”, cuenta Edinson. Antes ellos no tenían mesas y sillas,  para acondicionar el local, pero poco a poco han ido adquiriéndolas. “Más adelante, desearía abrir una picantería, diversificando los platos, y atrayendo a más comensales turísticos y locales” acota; pero antes el formalizaría su empresa para evitar problemas, pues su restaurante ahora no cuenta con un nombre y tampoco está inscrito en Registros Públicos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando posteriormente, pues tiene más planes en el futuro. Comprará con el dinero más mesas y sillas, también redecorará su local para su mayor atractivo frente a la clientela.
texts.en:
Edinson is 32 years old, single, and lives with his mother Aydé. They live in their own home, which is also the location of his business. For the past two years, Edinson has managed a restaurant where he sells "ceviche" (marinated seafood cocktails) in the morning and then offers food around noon. Since his mother helps him with looking after the business, he is able to save money instead of having to pay employees. “We have anywhere from 30 to 40 people who eat here during the peak hours, so I consider this business to be profitable,” says Edinson. Before they had no tables or chairs to furnish their establishment, but gradually over time they were able to acquire them. “In the future, I want to open a picantería (a restaurant that specializes in spicy foods) and diversify my dishes so that I can attract more tourists and locals,” he adds. Edinson formalized his business in order to avoid problems. Not only does his restaurant have a name, but it has also been added to the Public Registry.

This is the first time he has worked with MFP. Edinson looks forward to working with the organization because he has more plans for the future. He will use the money to buy more tables and chairs, as well as redecorate his facilities so that it will be more attractive to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs and to redecorate his restaurant.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, pasteles y refrescos, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 28 años de edad, ella se dedica al negocio desde hace 4 años, todos los días realiza las ventas y trabaja de las 3:00pm en adelante.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, gas, quesillo, aceite, estos productos son utilizados a diario para la preparación de las pupusas y pasteles, esta será una gran ayuda para mantener todo lo necesario para preparar los productos.
Su aspiración es que el negocio crezca, apoyar a su familia y ser una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Ana sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas), "pasteles" (fried meat pies), and soft drinks.  She is a single mother with a 28-year-old daughter.  She has had her business for four years, and she sells and works every day from 3 p.m. on.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy corn, gas, soft cheese, and oil.  These products are used daily to make pupusas and pasteles.  This will be a great help to have all the necessities to make the dishes.

Her goal is for the business to grow, to support her family, and to be a good customer.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas, soft cheese, and oil.

loans.name: Sourou Michel

texts.fr: Sourou Michel est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Sourou Michel est marié à un certain Mélanie.Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sourou Michel mène comme activité la vente des pièces détachées. A côté de cette activité Sourou Michel,vend des appareils électroniques. Sourou Michel exerce cette activité passionnément depuis sept ans. Sourou Michel s’approvisionne  au Port Autonome du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Sourou Michel contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Sourou Michel sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Sourou Michel is 34 years old, lives in Benin and is married to Mélanie. The couple has two children, both attending school and in its care. The children live with their parents, who share household expenses. To provide for his needs and those of his children, Sourou Michel sells spare parts and electronic appliances. Sourou Michel has passionately been in this activity for seven years. He gets his supplies at the Autonomous Port of Benin. Thanks to the income generated by his activity he can contribute to family expenses. In order to satisfy his ever expanding clientele, Sourou Michel came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for his first loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su esposa y una hija pequeña, él se dedica a la venta de plátanos, bananos, manzanas y otros frutos, el comenzó con el trabajo hace 8 años y su horario es de 6:00am hasta la tarde.
Actualmente necesita comprar plátanos y bananos verdes,  por lo que solicita el préstamo para cubrir el gasto, la compra le ayudara para tener suficiente productos y que las ventas mejoren.
Él aspira mejorar el negocio a través de los préstamos y que su familia cuente con la alimentación necesaria y los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his wife and one young daughter.  He sells bananas, green bananas, apples, and other fruits.  He started doing this work eight years ago and his schedule is from 6 a.m. until the afternoon.

Currently he needs to buy bananas and green bananas, which is why he is requesting the loan to cover the expense.  The purchase will help him have sufficient products for sales to improve.

He hopes to improve the business with the loans, and for his family to have the necessary nutrition and basic services.

loans.use: to buy bananas and green bananas.

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
Glenda, es empleada, vive con su madre, ella administra una pupuseria donde ofrece pupusas de queso, chicharon, revueltas y bebidas, gaseosas, chocolate y refrescos  por las tardes de martes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materia prima como (maíz, quesillo chicharon) y mesas, aceite y bebidas, con esta compra tendrá lo necesario para mantener el negocio y con la compra de mesas podra alojar a más clientes, con la intencion que esten más comodos.
El sueño de Glenda es,  que el negocio crezca y poder aumentar en sus ingresos y tener lo necesario para vivir mejor y que su madre siempre tenga lo necesario.
texts.en:
Glenda is employed and lives with her mother. She manages a pupuseria (a store selling stuffed tortillas) which sells tortillas stuffed with cheese, pork cracklings, scrambled eggs and drinks, sodas, chocolate and refreshments in the evenings from Tuesdays to Sundays.

The loan will be used to purchase raw materials such as corn, cheese, pork cracklings as well as tables, oil and beverages. These purchases are necessary to maintain the business and buy the tables which will allow her accomodate more customers with the intention of making them feel more comfortable.

Glenda's dream is that the business grow and she is able to increase their income so that they have enough to live a better life and that her mother always has everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork cracklings, oil and tables from the market

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino tiene 38 años, y vive con su esposa en la casa que ambos construyeron hace dos años. Catalino trabaja como jornalero durante la epoca de sequia (Noviembre a Junio), y como agricultor durante el resto del año (epoca de lluvia). Su esposa se dedica a la venta de medicina de botiquín (que no necesita receta médica) de comunidad en comunidad.

Durante la epoca seca (aproximadamente 9 meses del año), Catalino depende de su empleo como jornalero en una finca ganadera. En dicho empleo gana entre $6 a $8 dólares diarios. Durante la epoca de cultivo, Catalino cultiva un maximo de 7,000 metros cuadrados. Él cosecha lo suficiente para la alimentación de su familia, y deja una porción para la venta. De las ganancias de la venta, Catalino compra todos los insumos necesarios para su cultivo. El año pasado Catalino recibió un préstamo de Fundación Campo para cultivar maíz, y el cumplió con los pagos responsablemente.

Actualemente Catalino pidió un prestamo a Fundación Campo para colocarle energia electrica a su casa, al igual que para construir una cerca perimetral para su parcela agrícola. Hace dos años Catalino y su esposa construyeron su casa de adobe (tierra o barro crudo). Con la ayuda del préstamo Catalino podra tener energia electrica en su casa por primera vez en su vida. Con la energia eléctrica él podra tener otros electrodomesticos para preparar y guardar alimentos, al igual que darle mayor seguridad a su casa al estar iluminada por las noches. De igual modo el inmueble subirá en valor con acceso a dicho servicio.

En un futuro Catalino quiere comprar un refrigerador, y una cocina o una plancha pupusera (para hacer pupusas, platillo típico de El Salvador). Por la ubicación estratégica de su vivienda, Catalino desea tener una pequeña tienda y venta de pupusas. De esta manera su esposa no tendrá que viajar tan lejos para trabajar, y ellos podran tener otra fuente de ingresos para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Catalino is 38 years old and lives with his wife in a house that they built two years ago. Catalino works as a laborer during the dry season (November to June) and as a farmer during the rest of the year (which is during the rainy season). His wife sells over-the-counter medicines in their community.

During the dry season (which lasts approximately nine months), Catalino depends on his job as a ranch hand. In this job, he earns between $6 to $8 per day. During the farming season, he cultivates 7000 square meters of land. He grows enough to feed his family and has a portion left over to sell. The profit from what he sells is used to buy all the supplies he needs for farming. Last year, Catalino received a loan from Fundación Campo for growing corn. He completed his payments responsibly.

He is now requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to install electricity in his house. In addition, he will build a fence along the perimeter of his farmland. Two years ago, Catalino and his wife built a house out of adobe (earth or crude clay). With the help of this loan, Catalino will be able to have electricity in his house for the first time in his life. As a result, he will be able to have appliances for preparing and preserving food. In addition, his home will have greater security because he will have lighting at night. Since his property will have access to this service, it will increase in value.

In the future, Catalino wants to buy a refrigerator, a stove, and a griddle for making “pupusas” (a traditional dish in El Salvador). Since his home is in a strategic location, Catalino wants to open a small store and start selling “pupusas” so that his wife will not have to travel far in order to work. They will also have another source of income that will allow them to live decently.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home and to build a fence around his farmland.

loans.name: Marcos Tomas

texts.es: Marcos Tomas tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad es el comercio de chatarra. Desde hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida, el realiza este trabajo todos los días de manera ambulante el esfuerzo que realiza todos los días por conseguir este productos es muy difícil pero esto no lo desanima a continuar con este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de latas, hierro, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Marco Tomas has three young children. He sells scrap metal and has earned his living in this manner for more than three years. Every day he must travel around in order to acquire his products. Even though the work is very difficult, Marco is not discouraged and continues with this way of life.

This loan will be will be used to buy cans, iron, and other products.

loans.use: to buy cans, iron, and other types of scrap metal.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, Philomène est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses quatre enfants. Tous les enfants de Philomène sont scolarisés et sont à sa charge. Philomène n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Philomène mène comme activité la vente des tissus, des chaussures et des bijoux.Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Philomène assure sans grande difficulté, les différentes charges de sa famille. Philomène s’approvisionne  dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Philomène sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: 52-year-old Philomène is a widow who lives alone with her four children.  All her children are in school and in her care.  Philomène herself never went to school.  In order to cover her own needs, as well as those of her children, she works selling fabrics, shoes and jewelry.  Thanks to the money that she makes from her business, Philomène is able to cover her family's different needs without much difficulty.  She stocks up at the main market in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers and improve her standard of living and income, she is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, fabrics, shoes and jewelry

loans.name: Joen Patricia

texts.es: Joen Patricia tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Desde hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, que inicio como una oportunidad de empleo además le ayuda para contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo Joen se encarga de proporcionarle lo necesario a su hijo además todos los días le enseña valores muy importantes para que sea una persona de bien. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico, fósforos y golosinas.
texts.en:
Joen Patricia is 42 years old and has managed a store for more than 15 years. She started to pursue this opportunity for employment so that she could help contribute toward the household expenses. Joen has a son who she cares for and tries to provide everything he needs. In addition, she tries to teach him very important values every day so that he will become a good person.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, and candy.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, and candy.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel  es comerciante de bolsos, calzado, dulces y ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones que vende por minutos; su negocio lo inició cuando su hija se le ocurrió poner la venta de minutos a celulares y ella hace 4 años, al ingresar a la Universidad, lo dejó a Israel, a quien se le dificultaba trabajar en empresas, como antes lo había hecho,  porque su operación del corazón, le dificultó laborar en su antigua actividad. Hoy le adicionó  a esta clientela, dulces y  la oferta de bolsos y calzado,  apoyando a su esposa que ya vendía mercancía variada.  Su sueño es lograr más adelante tener un local confortable, para brindarle un ambiente especial a sus clientes, a los que aspira ofrecer todo tipo de mercancía que le soliciten. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar variedades de diseños en bolsos y calzado, además de tres nuevos planes de minutos para responder a la creciente clientela que diariamente llegan a su negocio y con esto sustenta el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Israel is a merchant of bags, footwear, and sweets and he also offers telecommunication services that he sells by the minute. His business started when his daughter had the idea of selling cell phone minutes and four years ago, upon entering the university, she left it to Israel.  However, for him it became more complicated to work in business as he had before, because of his operation on his heart, which made it difficult for him to work at his previous trade.  Now, he has added to this clientele, offering sweets, bags, and footwear, supporting his wife who already sold various merchandise.  His dream for the future is to attain a more comfortable location in order to offer a special environment to his customers.  For them, he hopes to have every type of merchandise that they request.   Currently, he is applying for his Kiva loan, first financing through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase a variety of designs in bags and footwear, in addition to three new calling plans in order to respond to the growing number of customers that arrive daily to his business and support the success of the investment.

loans.use: to purchase comprará variedades de diseños en bolsos, además de tres nuevos planes de minutos

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Clementina de 45 años, esta casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad y ya tienen familia. Por lo tanto vive con su esposo y se hace cargo de 3 hijos menores a quienes educa y cría. La casa que habita es propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, siendo la actividad económica que predomina en su comunidad, labor que heredaron de sus padres. Cultivan café, kión y achiote en sus propios terrenos que abarcan 6 parcelas aproximadamente. Todo lo que siembra lo vende, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos, ya que además cuenta con una bodega donde ofrece diversos productos de primera necesidad. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP, y se siente contenta con  el trabajo en su banco comunal, “soy consciente que trabajando con el grupo tendremos mayor producción, por que tenemos los mismos intereses”, comenta. Con el préstamo ella afianzará las plantaciones de café, con la compra de abonos naturales, además para el pago de mano de obra para la limpieza de sus sembríos de kión.
texts.en: Clementina, 45, is married and has five children.  Three of them are adults and have their own families.  She lives with her husband and cares for three minor children who she educates and cares for.  She owns her house.  She and her husband are farmers, the dominant economic activity in her community and a skill that was passed down from their parents.  They farm coffee, ginger and annatto on their own fields that encompass six parcels approximately.  Everything she grows she sells; this is her main source of income but she also has a store where she sells basic need items.  		This is the first time she’s worked with MFP and she feels happy with her communal bank.  “I’m aware that working with a group we will have higher production because we share the same goals,” she comments.  She will use the loan to tie back the coffee plants, to buy natural manure and also to pay labor costs to weed the ginger plantations.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 21 años, es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a  sus 3 hermanos menores. Él y sus padres se dedican a la agricultura, sembrando kión y café, principalmente. Edgar terminó de estudiar hace 3 años cursos de mantenimiento de maquinaria pesada en un Centro Tecnológico Productivo, pero por ahora prefiere desempeñarse en la agricultura, gracias a los terrenos que sus padres le han otorgado. Considera rentable la venta del café cuyo precio es de 11 soles el kilo; y del kión, ya que el kilo lo está vendiendo a 1.50 soles. Por la falta de capital para pagar la mano de obra no inició esta actividad el año pasado, así que espera hacerlo cuanto antes para ayudar a sus hermanos pequeños e independizarse. Mas adelante, él quisiera trabajar en las minas con el respaldo de sus estudios técnicos y visiones y con ello abrir un recreo turístico que cuente con restaurante y campos verdes en su comunidad. Es el primer préstamo que recibe de MFP, a la vez, es su primera vez trabajando con un banco comunal, así que menciona sentirse contento por ser integrantes conocidos y cercanos. Con la prestación económica Edgar podrá pagar al personal que laborará en la siembra y cosecha del café, que cuesta de 20 a 25 soles diarios por trabajador.
texts.en:
Edgar, 21, is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house with his three younger siblings.  He and his parents are farmers.  They grow ginger and coffee, primarily.  

Three years ago Edgar finished a heavy machinery maintenance course at a Productive Technological Center but he now prefers to work in farming thanks to the fields his parents passed down to him.  He considers selling coffee, which currently goes for 11 soles the kilogram, and ginger which sells for 1.5 soles a kilogram to be profitable.  

Because of lack of funds to hire workers, he was unable to start this activity last year so he hopes to be able to start it as quickly as possible to help his younger siblings and to become independent.  Later on he’d like to work in the mines availing himself of his technical studies and vision and eventually open a tourist center in his community complete with restaurant and green areas.

This is his first MFP loan as well as his first time working with a communal bank so he mentions that he feels happy because the members are neighbors and known to him.  Edgar will be able to use this economic help to pay workers to work in the coffee planting and harvesting which costs 20-25 soles per day per worker.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Osmar Daniel

texts.es: Omar Daniel se dedica a la venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Lo inicio porque en su finca realizaba la crianza  y venta de cerdos pues la experiencia la tiene por un buen tiempo. El sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda ya que no ha podido realizarlo porque no ha tenido el dinero necesario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues en algunos lugares de su comarca les ofrecen los cerdos a precios favorbles.
texts.en: Omar Daniel sells pigs; he’s had the business for over four years.  He started it because he raised pigs in his farm to sell and he has quite a bit of experience.  His dream is to finish building his house that he hasn’t been able to complete for lack of funds.  The loan is to buy pigs because there are places in his area selling them at favorable prices.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 23 años de edad tiene 2 hijos, uno de 4 y otro de 1 año. Son casi 2 años los que convive con su pareja en una casa humilde pero propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura en terrenos de su propiedad donde siembran café, plátano, y algo de yuca para consumo de su familia. Esencialmente, ellos viven de la venta del café, por otra parte su esposo aporta otros ingresos trabajando como peón en sembríos ajenos, pero no lo hace con frecuencia. Irma está iniciando sus labores agrícolas, su familia aún es joven, por eso siempre han tenido inconvenientes, tales como la falta de presupuesto, de personal y de terrenos. Más adelante, si sus planes en el campo prosperan ella espera arreglar su casa, sustituir su techo rústico por uno de calaminas y otros detalles para darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Es su primer crédito en MFP, y espera que sea continuo por que tiene muchas ansias de crecimiento. El trabajo con “Los Yorinis” (su banco comunal) es agradable y le sirve de inspiración para seguir emprendiendo. Comprará con el dinero sacos de abonos y fertilizantes que calcula costará unos 150 soles por costal, y semillas de café para iniciar una nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Irma, 23, has two children; one is four and the other is one year old.  She’s been living with her spouse for almost two years in a humble house that’s hers, though.  She and her husband farm fields they own where they grow coffee, bananas and some manioc for family consumption.  Essentially, they live off coffee sales.  On the other hand, her husband earns extra income working as a day worker on other fields but he doesn’t do this too frequently.

Irma is starting the farming chores.  Her family is still young so she’s always had inconveniences because of that like the lack of budget, for example, and lack of personnel and land.  Later on if her plans for the fields prosper she hopes to do some home improvements, to replace the rustic roof with plywood as well as some other details to provide her children with a better quality of life.

This is her first MFP loan and she hopes it will be continuous because she very much wants to grow.  Work with “Los Yorinis” (her communal bank) is pleasant and serves as inspiration for her to continue enterprising.  She will use the money to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer that she figures will cost about 150 soles per sack and coffee seeds to start the new planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Alihossi Christine

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans Ahihossi Christine est mariée à Toussaint un mécanicien. Le couple à quatre enfants tous scolarisés et leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Ahihossi Christine et son mari. Pour participer efficacement aux devoirs de mère de famille qui est le sien, Ahihossi Christine vend depuis sept ans, des ustensile de cuisine et des bidons d'huile "Dinor" par le système de distribution. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Ahihossi Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un septième prêt.Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Alihossi Christine is 27 years old and married to Toussaint who is a mechanic.  The couple have four children who are all in school and their responsibility.  The couple live together with their children.  The household expenses are covered by Alihossi Christine and her husband.  In order to participate effectively in her duties as a mother, for the past seven years Alihossi Christine has been selling kitchen utensils and cans of Dinor-brand oil through the distribution system.  With the goal of building up her business and better responding to her customer demand, she is requesting a seventh loan from ALIDé.  She fully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and cans of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Tejiendo Sueños En La Cordillera Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Tejiendo Sueños en la cordillera”, está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía en madera, lana, gastronomía, preparación de comida rápida, venta de ropa y confites. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Patricia delegada del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, usando un sweater estampado, se dedica a vender lana hilada. Ella se encarga de procesar lana esquilada de oveja, la compra en casas particulares en las cuales crían ovejas. Posteriormente la lava, seca, escarmena (desenredar y limpiar la lana) e hila la lana. El proceso tarda alrededor de tres días. Comenta que éste es un oficio heredado por su madre, por lo que se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a éste rubro. 
El crédito lo utilizará para comprar una máquina escarmenadora, sin embargo debe juntar más dinero para obtenerla, ya que tiene un valor más alto. Esta máquina facilitaría su trabajo. 
Patricia vende de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga durante la semana. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se debe principalmente a que Patricia disfruta mucho lo que realiza, además que le permite un ingreso económico para su hogar.
Sus metas son mantener éste oficio y poder enseñarlo a algún familiar para que se mantenga culturalmente. 
Ella vive junto a su marido y tiene un hijo de 28 años quien está casado.
Patricia está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste crédito le servirá para invertir en su negocio y de ésta manera generar en lo posible mayores ingresos. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal dice tener una muy buena relación, ya que además se conocían de antes. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The Tejiendo Sueños en la Cordillera communal bank is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different areas such as: wood crafts, wool, cooking, fast food preparation, clothing and candy sales.  All are from Temuco.
Patricia Delegada of the communal bank is in the first row, second from right to left in the phot wearing a patterned sweater and she sells wool thread.  She is in charge of processing fleece that she buys from the private houses that raise sheep.  She then washes it, dries it, cards it,  (untangles and cleans the wool) and makes thread from it. The process takes three days.  She says that she learned the skill from her mother and that’s why she has been working in this field for a long time.

She will use the loan to buy a wool carding machine.  However, she needs to collect more money to get it since the machine is very expensive but it will make her work easier. Patricia sells according to the orders she has during the week.

Her motivations to continue with the business are principally that she enjoys what she does and it also gives her an income for her home.

Her goals are to keep this business and to be able to teach the skill to one of her family members so there is a continuation of this cultural craft.  She lives with her husband and she has a 28-year-old married son 

Patricia is very happy and grateful for the support offered her by Fondo Esperanza since this loan will be used to invest in her business and thus hopefully generate higher earnings.  As for the communal bank group she says that she has good relationships with the members since she knew them from before.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region, located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There are  a series of natural baths (Pucón, Villarrica) and a very beautiful native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s noteworthy that 50% of the Mapuches, an indigenous people of our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy a wool carding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to build a fence around the house

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es: Manuela Del Socorro administra una pulpería, a pesar de las dificultades que a diario atraviesa ella se ha dedicado a ser una persona responsable y al mismo tiempo disfruta de tener un medio de vida. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, sopas, enlatados y algunos estantes ya que hay algunos productos que solicitan en su vivienda. Esta inversión le dará una mejor vistosidad al negocio, ya que podrá lucir sus productos para los clientes.
texts.en: Manuela Del Socorro manages a store.  In spite of the difficulties she passes every day, she strives to be a responsible person and also enjoys having a livelihood.  She requests a loan to buy basic grains, detergents, candy, soft drinks, bread, crackers, soup, canned goods, and some shelves, since there are some products her customers ask for in her store.  This investment will give the business a better look, since she will be able to show off her products to her customers.

loans.use: buy basic grains, detergents, candy, soft drinks, bread, crackers, soup, canned goods, and some shelves.

loans.name: Vacelisa

texts.es: Vacelisa de 37 años de edad, tiene 10 hijos, de ellos todavía mantiene a 7. Convive con Venancio, su esposo en una casita rústica que es de su propiedad. Ella y su numerosa familia se dedican a la agricultura, con la siembra de café, maíz, yuca, plátano, entre otros de consumo personal; en  sus 15 parcelas de terreno agrícola.  “El achiote es un producto que tiene mucha demanda en la provincia de Chanchamayo”, menciona. A su vez considera su cultivo rentable por que dicha planta es utilizada para la pigmentación de quesos, mantequillas; y como principal ingrediente para la elaboración de condimentos. El principal problema que tiene ella, proviene de las malas jugadas del clima, el exceso y escasez de lluvias; además de la baja de precios de sus productos. Vacelisa y Venancio viven en armonía, pero anhelan que, con el pasar de los años, sus 15 porciones de terrenos sean explotados en su totalidad, para afianzarse económicamente y darles a sus hijos una buena educación. Es el primer crédito que obtienen de MFP, por ello, se muestra entusiasta frente a los días y meses venideros y más aún con el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, del cual se siente satisfecha hasta el momento. Con el dinero que solicita, podrá comprar semillas de maíz y pagar a los jornaleros que apoyarán en su siembra y cosecha.
texts.en:
Vacelisa is 37 years old. She has 10 children and still supports 7 of them. She lives with her husband Venancio in a small rustic house she owns. She and her numerous family work in agriculture. In their 15 plots of land they sow coffee, corn, manioc, plantain, and other produce for personal consumption. "Annatto is a product for which there is a lot of demand in the province of Chanchamayo", she mentions. She herself considers this crop profitable because said plant is used for coloring cheeses and butters, and also as a main ingredient for making condiments.
The main problem she faces comes when the weather is bad, with too much or too little rainfall, and also when the price of her produce is down. Vacelisa and Venancio live harmoniously, but they wish that in time their 15 plots of land can be cultivated in their entirety. That way they can establish themselves financially and give their children a good education.
This is the first loan they receive from MFP. Because of it, she is enthusiastic about the days and months to come and also about working with her communal bank, with which she is pleased so far. With the loan she requests she will purchase corn seeds and pay the farmlabourers who help her with sowing and harvesting.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and hire farmlabourers.

loans.name: Irania Maria

texts.es: Irania Maria tiene dos créditos con Fundación, ella tiene 39 años es casada y junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario lo inicio en su vivienda, Irania cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos que siempre la han apoyado y su esposo que también obtiene otros ingresos  trabajando fuertemente. Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de carnes, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados entre otros. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Irania Maria has had two loans with Fundación. She is 39 years old and married, and along with her partner she has three underage children in her care. She sells goods for daily consumption, a business she started from home. She gets help from her children, who have always supported her, and from her husband who also earns an income from another source by working very hard. She requested the loan to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soup, canned goods, etc. She is happy to get the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soup, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 30 años de edad convive hace 3 años con su esposo, con quien tiene 4 hijos pequeños. Ellos viven en armonía en una casa rústica de su propiedad. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. En sus 2 parcelas de terreno siembran café, para negociar; y yuca para el consumo de su familia. A parte de eso, Verónica cuenta con un pequeño negocio en su casa, ahí vende golosinas, gaseosas y cervezas. Por su parte, de vez en cuando, su esposo trabaja en el campo de personas ajenas. Próximamente piensa ampliar su negocio de gaseosas y cervezas, pues sabe que es rentable y trae buenos ingresos, para ello necesitará acondicionar un nuevo ambiente. El tema económico y la falta de presupuesto fueron sus principales inconvenientes, tanto en la siembra como el negocio, situación que piensan superar con esfuerzo. “Mas adelante me gustaría tener una casa bonita, confío mucho en Dios y sé que si me esmero lo podré lograr”, cuenta entusiasta. Trabaja por primera vez con MFP y su banco comunal, del cual se siente cómoda y agradecida. Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de una refrigeradora, por exigencia de su pequeño mercado; también más gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 30 years old. She has lived with her husband for three years and they have four small children. They live harmoniously in a rustic house they own. Their main business is agriculture. In their two plots of land they sow coffee for selling and manioc for their family's consumption.
Besides that, Verónica runs a small business from her home, where she sells candy, soft drinks and beer. On his part, her husband works in other people's lands from time to time.
She plans to soon expand her soft drinks and beer business, because she knows it is profitable and generates a nice income. For that she will need to set up a new room. Financial matters and the lack of a budget have been their main obstacles both in farming and in this business, a situation they hope to overcome with their efforts.
"In time I would like to own a beautiful house. I trust in God a great deal and I know that if I work hard I can achieve that", she says enthusiastically. This is the first time she works with MFP and the communal bank, in which she feels comfortable and grateful. She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator, which her small store demands, and also more soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and more beverages.

loans.name: Otara

texts.en:
Otara is 39 years of age and married with six children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Otara has 2 years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated at WST 400 or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Otara joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Otara's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Penina owns and operates a business selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Penina needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Penina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Penina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Sarai

texts.en:
Sarai owns and operates a business venture selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She is 30 years of age and married with two children. Sarai has two years of experience in this business. 

In 2010, Sarai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sarai's second loan with SPBD. She needs a loan of 1400 tala to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 tala or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es: Meliza tiene 23 años. Hace 8 años se casó con Willy, el padre de su único hijo de 8 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus suegros. Ella se dedica principalmente a labores del campo, específicamente a la siembra de productos como: papaya, café, maíz, kión y plátanos en terrenos de su propiedad. Hace 2 años abrió una pequeña bodega en el hogar donde vive, de esa manera genera más ingresos para su familia. Con su esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus suegros a podido mantener a su hijo; ya que su esposo se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima dedicándose a la música, por tal motivo no la visita con frecuencia. Meliza comenta que, la venta del café y maíz son rentables y tiene mucha demanda en la ciudad de Pichanaki. La falta de capital hizo que no pueda sembrar sus productos en cantidades que ella deseaba, por lo que anhela ampliar sus cosechas en las parcelas de sus suegros y con suerte al próximo año construirá su casa y ampliará su negocio. Es la primera vez que Meliza obtiene un préstamo de MFP, por esa razón tiene muchas expectativas en el trabajo con su banco comunal en donde se siente muy cómoda y entusiasta. Con el financiamiento que espera obtener, ella comprará semillas de café y kión; así como invertir en la mano de obra que requieren los cultivos que, según comenta Meliza, cuesta de 20 a 25 soles al día por peón.
texts.en:
Meliza is 23 years old. Eight years ago she married Willy, the father of her only child, an 8-year-old son. She lives at her in-law's house.
She does mainly rural work, specifically sowing produce such as papayas, coffee, corn, ginger and plantains in the land she owns. Two years ago she opened a small grocery store at home in order to get more income for her family. With her own efforts, as well as her in-law's help, she has been able to support her son. Her husband is in the city of Lima working in music and for that reason he doesn't visit often.
Meliza reports that coffee and corn sales are profitable and there is much demand for it in the town of Pichanaki. For lack of working capital, she can't sow her produce in the quantities she would like to. That's why she wishes to expand her harvests in her in-law's plot. With luck, next year she will build her house and expand her business.
This is the first time she receives a loan from MFP. For that reason she has great expectations for her work with the communal bank, in which she feels very comfortable and enthusiastic. With the loan she hopes to get, she will purchase coffee and ginger seeds. She will also use it to hire labor which is needed for farming. Meliza says that each rural worker costs 20 to 25 soles a day.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and ginger seeds and to hire rural workers.

loans.name: Ofusina

texts.en:
Ofusina is 28 years of age and she is a single woman with four children. Ofusina owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has one year of experience in this business.  

In 2011, Ofusina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Ofusina's first loan with SPBD. Ofusina needs a loan of 1000 tala to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 tala or US $125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en:
Mataniu owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She is 51 years of age and married with eight children. Mataniu has six years of experience in her business. 

In 2007, Mataniu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mataniu's seventh loan with SPBD. Mataniu needs a loan of 2500 tala to purchase general farm supplies and equipment such as a spade, knives, axes and a wheelbarrow. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 tala or US $200 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment such as a spade, knives, axes and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Rupi

texts.en:
Rupi owns and operates a business venture selling food products in the local community. She is 40 years of age and married with four children. Rupi has four years of experience in this business. 

Rupi needs a loan of 2700 tala to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks, candies, tinned food and freezer [foods]. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Rupi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Rupi's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks, candies, tinned food and freezers (mutton flaps, sausages and pork)

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She is 34 years of age and married with five children. Ulata has one year of experience in this business. 

Ulata needs a loan of 750 tala to purchase baking powder, a sack of flour, cooking utensils and an oven. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 180 tala or US $80 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Ulata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Ulata's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking powder, a sack of flour, cooking utensils and an oven

loans.name: Ceprina

texts.en:
Ceprina needs a loan of 1500 tala to purchase another quarter acre to expand her plantation. She is 23 years of age and married with three children. Ceprina owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Ceprina plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 tala or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Ceprina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Ceprina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase another quarter acre to expand her plantation

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is 48 years old. She is a single woman with no children. Sale owns and operates a business selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Sale needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sale's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Rodrigo's Group

texts.es:
Rodrigo's group está conformado por tres personas: Dos mujeres y un hombre, en este grupo el presidente se llama Rodrigo.

Rodrigo tiene 27 años, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos y vive solo en San Gabriel provincia del Carchi en el Norte de Ecuador. Se considera una buena persona que busca lo mejor para sus hijos.

Trabaja solo en la crianza y venta de cerdos. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de crías de cerdo para su crianza y posteriormente para su venta, causando que su negocio incremente sus ventas e ingresos lo cual es indispensable para el y para sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un criadero de cerdo grande.
texts.en:
Rodrigo's group is comprised of three people - two women and one man. The leader of this group is named Rodrigo.
Rodrigo is 27 years old and single. He has two children and lives alone in San Gabriel, province of Carchi, northern Ecuador. He considers himself a good person who seeks the best for his children.
He works alone in raising and selling pigs. This is the first loan he requests from FODEMI and he will use it to purchase piglets for raising and later selling. That way, his business will get an increase in sales and profits which are indispensable to him and his children.
His dream is to own a large pig breeding farm.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Poima

texts.en:
Poima is 28 years of age and married with two children. Poima owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. 

Poima needs a loan of 1,500 tala to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2010, Poima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Poima's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sulimauga

texts.en:
Sulimauga is 49 years of age and married with five children. Sulimauga owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Sulimauga needs a loan of 1,500 tala to purchase sacks of flour, baking powder, yeast and an oven to replace the old one. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 tala or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Sulimauga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sulimauga's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, baking powder, yeast and an oven.

loans.name: Koleta

texts.en:
Koleta is 59 years of age and she is a widow with six children. Koleta owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Koleta needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 108 talas or US $45 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2008, Koleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Koleta's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Uilou

texts.en:
Uilou is 26 years of age and married, with two children. Uilou owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Uilou needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $40 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2010, Uilou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Uilou's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Asociacion Comunal Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Eusebia con sus compañeras Leyda, Donald, Silvia Del Carmen, Maria De Los Ángeles, Teresa de Jesús, Sabina, Martha, y Jefry.Todos los que conforman el banco comunal tienen diferentes actividades económicas. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Maria Eusebia se dedica a la venta de hornado y una pulpería, tiene más de 2 años en este negocio comenzó esta actividad por su Mama que le enseño la forma de salir adelante. El crédito como los otros socios lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, pan, galletas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María Eusebia and her companions: Leyda, Donald, Silvia Del Carmen, María De Los Ángeles, Teresa de Jesús, Sabina, Martha and Jefry.  

Each member of the communal bank has a specific activity.  The communal bank is composed of people who are all hardworking and enterprising and always seek through their own efforts to find opportunities for their families to get ahead and to provide their children with a better future.

María Eusebia sells baked goods and has a grocery store.  She’s had the business for over two years and started it thanks to her mother who taught her how to get ahead.  She requests the loan, like the other members too, to buy basic grains, detergent, bread and cookies, among other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, bread and cookies, among other products.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni, se dedica a vender verduras, vive con su familia, el negocio de Marleni es la venta de verduras tomates, rábanos, plátanos, papas, dichas verduras las compra en el mercado municipal, luego sale a visitar casa por casa a los clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verduras, ya que por falta de efectivo no puede en algunos días salir con la venta, al disponer de este fondo piensa invertirlo en güisquiles, repollo, papas, cebollas, con esto espera tener disponibilidad para mantener las ventas.
Las aspiraciones de Marleni son mejorar la vivienda, ser buen cliente con los pagos para contar con financiamientos que le permitan crecer.
texts.en:
Marleni sells vegetables. She lives with her family. Marleni's business is to sell vegetables such as tomatoes, radishes, bananas, potatoes which she buys at the municipal market and then sells house-to-house to her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables as some days she can't go out to sell as she has no funds with which to buy the vegetables. On receiving the loan she is thinking of investing it in the purchase of güisquiles, cabbage, potatoes, onions. With this she hopes to be available to maintain her sales.

Marleni's aspirations are to improve her house, be a good member with regards her repayments so as to be able to count on financial backing that will allow her to grow.

loans.use: to buy güisquiles, cabbage, potatoes and onions for the business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years of age and married, with three children. Ruth owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Ruth needs a loan of WST1500 to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder and baking utensils.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Ruth joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ruth's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder and baking utensils

loans.name: Santos Enor

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es agricultor, durante la temporada siembra maíz y frijol, tiene 5 años de estar en esta actividad, su padre fue quien le enseño a realizar todo el proceso agrícola.
Actualmente Santos está solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en abono y semilla mejorada, estos materiales son los principales en esa labor, por ello al comprarlos estará dando un buen inicio para que la siembra este fuerte.
La aspiración de Santos es que sus hijos estudien, en un futuro poderles brindar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his wife and 2 children. He is a farmer and during the season he plants corn and beans. He has been doing this job for 5 years. His father taught him everything he knows about farming. 

Currently Santos is asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of manure and improved seed. These materials are key in his work. That is why by buying them he will ensure that his sowing has a good start and the plants are strong.

Santos' aspiration is that his children study and that in the future he can provide them with their own house.

loans.use: to buy manure and improved seed.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Tulcán. María se describe como una persona muy responsable, sencilla, humilde y tranquila. 

Trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de cerdos de engorde para posteriormente sacar al mercado para su venta. Es es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado para la compra de crías de cerdos para su crianza que servirá para que su negocio crezca.

Su sueño es que su familia se mantenga con buena salud y que su negocio le siga dando ingresos para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en: María, 47, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in Tulcán.  She describes herself as a very responsible, unassuming, humble and calm person.  She works with her husband raising pigs to later take to market to be sold.  This is her second loan request to Fodemi and she’ll use it to buy litters of piglets to raise so that her business will grow.  Her dream is that her family stays healthy and that her business continues to produce income so that she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta owns and operates a business venture baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She is 56 years of age and married with seven children. Imeleta has four years of experience in this business.

Imeleta needs a loan of 2,700 tala to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, flavoring and an extra oven. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 tala or US $235 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Imeleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Imeleta's sixth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, flavoring and an extra oven

loans.name: Oscar Osmar

texts.es:
Oscar, es agricultor, está soltero, vive con sus padres, él lleva muchos años dedicándose a sembrar maíz, actividad que ha aprendido al lado de su padre, este oficio le agrada mucho a Oscar, ya que lleva varios procesos que por su experiencia los maneja a perfección.
Actualmente necesita compara abono y semilla mejorada para iniciar el proceso de siembra en frijol y maíz, esta compra de materiales serán un gran apoyo para Oscar.
Su sueño es algún día formar su propio hogar, construir su casa.
texts.en:
Oscar is a farmer. He is single and he lives with his parents. He has been growing corn for several years. He learned to do this from his father. This trade makes Oscar very happy. Due to his experience, he is able to do many farm processes perfectly.
Now he needs to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to start the process of planting beans and corn. The purchase of these materials will be a great help for Oscar. 
His dream is to one day have his own home and build a house.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and seeds in order to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Sivanila

texts.en:
Sivanila owns and operates a business venture producing flavored drinks to local communities. She is 27 years of age and married with four children. Sivanila has two years of experience in this business. 

Sivanila needs a loan of 1,500 tala to purchase large coolers for storage of drinks and sacks of sugar. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 295 tala or US $140 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sivanila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sivanila 's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase large coolers and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Seirosa

texts.en:
Seirosa is 24 years of age and a single woman with no children. Seirosa owns & operates a business baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Seirosa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Seirosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Seirosa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and milk.

loans.name: Yamila Jeanneth

texts.es:
Yamila, es sastre, confecciona toda clase D. ropa D. vestir, vive con su hijo y su esposo, ella aprendió el oficio D. sastrería porque su madre se lo enseño, y este oficio le ha servido para poder comprarse todo lo necesario  y apoyar a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. telas D. diferentes colores, hilos, agujas, entre otros materiales que son muy necesarios, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener en la sastrería los insumos necesarios para la confección, realizando los trabajos en el tiempo requerido por los clientes. La aspiracion D. Yamila es poderce capacitar para mejorar los trabajos y hacer nuevas modas en la confeccion.
texts.en:
Yamila is a tailor who makes all types of clothing.  She lives with her son and her husband.  She learned the traD. of tailor because her mother taught it to her, and this job has served her to be able to buy herself everything she needs and support her family.
 
Currently she is requesting a loan to buy fabric in different colors, threads, needles, and other necessary materials.  This loan will help her to keep on hand the necessary tailoring materials for finishing the jobs in the time required by her customers.

Yamila's goal is to be able to prepare herself to improve her work and to make new styles.

loans.use: to buy fabric in different colors, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en:
Tasileta is 36 years of age and married with five children. Tasileta owns & operates a business venture baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has four years of experience in this business. Tasileta needs a loan of WST $2,700 to purchase additional baking utensils and an extra oven to make her baking go faster. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $240 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tasileta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tasileta's sixth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking utensils and an extra oven

loans.name: Abriendo Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Abriendo Futuro”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de dulces, repostería, venta de ropa nueva y usada, además de artesanía y picadura de leña. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Johana integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en la tercera fila, en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello está peinado hacia atrás. Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva, desde hace 2 años.
Las ventas, las realiza casa por casa a sus amigos y conocidos, también vende su mercadería en el living de su casa cuando junta un grupo de clientes. Su mercadería la compra en el barrio Meiggs, ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará zapatillas y poleras para niños.  
Sus metas son expandir su negocio, para esto instalarse con un local establecido, en donde pueda ofrecer y vender su mercadería. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que quiere conseguir una estabilidad económica para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Johana vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 2 años de edad. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que a las demás integrantes del grupo del banco comunal, las conocía anteriormente, por lo que existe una mayor cercanía. Respecto a las reuniones del banco comunal, comenta que también han sido un momento de distracción.  
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Abriendo Futuro” and has 18 enterprising members who are in different lines of work among which are candy sales, pastry making, new and used clothes sales, crafts and chopping wood for firewood.  They are all from the city of Temuco.

Johana is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the third row, first seat from left to right; her hair is pulled back.  She has been selling new clothes for the last two years.  Her sales are door to door among friends and acquaintances.  She also sells her wares in her living room when she gathers a group of customers together.  She buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood located in the city of Santiago.  She will use the loan to buy shoes and t-shirts for children.  Her goal is to expand the business to install herself in a fixed locale to display and sell her merchandise.  Her motivation to continue in business is that she wants to attain economic stability to provide a better quality of life for her family.  Johana lives with her mother and her two children who are 8 and 2 years old.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained from Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the she knew the other communal bank members previously so there’s closeness among them.  With respect to the communal bank meetings, she comments that they have been opportunities to pass the time pleasantly.

Temuco is the capita of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There is a series of lakeside resorts nearby (Pucón, Villarrica) and very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth pointing out that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous peoples of our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy sandals and t-shirts for children.

loans.name: Faye

texts.en:
Faye is 23 years old and married with two children. Faye owns & operates a business venture selling coconut products in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Faye needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 125 talas or US $88 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faye joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faye's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 24 years of age and married with three children. Carolina owns & operates a business venture baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. Carolina needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Carolina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Carolina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Pilar Del Rocio

texts.es:
Pilar de 51 años, una muy trabajadora que a pesar de ser madre soltera sabe como salir a delante con sus hijos.
Empezó su negocio de restaurante hace 2 años, gracias a  Dios ha ido creciendo hasta la fecha.
Su restaurante se inicia a las 8:00am hasta la finalización de sus comidas.
La dificultad de ella es el espacio de su local ya que es muy pequeño y eso incomoda a los clientes.
Ella solicita este préstamo para agrandar su negocio e invertir en víveres como aceites, papas, azúcar, cebollas.  
El sueño de ella es que su negocio cada día crezca más en la clientela y así poder ayudar a su mamá.
texts.en: Pilar, 51, is a very hardworking woman who despite being a single mother has known how to get ahead with her children.  She started her restaurant business two years ago and thanks to God it’s been growing to date.  She opens at 8am and continues until the food runs out.  Her difficulty is that space in her locale is small and that is uncomfortable for the customers.  She’s asking for this loan to enlarge the business and invest in foodstuffs like oil, potatoes, sugar and onions.  Her dream is that the business’ clientele grows every day so that she can help her mother.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions and sugar.

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en:
Tuloto is 41 years old and married with no children.

Tuloto owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting peanuts for sale. She has five years of experience in this business. Tuloto needs a loan of WST $2,200 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Tuloto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tuloto's sixth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Yaritza Yurie

texts.es:
Doña Yaritza, sigue creciendo en inventario, en su negocio como pulperia, ahora ah aumentado la venta de frutas y verduras, pues lleva varios años apoyando a su esposo en los gastos basicos del hogar, al obtener mejores ganancias, ya que el, no tiene un trabajo fijo, solo trabaja por contrato, sus dos pequeños siguen cursando el año escolar, el  menor ha estado un poco mal de salud, lo que ha tenido mas gastos al comprar medicina.
Atraves de estos financiamientos, ha logrado, la construcion de su porche, construccion de baños higienicos, y aumento de mercaderia para su pulperia. Con este nuevo prestamos sera para invertir en granos basicos como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, caja de jabon de lavar, bidon de aceite, productos de uso personal, productos lacteos, carne, pollo, gaseosa, siendo estos los mas demandado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yaritza continues adding inventory to her grocery store. Now she is expanding the fruit and vegetable section. It has taken some years to increase earnings with her husband helping in the basic household expenses. He does not have a steady job since he is a contract worker. Her two young children continue their course of studies with the youngest having been in bad health, which has meant more expenses in order to buy medicine.

Through the loans they have received they have built a porch and a sanitary bathroom, and they have added merchandise to their store. With this new loan she will buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, boxes of soap, a large container of oil, personal care products, dairy products, meat, chicken, and soda as these are the items that are most requested by their customers.

loans.use: to buy various products for her business which are requested by her clients which will help her maintain good sales performance

loans.name: Darwin Nain

texts.es:
Darwin de 28 años, un hombre trabajador que ha sabido cómo ganarse la vida.
Inicio su negocio hace dos años. El brinda el servicio de taxi amigo y haces expreso a personas específicas. Su actividad las inicias desde las 7:00am hasta las 12:00pm.
Su dificultad es la competencia y la delincuencia del país.
El solicita este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, la compra de llantas y accesorios como: radio, retrovisores.
Su sueño es terminar las construcción de su vivienda y sus aspiraciones es tener un buen vivir.
texts.en:
Darwin is a hard-working 28-year old who has done his best to earn a living.
