He began his business two years ago. He provides taxi services and serves as a driver for specific people. He begins work at 7:00 a.m. and works until 12:00 p.m.

His challenges are competition and the level of crime in the country. He applied for the loan for car maintenance. He will buy new tires and other items like rear-view mirrors and a radio. His dream is to finish building his home, and he aspires to have a good life.

loans.use: car maintenance and purchase tools for his taxi

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto is 34 years old, married and has four children.

Toto owns & operates a business venture selling poultry products in the local community.  She has five years of experience in this business. Toto needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Toto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toto's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Carmen Manuela

texts.es:
Carmen de 55 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Paijan, la cual pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Carmen desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos y gallos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener su pesoy tamaño ideal los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento a sus animales y realizar algunos arreglos en su casa, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y mejorar económicamente para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 55 years old, lives with her family in their own house. It has electricity and water service and is located in the urban zone of the district of Paijan, which belongs to the department of La Libertad. This zone is known for its agricultural and livestock-raising activities.

Carmen has raised and sold domestic birds (hens, turkeys, and roosters) for a number of years. Her poultry yard is located behind her house. It is roomy and accommodating, and she feeds them a balanced food and natural grains. Once they reach their ideal weight and size, she offers them for sale in different markets in the zone, and thus she obtains good earnings to pay the daily household expenses.

She has applied for a loan of 1000 PEN at Edpyme Alternativa to buy more food for her animals and to make some repairs in her house. With the income that she obtains she can cover her loan and improve the quality of life of her family. Carmen is a hard-working woman and is very responsible. The only thing that she wants is that her children aim higher and to improve economically so that she can offer them more advanced schooling.

loans.use: to buy more food for her animals and make some repairs inside her house.

loans.name: San Miguel Chuanoj Group

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria es casada, tiene 49 años D. edad, estudio sus estudios D. primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operaria y hasta ahora lleva 3 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría también.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra D. hilos D. diferentes cuales y colores para el tejido D. cortes típicos D. diferentes D. diferentes estilos y colores, espera en el futuro ver su negocio con operarios. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, tejeduría D. cortes típicos, tejido D. sabanas y a la talabartería.
texts.en:
Candelaria is married and is 49 years old. She has a primary school education. She has two children who are studying. She is a weaver. She started working as an operator and she now has 3 years of experience. He has help from her husband who also works in weaving. 

She decided to organize a group to request a loan in order to purchase thread of different types and colors for weaving that come in different styles and colors. In the future, she hopes to have a business with operators. The other members of the group are merchants, weavers of fabric and sheets and leather workers.

loans.use: purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, es casado, reside en su casa propia junto a su  familia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada  en la zona rural de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. También cría y vende aves de corral. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

José desea comprar fertilizantes y para  brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José, who is 41 years old, is married and lives with his family in his own house, which has electrical service and is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura. It is a district with agriculture, livestock-raising, and handicrafts.

He has some farmland where he usually plants lemon trees. He has several years of experience in this business and during this time he has learned a lot about the management of crops. He also raises and sells poultry. He uses the income that he receives from these activities to pay the daily expenses of his family.

José wants to buy fertilizers and maintain his land so that he can plant a new lemon plantation. In this way he will obtain a better harvest. To achieve his objective, he has seen the need to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his fields and to plant a new lemon plantation.

loans.name: Nestor Hildefonso

texts.es:
Nestor de 60 años de edad, es soltero, reside en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de San José del departamento de La Libertad.  Se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera, agrícola y ganadera.

Nestor se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros de San José a Pacasmayo y viceversa, una zona donde predomina la pesca. Para realizar su actividad cuenta con un carro y sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona donde vive. El ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su casa y personales.

El desea realizar mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos de su unidad móvil ya que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, con la finalidad que al tener su carro en buenas condiciones podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.  Nestor es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Nestor, who is 60 years old, is single. He lives in his own house, which has water and electricity and is located in the San José district of the La Libertad department. This area is characterized by fishing, agriculture, and raising livestock.

Nestor offers transportation services for cargo and passengers from San José to Pacasmayo and return, a zone dominated by fishing. To carry out his business activity, he has a car, and his principal customers are the residents of the zone where he lives. He has already been in this business for several years, and thanks to it he pays for his house and his personal expenses.

He wants to do some maintenance and replace some parts on his car, since it is presenting some mechanical problems. His goal is to have his car in good condition so that he will be able to offer better service to his customers. For this reason he believed it would be convenient to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN. Nestor is well-known and admired by his fellow workers. They consider him a responsible person with a great will to continue advancing himself.

loans.use: to maintain and replace some parts of his vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Ana Celia le está haciendo falta la elaboración de la barda al frente y también un portón. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder compra el material que es (cemento, arena, block y pagarle a la persona que va hacer el portón) por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejor a su vivienda. 
Doña Ana Celia es viuda y vive le preocupa la seguridad que tiene en su vivienda y que sus bienes no están seguros y protegidos cuando ella no se encuentra en casa. 
Con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en limpieza de casas particulares planea pagar el crédito  ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella.
texts.en:
Ana Celia’s house does not have a front yard fence or a gate. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy materials such as cement, sand, and blocks, and also money to pay the person making the gate because at this time she does not have the necessary money to make these improvements.

Ana Celia is a widow and worries about the security of her house and about her belongings which are not safe and secure when she is away from the house.

She plans to repay the loan from her income that she receives from cleaning private homes which is her source of income.

loans.use: to build a fence and gate around the front of the house

loans.name: Fabiana Fidelina

texts.es:
Fabiana de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Fabiana desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento  ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimento para engordar a sus animales y así venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Fabiana es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder brindarle algunas comodidades a su familia y que logren sus metas propuestas sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fabiana is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own house, which does not have basic services. It is located in the rural district of Tambogrande that belongs to the department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Fabiana has for some years been breeding and selling sheep and poultry. The poultry are kept in the back of her house, which is roomy. The animals are fed a balanced diet of grains and natural pasture, until they reach the ideal size. She then sells them in various markets in the area and thus earns a good income to pay the family expenses.

She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 800 soles in order to buy food to fatten her animals so she can sell them to her customers at a better price. The earnings will allow her to pay the loan and to improve her quality of life. Fabiana is a person who works hard and all she wants is to be able to give some creature comforts to her family and meet some needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fodder to fatten her animals

loans.name: Fredesvinda Felicitas

texts.es:
Fredesvinda D. 49 años D. edad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca, agricultura y turismo.

DesD. hace varios años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en las afueras del mercado en donD. ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar susobligaciones familiares.

Fredesvinda observa que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente desD. un principio. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería como productos D. consumo diario y abarrotes en general.  Va a comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades lo que ayuda en bajar el precio que paga. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2,000 nuevos soles. Fredesvinda es muy trabajadora y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home, which has electric and water. It is located in the Pacasmayo district in the La Libertad department. This area is devoted to fishing, farming and tourism. 

For a number of years she had her own business which she ran in the market. There she offered her customers groceries and all of the products of prime necessity. Due to her established clientele and her earnings she will be able to cover her family expenses.

Fredesvinda notices that her business has been growing favorably since it began.  She wants to continue growing her business and to buy more merchandise such as staple products and general groceries.  She is going to buy these products in large quantities which will help her in lowing the price that she pays. 

This is why she is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Fredesvinda is a very hard worker and responsible.  She hopes to obtain a greater income in order to continue advancing her family.

loans.use: to buy more staple products and general groceries for her business.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de La Libertad.

Jesús brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior (máximo 3 personas), la actividad que realiza lo hace durante todo el día hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de la competencia en el rubro trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para usarlo en el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos accesorios para su mototaxi. Necesita mantener sus moto en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús is 46 years old and lives with his family in their own home. They receive running water and electricity services. Jesús resides in the District of Paijan, a farming and ranching district that is located in the Department of La Libertad.

Jesús provides transportation services using a motorcycle taxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for transporting passengers (a maximum capacity of 3 people). He works all day until 6pm. Despite the competition in this type of business, he is able to generate the required income to meet the needs of his family.

Jesús is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2000 PEN to use for maintenance and to replace a few accessories on his motorcycle taxi. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue providing excellent service to his customers. With the help of this loan, he expects to increase his income and continue supporting his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and to replace a few accessories on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La Sra. Aurelia es  una  persona trabajadora  y  muy responsable, que   se  preocupa  por  el acondicionamiento  de  su  vivienda,  en esta ocasión  ella  y su  distinguido esposo  desean  realizar  la construcción de  una   barda  en su  domicilio,  ve en el  crédito al posibilidad  de  ofrecer a  su  familia una  excelente  calidad de  vida  contando con la posibilidad  de  tener   mayor  seguridad en su  domicilio,  agradece el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurelia is a hardworking and responsible person. She is concerned about the condition of her home. On this occasion, she and her distinguished husband want to build a security wall around their home. She sees this loan as a possibility of offering her family an excellent quality of life and greater security for her home.

Aurelia is grateful for the support that has been provided so that she can complete this project.

loans.use: to build a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Ana Micaela

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes, la calidez de su gente, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos que la hacen una ciudad especial y quien la vista se enamora de ella.

Doña Ana tiene 52 años, es casada y no tiene hijos. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi que es de su propiedad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ana es de profesión costurera, esta actividad aprendió estudiando y lleva 30 años con su negocio, ella trabaja en su casa y  realiza todo tipo de prendas de vestir o arreglo de las mismas.
 
En el banco comunal es socia hace 12 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, cierres, botones y otros materiales de costura para realizar sus prendas de vestir.

Su meta es  tener un taller grande con operarios.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “La Paz”. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful scenery, the warmth of its people, and its culture and traditions. All of these elements make it a special city and people enjoy visiting it.

Doña Ana is 52 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is a chauffeur by profession and drives a taxi that he owns. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Ana is a professional seamstress. She learned this trade as part of her studies and now has been in business for 30 years. Ana works at home and produces all types of clothes. She also does alterations.

In her Communal Bank, she has been a member for 12 years. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of fabrics, zippers, buttons, and other sewing materials so that she can produce more clothes. Her goal is to have a large workshop with employees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: María Delfina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes, la calidez de su gente, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos que la hacen una ciudad especial y quien la vista se enamora de ella.

Doña María tiene 49 años, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 33, 26, 23, 18, 6 de edad, todos son solteros sus cuatro hijos mayores de edad trabajan solventándose sus gastos personales y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de granos secos como: frejol, lenteja, arveja, habas, etc. Esta actividad la realiza hace 25 años, no tiene un puesto fijo por lo que vende recorriendo la ciudad y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su veinteavo crédito, este lo va a invertir en la compra de granos secos como: frejol, habas, lentejas, arvejas, etc. para la venta.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “La Paz”. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful scenery, the warmth of its people, and its culture and traditions. All of these elements make it a special city and people enjoy visiting it.

Doña María is 49 years old, separated from her husband, and has five children (ages 33, 26, 23, 18, and 6). All of them are single, but four of them are adults who work in order to cover their personal expenses. Her youngest child attends a school in the city. She does not own a home, so she lives in a rental property.

Sra. María sells dry goods such as kidney beans, lentils, peas, broad beans, and other products. She has been in this business for 25 years. María does not have a fixed location, so she sells by traveling throughout the city. She works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule.

In her Communal Bank, María is receiving her 20th loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of dry goods such as kidney beans, broad beans, lentils, peas, and other products to sell. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy kidney beans, broad beans, lentils, peas, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Dolores Esmeralda

texts.es:
La Señora. Dolores es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes, la calidez de su gente, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos que la hacen una ciudad especial y quien la vista se enamora de ella.

Doña Dolores tiene 45 años, es soltera y ha concebido 5 hijos de 34, 29, 26, 22 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su cuarto hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales y también ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su último hijo estudia en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Dolores tiene un local donde vende comida, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo de 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para preparar la comida.
 
Su meta es agrandar su local.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the communal bank La Paz.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful scenery, the warmth of its people, and the culture and traditions of its towns that make it a special city, one that you fall in love with when you see it.

Dolores is 45 years old, single, and has 5 children aged 34, 29, 26, 22 and 11 years.  Her oldest three children are married and independent.  Her 22 year-old works and pays for his personal expenses and also helps with the household expenses, and her youngest is in school.  She does not own her own home, so she lives in a rented dwelling.

Dolores has a place where she sells food.  She has been in this business for a year, and she works every day from 7am until 7 at night.  

This is the 3rd loan that she has taken through her communal bank, and she will invest this money in the purchase of foodstuffs to use in preparing her dishes.

Her goal is to enlarge her business premises.

loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Rito

texts.es: El Sr. Rito es un hombre que  gracias  a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a  salido  adelante  día  con día, gracias  a su esfuerzo a  lagrado  adquirir   su  vivienda y   continuar   brindándoles   a  sus  hijos  una excelente   estabilidad  económica,  en   esta ocasión  el esta   muy contento  de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que  en este  momento como   apenas  inicia   el periodo  escolar  requiere   realizar  la compra de uniformes  y útiles  escolares  para  que  sus  pequeños  hijos  continúen con el estudio  ya que  esta es  la mejor  herencia  que  les  puede   brindar, en esta  ocasión sus  hijos   no pudieron  salir   en la   fotografía   por   el  horario  que   ellos  tienen  en su  escuela.
texts.en:
Rito is a man who, thanks to his effort and dedication, has gotten ahead day by day.  Thanks to his effort he has managed to acquire his home and continue giving his children excellent economic stability.

Right now he is very happy that he has found us, since currently the school year is beginning and he needs to buy uniforms and school supplies so his little children will continue with their studies.  This is the best legacy he can offer them.

His children couldn't be in this photograph because of their school schedule.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and supplies.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive por la comunidad Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales también labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora que laboran día a día para salir adelante.

La Señora María tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 18, 17 y 12 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo para sacar adelante a su familia, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa cría y vende animales como cuyes y gallinas.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para iniciar con esta actividad. 

Su meta es tener  más variedad de animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Yanaturo.  She lives in the community of Yanaturo in the city of Cuenca, a place where the people work in agriculture, raise animals, and also work in the city in a variety of occupations.  The people of this place are friendly, courteous and hardworking, and they work each day in order to get ahead.

Maria is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children who were born into the marriage.  Her children are 19, 18, 17 and 12, and they are all in school in the city.  Her husband is outside the country; he has migrated in order to seek better work opportunities to provide for his family.  The family lives in their own home.

Maria devotes her time to caring for her children and she also has a business at her house raising animals to sell such as guinea pigs and hens.

She is taking her 3rd loan through her communal bank, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs to raise.

Her goal is to have a greater variety of animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married with three children. Juanita is 47 years old and she lives in Pulang Yuta, Kapatagan Lanao Del Norte.

Juanita sells coconuts to earn a living and has had this business for about 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 12,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase fertilizers. Juanita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Juanita hopes to progress her business for the future of her children and she hopes to buy a motorcycle for business transport purposes.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive por la comunidad  Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales también labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora que laboran día a día para salir en adelante.

Doña María tiene de 65 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija que es casada e independiente. Su esposo realiza trabajos de carpintería en su casa, la casa en donde viven es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio y trabajo en su juventud.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y a la cría  y venta de animales pequeños como cuyes y pollos.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hija,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para los mismos para continuar con su negocio.

Su sueño es conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Yanaturo. She lives in the community of Yanaturo in the city of Cuenca, a place where the people work in agriculture, raise animals, and also work in the city in a variety of occupations. The people of this place are friendly, courteous and hardworking, and they work each day in order to get ahead.

Maria is 65 years old, married, and has a daughter who is married and independent.   Her husband has a carpentry business in their home.  They own their own home, as a result of the sacrifices and hard work of their youth.

Maria devotes her time to doing household chores, and she also has a business raising small animals to sell such as guinea pigs and chickens.

This is the first loan that she has taken through her communal bank, which she joined at the invitation of her daughter.  She will invest the loan proceeds in the purchase of chickens and poultry feed to continue with her business.

Her dream is to be able to remain in good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Zoila Targelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive por la comunidad  Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales también labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora que laboran día a día para salir en adelante.

Doña Zoila tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 17, 14 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad, dos están en colegio  y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano y labora en el arte de la joyería, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Zoila es  Auxiliar de Enfermería hace  20 años, trabaja en esta actividad de lunes a sábados en horarios rotativos. También en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa, lleva 4 años en esta actividad.

En el banco comunal es socia hace dos años y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y joyas para tener más surtida su mercadería para sus clientes. 

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Señora Zoila is a member of the communal bank Yanaturo. She lives is the Yanaturo community in the city of Cuenca, a place where the people work in agriculture, raise animals, and also work in the city in different economic activities. The people are kind, gentle, and hardworking and work day after day to advance themselves.

Doña Zoila is 40 years old. She is married and has four children, ages 19, 17, 14, and 7. Her oldest daughter studies at the university, two are in secondary school, and her youngest son goes to a little city school. Her husband is a craftsman and works in jewelry. The house they live in is their own.

Señora Zoila has been a nursing assistant for 20 years. She works from Monday to Saturday with rotating hours. In her free time she sells jewelry and clothing; she has been doing this for 4 years.

She has been a member of the communal bank for two and a half years, and she is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of clothing and jewelry to have a bigger stock of merchandise to offer her customers.

Her goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Purisimo

texts.en:
Purisimo is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Purisimo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Purisimo has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Purisimo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheang, 39, is married with six children who are single and live together with her. Some of her children work in a garment factory located in Kampong Chhnang province. They do not have their own motorcycle to use to travel to work. That is why they have to spend money for daily transportation fees. Mrs. Chheang is in the business of selling mixed products in her community. She sells items like groceries, sweets, canned food, packed food and other kinds. She usually earns around $2 USD per day from this business.

Mrs. Chheang has requested some funds from Kiva through HKL to support her children by buying a second motorcycle for them to use to travel to work. This loan will help reduce the expenses of transportation for the family and improve her living conditions.

In the future, Mrs. Chheang hopes to expand her store because many items are sold out.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for her children

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Rosa has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy products from AVON & NATASHA to sell.

Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products from AVON & NATASHA to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Marites has a retail shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells spices & vegetables like okra, eggplant & squash. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
Expedito is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Expedito has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, detergents, and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Expedito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Expedito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Lorecil

texts.en:
Lorecil is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Lorecil has a retail shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Lorecil is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lorecil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Raquel has a retail shop that sells clothing like blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Raquel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Junerick

texts.en:
Junerick is single. He is 30 years old and lives in Pulang Yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte. Junerick owns and manages a motorcycle shop to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month he earns 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase motorcycle repair equipment like compressor. Behind, is his shop.

Junerick has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Junerick hope to improve and expand his small shop to help his family to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and for repair equipment

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun is a resident of Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, where people depend on agribusiness for most of their incomes. Mrs. Bun and her husband have been engaged in agriculture for years. Together they are able to earn approximately $5USD per day through farming. Now they are blessed with two children, both of whom are young and live under her care.

Mrs. Bun is looking for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to purchase a motorcycle for use by the family without hiring any motorcycle services. This loan will make her family's life more comfortable.

In the future Mrs. Bun wishes to have a plowing machine for growing her rice crops and to send her children to study in a local school. She would like to say thanks to all lenders that always kindly help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for using in the family.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Evangeline has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evangeline is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jessica has a retail shop that sells fruits like ponkans, mangoes & oranges. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

Jessica is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with seven children. 

Leoncia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Leoncia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leoncia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Riza works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling shells  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Riza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase shells to sell for her buying and selling of shells business.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase shells to sell.

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jeanelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jeanelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeanelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nydia

texts.en:
Nydia is 58 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nydia has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from running a junk shop.

Nydia aspires to save enough money to buy a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for transport.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 61 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling herbal medicines in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for a year and also earns an income from networking & rice retailing.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia is 50 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anelia has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Haydee is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Haydee has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

Haydee has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Haydee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Roel has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Roel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business of selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Teresita is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her stall.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Vicky has a retail shop that sells used clothing like shirts and blouses. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

Vicky is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Vicky hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 59 years old and married with one child. Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requests a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lucena has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lucena would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Ma. Sol is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of products to sell.

Ma. Sol has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from a restaurant, entertainment (videoke), and ready-to-wear store.

Ma. Sol aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of products to sell.

loans.name: Joner

texts.en:
Joner is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Joner has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages.

Joner has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joner hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads, and beverages.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. They live in her father’s house. Dornod borders the Russian boundary, and Batchimeg makes sales of livestock meat between Russians and Mongolian customers. She and her husband drive around and buy meat from suppliers in the countryside for lower prices. She has been running this business for many years and they have a lot of loyal customers, which make the business mutually efficient. 

A month ago she decided to start a new direction of her sales, selling things such as handmade leather shoes. She has made an order of Mongolian handmade leather shoes from suppliers in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. She is going to sell them to Russian customers at a reasonable price. Since the winter is coming this kind of trading is gainful. She is requesting a loan to cover the fee of her order in advance. It is very important to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to cover the fee of her order of handmade leather shoes.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores, a 49-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past seven years. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nonima

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Nonima works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Nonima is borrowing 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nonima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her fishing/fish vending business. Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening and motorcycle transport.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is married with one child. Jimmy is 31 years of age and he lives in Pulang Yuta, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte.

Jimmy sells coconuts to earn a living, and he has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type  of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. 

Jimmy has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jimmy hope to improve and expand his small business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Felipe is making and peddling snacks like siopao (steamed bun with meat filling). He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Felipe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Felipe hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines.

Dyna requested a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more materials for her videoke rentals. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

In the future, Dyna would like to save enough so she could afford to send her child to school and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her videoke business.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rovelyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an electronic reloading and sari-sari (variety) store. Rovelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Edna would like to save enough so that she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. She would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of products to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 38 years old and two of her children are in school.

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Erlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is married with two children. Cristita is 34 years old and she lives in Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. Cristita sells rice to earn a living and had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock of rice.

Cristita  has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Cristita hope to progress her small business as well as having a store to display her stock.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a sociable tailor in her community. She is well known and skillful in making clothes. She has been in this business for 11 years with many customers who come to her shop for sewing or making their clothes every day. She normally earns an average of $2.50 USD per day from her work. 

Mrs. Sam wants to fix her house, partially because it’s too narrow for a big family to live in. In addition, during the rainy season, drops of rain are blown into her house through gaps by the wind. 

Mrs. Sam would like to request some funds from Kiva, a partner of HKL, to fix her present house. In the future, she hopes that she’ll be able to expand her sewing business and rebuild a new house made of brick.

loans.use: to fix her present house.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 32 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eufemia has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Eufemia has been in this business for three years. Eufemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, eggs, noodles, junk foods and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Floramil

texts.en:
Floramil is 37 years old and widowed with three children. With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Floramil runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Floramil would like to save enough for her to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 30 years old and married with four children. With all of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, and other groceries. 

Glenda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married and runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines where she works very hard to provide for her family. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for four years and would like to save enough money  to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en: Jenelie is 24 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard at her fishing business and is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy new equipment. She has been in this line of work for five years and would like to save enough money to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is married and with 4 children.  Edmund is 57 years of age and lives in Acad Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. 

Edmund owns and operates a business project in the agricultural sector planting and harvesting coconut for sale. He sell coconut to his contract buyer to earn a living and had this business for about 5 years. Each month, he earns PHP 13,500 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 35,000 to purchase coconut farm fertilizer and other farm equipment.During harvest time he requested his neighbors to help him and he compensate them.

Edmund  has been a member of GDMPC for one year. This is the first cycle of loan taken from the cooperative. In the future, Edmund hopes to improve and expand his business so that he can help his children to have a brighter future and plan to buy another coconut farm.

loans.use: to purchased coconut farm fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old, married, has three children and works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. In addition to her store, she also earns income from karaoke rentals. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lebina

texts.en: Lebina is 42 years old, married and the mother of five children, three of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has worked very hard at her business, which is making baskets. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy the materials she needs to make more baskets. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more baskets.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie is married and has for the last 10 years worked very hard to support her family by selling various food items that she makes herself. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she needs to make food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and widowed with 1 child. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Lilia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with 11 children, two of whom are in school. She is 48 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maria has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oils, vapor rubs, soaps, lotions and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mamerta has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Mamerta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. Maricel has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 57 years old and is married with 2 children. Diana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 3 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past to sustain the business.

Diana requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

In the future, Diana would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and married with six children. Conchita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in the store.

Conchita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, soft drinks, beverages and various groceries. 

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in the store

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, Mrs. Va is a 37-year-old married woman who has been working in agricultural work. Her husband, Mr. Horn, also works alongside her on their farmland. They grow rice crops and some kinds of beans both in the rainy season and in the dry season. Together, this couple can earn about $5USD each day, used for managing their household expenses and supporting their children to go to school. 

Mrs. Va has asked for a loan from Kiva to purchase crop sprayings and mineral fertilizers in order to make her plants grow well. For her future prospects, she hopes to improve her farming business and she dreams of having various agricultural materials like a plowing machine and a pumping machine as well.

loans.use: to purchase crop sprayings and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is widowed with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bonifacio is 52 years old and has two children who are in school.

Bonifacio has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Bonifacio has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, 52 years old, is a grocery seller at home, and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a driver and earns $5 per day. They have five children, two are studying and the other three are working, earning $2 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell. This loan can help her to buy different kinds of goods to sell that can make more income. She wants to extend her grocery shop when she has enough money. For her children, she wants to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany, 39 years old, is a house wife. Her husband is a chief construction worker and earns $10 per day. They have five children, three are studying and two are too young to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. Before, she used to do construction with her husband, but she quit because she has babies and her husband wants her to stay home take care the children. She wants to buy more construction equipment and material for her husbands work so that he can provide better service to the customers.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is 48-years-old, and a grocery seller. She is a widow and has one daughter. They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Sarantuya has been running a grocery store since 2008 in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. She is a very hardworking woman and always tries to support her family and relatives. 

Recently her cousin has opened the same sort of grocery store in another district. He needs financial support to obtain the commodities for his store for the first time. As we know creating working capital is absolutely important to this kind of business. Therefore Sarantuya is taking a loan to support her cousin to purchase the food commodities for his new grocery store.

loans.use: To support her cousin to purchase the food commodities for his new grocery store

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 41, married, and has three school-age children. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village. Due to financial difficulty, she is engaged in selling fresh meat and pork sausages in the market to supplement her husbands income. Since their children are now in secondary and tertiary level school, they need to earn more income to support their education. Despite the hardships of life she and her husband are striving hard to earn income, for they want their children to become professional someday.

She aims to improve the business but she has inadequate capital, therefore, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fresh meat and longganiza (pork sausages) to sell in the market. She hopes that the loan will contribute a lot to the improvement of the business.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat and longganiza (pork sausage) to sell in the market

loans.name: Rorng

texts.en:
Rorng, 44 years old, feeds and sells animals for a living of $3 per day. Her husband buys and resell cattle for $5 per day. The couple has 10 children.  Three of the children are in school, 4 are too young to go to school, and the other three are working, each earning $4 per day. 

Every month, Rorng has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use as he travels to sell cattle and for other usage by the family. 

Rorng wants to buy more pigs to feed and sell when she can save more money.  She also wants to help her children to study to a sufficient level that they can find good jobs to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to sell cattle

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
This is Lennie, 46, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Geraldo, a tricycle driver, and is the mother of three children. By the grace of God, Lennie has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Lennie oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Lennie earns a living through the daily quota that her husband remits each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Lennie also offers direct selling products for added income. She earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lennie dreams of being able to buy another tricycle soon and of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Nen is a cake seller and earns about $3 per day. Her husband buys and sells cattle and earns about $5 per day. She lives with only her husband and one grandson because all of her children got jobs to do and they left home. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $13 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy cattle for resale. This loan can help her husband to continue his career. She hopes her career of selling cakes will get good profit forever.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
This is Sherly, 33, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Felix, a construction worker, and is a mother to her only child. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sherly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She  earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sherly hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoos, soaps, canned goods, breads, junk foods, candies, soft drinks and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a widow and 32 years old with 3 children.

Annie owns and operates a business venture, selling chips.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Annie needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her loan to improve the business.

In 2009, Annie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Annie's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель города Исфара. Ему 33 года. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Он имеет среднее образование. Илхом занимается изготовлением мебели. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для приобретения сырья, то есть для приобретения досок, ДСП, ДВП, краски и других необходимых вещей для изготовления.
texts.en: Ilhom is a resident of the town of Isfara. He is 33 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. He has secondary education. Ilhom makes furniture. He has been in this business for three years. He is taking out the loan to buy raw materials such as boards, CPD, fibreboard, paint and other necessary things for production.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 37 years old and lives in the village of Cabisera 9-11 of the province of Isabela. She is married to Jimmy who works as a furniture laborer in their village. Their eldest child is Leggie Boy, who is 19 years old. He did not pursue continuing his studies in college because he was not at all interested. Their youngest child is Gelvin, who is 18 years old and presently studying in high school. Levi wants both of them to finish their studies in college. She is trying to convince her elder son to pursue his studies, and she hopes that someday they will both have a complete education.

Levi is requesting a loan amounting to PHP21,000 to use as additional business capital in her tailoring business. She wants her business to expand and become more productive in order to improve their standard of living. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved so that she can generate more income. That would greatly benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy needles, textiles and other supplies needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Soe

texts.en:
Mrs. Soe, 52, is a goal oriented and industrious farmer who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Thom province. She is married with five children. Most of them are married and live away. Soe owns two hectares of farmland which she has used to plant some kinds of potato crops. She typically makes a profit of around $1.50 each day from her business. She also depends on the income from her husband who hauls and sells firewood around the community. 

Soe intends to increase their income by raising some piglets behind her house. However, she doesn’t have any capital to buy them. Therefore, she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some pigs for raising, and also to buy a few sacks of pig feed. 

In the future, she hopes she will be able to achieve a quality of life through her efforts and secure the family away from the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for raising and also buy a few sacks of pig feed.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, 42 years old, is a garment factory worker and earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver earns about $4 per day. They have only one child, and he is 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on transportation and $13 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a Tok Tok (motorcycle) for her husband's career. Her husband wants to change his career of being a motor taxi driver to being a Tok Tok driver because it can make better income. She wants to quit working in the factory and wants to sell food and drinks in front her factory, because she saw that others can make a good income from selling food.

loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok for her husband's career.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.en:
Malia Paula is married, 53 years old, and has 10 children. She owns and operates a business venture of planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve the business.

In 2010, Malia Paula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 48, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ordialyn, a jeepney driver, and is a mother to their two children. Both children already have their own families. She, together with her husband, is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Avelina oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which pays boundary (daily quota) each day. Aside from this she also manages a small variety store in her place. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina hopes to add another Jeepney unit someday and hopes for a better future for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese.
