Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

In 2009, Maliumai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.name: Efaraima

texts.en:
Efaraima is 28 years old and he's single. Efaraima owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. He has two years of experience in this business. Efaraima needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.He plans to use the profit from his business (estimated to be 260 talas or $108 per week) to improve and expand his business.

In 2010, Efaraima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Efaraima's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Talifaia

texts.en:
Talifaia is 50 years old and is married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture selling ice-cake. She has three years of experience in this business. Talifaia needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Talifaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Talifaia's third loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is), and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from a university.

loans.name: Pet

texts.en: Pet, 42 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a single mother with three children. One of her children is studying and the other two are working in the factory, earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $27 on food, $5 on electricity, $7 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $250 to buy pigs to feed and sell. This loan would help her to have enough money to buy pigs to feed so she can earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, candies, soaps and toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
This is Annalie, age 26. She is a resident of Pasay City in the Philippines. She is married to Jose, a driver, and is the mother of their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annalie operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do research and complete their papers. Annalie rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annalie hopes to have another shop in their area and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed for her computer shop business.

She needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 210 talas or $88 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Eve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is married to Abner, who works as a government employee. She is 46 years old and is blessed with three children. Haydee, her eldest, is currently living in Jordan and working as a factory worker. Hayleen is a fourth-year college student. Absel, the youngest, is also in college. Sending them to college is very costly. Celia hopes that her children will finish their studies with her financial support. 

To help her husband in providing for the growing needs of their children, she began selling beauty soaps and other products like detergents, gas stove and umbrella. She sells her products to the people from her community.

Aside from her retailing business, she also maintains a hog-raising business. 

To further grow both of her businesses, Celia is requesting a loan of Php 28,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to purchase stocks of beauty soap, lotion, gas stove and silver wares to sell.

She hopes that someday her business will expand to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beauty soap, lotion, gas stove and silver ware to sell

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru: Абдуразок житель города Худжанд. Ему 25 лет. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Абдуразок работает в пекарне, он в основном печет лепешки. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. На сегодняшний день он купил столовую и ему необходимо получить кредит для расширения деятельности. Поэтому он берет кредит для проведения ремонта, приобретения мебели и покупки посуды.
texts.en: Abdurazok lives in the town of Khujand.  He is 25 years old, single and lives together with his parents.  Abdurazok works at a bakery and primarily bakes flatbread.  He has been involved in this business for two years.  He recently bought a cafe and needs to obtain a loan in order to expand his business.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs, purchase furniture and dishware.

loans.use: to make repairs, purchase furniture and dishware

loans.name: Gulomchon

texts.ru: Гуломчон  Миникулов умный, целеустремленный человек. 6 лет он занимается  автоперевозкой. Он  примерный семьянин, женат, у него 4 детей. Гуломчон  перевозит товары с одного региона на другой. Эта деятельность приносит  хорошую прибыль семейному бюджету. Гуломчон хочет получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для приобретения запчастей машины, эта покупка поможет в получении большей прибыли и принесет пользу населению для качественной перевозки товаров. Гуломчон надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Gulomchon is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in auto transportation for six years.  He is an exemplary family man, married and has four children.  Gulomchon transports goods from one region to another.  This business yields a good profit for the family budget.  Gulomchon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of spare auto parts.  This purchase would help with making a big profit and would be useful for residents when it comes to quality goods transportation.  Gulomchon hopes that you will support him and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Asoono

texts.en:
Asoono is 40 years old and married with 1 child. She owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Asoono needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Asoono joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are attending school.  Ven is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and beans. She has been involved in this business for 19 years. After her crops mature, she retails them in a local market at a reasonable price. She usually earns approximately $1.60 each day. 

In order to sustain her business, Ven is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase crop seeds and fertilizers and make a payment for rental land. With the increase in her income, she would like to save money to expand her business and support her children until they graduate high school.

loans.use: to purchase crop seeds and fertilizers and make a payment for rental land.

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
SIlika is married and she is 34 years old with 3 children. Silika owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting cocoa for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Silika needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Silika joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Faatiu

texts.en:
Faatiu is 18 years of age and married with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve the business.

In 2010, Faatiu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en:
Tagisia, a 34-year-old married mother of one, has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale for the last three years. Having joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services, Tagisia is requesting her first loan for WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand it.

Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score."" For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. "

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 53, married and has four adult children. As a responsible father, he works hard and strives harder to support his family. As a fruit of their patience and sacrifices, three of their children have already graduated from college while the youngest is still in college. To earn additional income, Marlon is engaged in cooking and selling food for snacks and meals. He has been operating this business for almost two years now and usually earns a profit of P7,000 a month which they utilize for their food and allowances for their child in college.

Marlon wants to ask for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the food stall. He mentioned that this loan will help a lot to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the food stall.

loans.name: Saidchafar

texts.ru: Саидчафар житель района Шахритус. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Саидчафар зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Saidchafar lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 45 years old, married and has six children.  His son is working in the Russian Federation.  Saidchafar earns a living by breeding cattle and small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.   He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old, married, and has one child.She is engaged in a retailing business selling goods for daily consumption. She says she opens her store at 5 o'clock in the morning due to many customers going to  their fields. She is grateful because she has a loving husband who has always supported her. Her husband has been a farmer and tricycle driver. The generated income of the couple has been used in buying a refrigerator, in payment for motorcycle transport, daily needs and the allowance of her child.

Teresa had added products such as frozen foods and raw meat to her store because their village is far from the market. She has been buying her products wholesale to minimize her expenses going to and from the market. Nowadays, she suffers from shortage of funds due to some who have shopped on credit in her neighborhood. For these reasons, she requests additional capital in the amount of P30,000 to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soups, canned goods, cooking ingredients and shampoo needed in her general store. She is happy to get the loan and promises to make her repayments on time. She is hoping that she can expand her store and give her child a better future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soups, canned goods, cooking ingredients and shampoo for her general store.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Mrs. Suos comes from Kompong Chhnang province where she depends on agriculture for most of her income. Mrs. Suos is married with six children. It is quite a big family and hard for her to support them. Presently two of her daughters are working as house cleaners in a neighbor country. Mrs. Suos does not want her daughters to work far away from home, but due to the lack of finances, they are forced to work there. 

Besides farming, Mrs. Suos spends her spare time collecting palm fronds around the village, and then she attaches the leaves together for sale. This kind of product can be used for roofing. She can earn around $2 USD each day. Mrs. Suos has applied for a loan from Kiva, a partner of HKL, to buy mineral fertilizers to keep her rice crop healthy. With the remaining funds, she will buy some construction materials for her husband who works as a construction worker. With the anticipated profit she will make, she plans to fix her house partially.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and some construction materials.

loans.name: Boir

texts.ru: Боир семянин, на воспитании имеет одного сына. Более 16 лет он занимается пчеловодством, производством меда по наследству, также он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов, такие как арбуз, дыня, морковь и т.д. и бахчевых на собственной земле площадью 2,5 га. Займ он хочет получить для приобретения крупного рогатого скота и нужных товаров для  пчеловодства.
texts.en: Boir is a family man, who is raising one son.  For over 16 years, Boir has been involved in beekeeping, inherited honey production and also growing agricultural products, such as watermelons, cantaloupe, carrots, etc. and melons on his own land of 2.5 hectares.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle and necessary goods for beekeeping.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and ncessary goods for beekeeping

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он шафер. Фуркат более пяти лет предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Furkat lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 44 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary-specialized education.  He is a driver.  Furkat has been providing a taxi service for five years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car and provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, oxygen, and paint to be used in the repair shop.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru:
Фарогат мать четверых детей. Трое из них являются несовершеннолетними. Муж плотник.
Для содержания семьи она занимается торговлей хлопчатобумажных тканей и одеял уже более 20 лет. Фарогат работает без выходных и в бизнесе ей помогает ее старший сын. Она привозит товар из города Худжанда 3 раза в месяц. В будущем она желает расширить свой бизнес и открыть вторую точку бизнеса для своего сына. Займ запрашивает для покупки строительных материалов, так как она хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Farogat is a mother of four children, three of whom are adolescents.  Her husband is a carpenter.  In order to provide for her family, Farogat has been involved in selling cotton fabrics for over 20 years.  She works without days off, and her oldest son helps her with the business.  She brings merchandise from the town of Khujand three times per month.  In the future, Farogat wants to expand her business and open a second retail outlet for her son.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of construction materials because she wants to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house

loans.name: Buena Flor

texts.en:
Buena Flor is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Buena Flor has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Buena Flor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Buena Flor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to stock and sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, who lives in the mountainous village of Rizaluna, is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of the family. Cristina's husband has been operating their motorcycle transport for almost ten years, while Cristina owns a sari-sari (variety) store in the area.

Cristina is now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy stocks of groceries for the store and sprockets for the motorcycle, unable to purchase these goods from savings that have been eroded due to the high cost of basic commodities and an abrupt increase in their household expenses. The resulting additional profits will enable her to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy sprockets for the motorcycle and groceries  for her store.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Candelaria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. Candelaria has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Candelaria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Felisa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. Felisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Felisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Munochot

texts.ru: Муночот разведенная. На воспитании имеет двоих несовершеннолетних детей. Семью она кормит выручкой с продажи на рынке верхней женской одежды. Раньше Муночот помогала маме и после того как она развелась с мужем и осталось одна с двумя детьми она решила начать свой собственный бизнес. Она работает с “Имон интернешнл ” более 6 лет и имеет отличную кредитную историю. Так как наступает зима, она хочет увеличить ассортимент своих товаров за счет, полученного займа. Приобретение новых товаров поможет Муночот в получении хорошей прибыли от выручки.
texts.en: Munochot is divorced.  She is raising two adolescent children.  She supports her family with the profits from the sales of women's outerwear at the market.  Previously, Munochot helped her mother, but after she got divorced from her husband and was left with two children, she decided to start her own business.  She has been working with "Imon International" for over six years and has an excellent credit history.  Due to the onset of winter, Munochot wants to expand the assortment of her merchandise by using this loan.  Buying new merchandise will help Munochot with making a good profit from the sales.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Dorie

texts.en: Dorie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has one child. Dorie has a beauty shop that provides haircuts, pedicures and manicures. She has had this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for her beauty salon. Dorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Dorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жительница города Куляб. Ей 32 года. У нее двое детей. Она одна воспитывает своих детей. Образование у нее среднее. Она шесть лет как занимается торговлей. Замира арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает детскую одежду. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара. Поэтому берет кредит для покупки детских шапок, теплых костюмчиков, футболок и еще осеней обуви.
texts.en: Zamira lives in the town of Kulob.  She is 32 years old and has two children, whom she is raising by herself.  She has a secondary education.  Zamira has been involved in retails sales for six years.  She leases a retail outlet at the market, where she sells children's clothing.  She wants to expand the assortment of her merchandise.  This is why Zamira is requesting a loan to buy children's hats, warm suits, tea-shirts and also autumn shoes.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. Josephine has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for three years. She requests a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy green and yellow bananas to sell. Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Helen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо вдова. Ее дети совершеннолетние, имеет внуков. Ей 61 года. Несмотря на это она занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота и торговлей сухофруктов на протяжении восемнадцати лет. В бизнесе ей помогает сыновья и внуки. Полученный займ она хочет потратить на приобретение крупного рогатого скота и закупу сухофруктов.
texts.en: Markhabo is a widow. Her children are adults and she has grandchildren. She is 61 years old. Despite this she has a business feeding large horned cattle and selling dried fruits for eighteen years. Her sons and grandsons help her in this business. She wants to use the received loan to buy large horned cattle and dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle and dried fruits.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Julieta has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for two years. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en:
Handsuren is 57 and lives with her husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. She has three kids who all live separately. Her husband runs a taxi business with his own Russian SUV. She operates a used clothes business. She was a school teacher from 1990-1998, sold second-hand clothes from 2008-2009, and from 2009-2011 a photographer. She got back into the second-hand clothes business recently, which was the one she had the most experience with and  the most profitable. 

Handsuren is a strong and diligent woman who says, "It was challenging to raise three kids (with college degrees) and it is time to use my money on my own self and rest a  bit." She is requesting 2,800,000 MNT to buy more used clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a very responsible husband and father. He is 42 years old and he is married to Myrna, 40 years old. They are blessed with two children: Melowin, 18 years old, a first year college student and Eron, four years old, already studying in a Day Care Center in their village. Wilson is doing his best to provide for the needs of his family and one of his goals is to send their children to school. 

Wilson has been managing a store and a bakeshop in their village. He has been in this kind of business for  two years already and he always wanted to further grow his business, however, availability of sufficient capital hinders him. He hopes to access a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to be used as his additional working capital for his retail business. The loan will be of big help for the progress of his business so he prays that lenders will give him the opportunity of improving his general store and bakeshop

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and spices for his store.

loans.name: Esther Lily

texts.en:
Esther Lily is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Esther Lily has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esther Lily has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esther Lily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 33 years old and lives with his wife and one child in his house in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his child goes to the kindergarten. 

Batsaihan operates a shoe-making business. He started his shoe-making business in 1996. At first, he was only able to make one kind of shoes on order and they barely sold. Now, he makes a variety of types of shoes and he sells them to resellers. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "I believe that I can do even better and I have a bright vision for my business." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy materials to make more boots to increase his assets.

loans.use: To buy materials to make more boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy textile materials to add to his stock.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is  30 years old, married, and a mother of two children. Jackline sells clothes in Bombolulu, Mombasa.  

She  was recently introduced to KADET LTD and she has been in her business for the last two years. It has been a success. This marks her first time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase a bale of clothes for her business.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and into the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru: Зулфинисо вдова и она мать 5 детей. Она в молодости потеряла своего мужа, и вырастили своих детей сама. Сейчас все ее дети совершеннолетние и имеют свою семью. Несмотря на свой не молодой возраст она занимается переаботкой, сушкой абрикосов и торговлей сухофруктов. Зимой она продает шерстяные платки. Займ хочет получить для закупа сухофруктов и перепродажи их зимой.
texts.en: Zulfiniso is a widow and a mother of five children.  She lost her husband when she was young and raised her children on her own.  Currently, all of the children are adults and have their own families.  Despite her respectable age, Zulfiniso is involved in processing and drying of apricots and sales of dried fruits.  She sells wool scarves in the winter.  Zulfiniso wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of dried fruits and sales of them in the winter.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Kim Eng

texts.en: Kim Eng is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a farmer and sells palm products earning $3 per day. They have four children; all are working and each earns $3 per day. Every month, Kim Eng has to spend $40 on food, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy brick and cement for repairing her house. This loan will help her family to have a better house to live in.

loans.use: To buy brick and cement for repairing her house.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Feliza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Feliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Feliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 58 years old, is a cake seller earning $10 per day. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter, 31 years old. Her daughter is a soup seller and sell some grocery goods, earning $10 per day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy wood and cement to repair her house. This loan will help her to have a better house to live in and a proper place for her daughter to sell soup.

loans.use: To buy wood and cement to repair her house.

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 44 years old, married, and has three children two of whom attend school and one of whom is working.  She is a fish seller and earns $15 per day.  

Every month, Saly spends $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan for $1100, which she will use to buy fish to sell. This loan will help her family to have enough to continue her career of selling fish. Saly is trying to support her children to study in the university so that they can get good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Tor

texts.en:
Mrs. Tor is a diligent and patient persO. in working. She has been engaged in a hog fattening business for six years and a rice cultivating business for ages. With the strenuous work, she successfully earns a livelihood. 

She would like to grow her business by expanding her farmland at the size of three hectare. By doing that, she will be able to plant more crops and get a high rate of productiO. from this land. With the loan amount of KHR 4,000,000 she wants to buy extra farmland. She hopes that with the help of this fund she will earn more net income and save it for the further expansiO. of her existing business. 

She wishes to lift her family from poverty. Nowadays she lives with her husband and four single children.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 42 года, она замужем имеет одного ребенка. Она 7 лет занимается куплей и продажей промтоваров и парфюмерии и имеет опыт в этом деле. Этим бизнесом  Робия  занимается самостоятельно. Она продает много разных товаров и имеет постоянных  клиентов,  среди продавцов предпринимателей она имеет хорошую репутацию  Для привлечения большего количества клиентов Робия хочет улучшить ассортимент товара, а для  этого Робие нужен  займ на сумму 12000 сомони. Это поможет развитию бизнеса Робии.
texts.en: Robiya is a hardworking woman. She is 42 years old, married and has one child. She has been buying and selling manufactured goods and perfumes for seven years and has good experience in this business. Robiya runs this business by herself. She sells a lot of different kinds of goods and has many regular customers, as well as she has a good reputation among fellow sellers business owners. To attract a large volume of buyers Robiya wants to improve the variety of her merchandise and for this she needs a loan for the amount of 12000 somoni. This will help Robiya to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and increase commodity turnover.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж тракторист. Сама она занимается торговлей. У нее имеется не большой продуктовый магазин. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения продуктов питания.
texts.en: Nilufar lives in the town of Tursun-Zoda. She is 32 years old. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is a tractor driver.  As to Nilufar, she works as a vendor. She has a small grocery store. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to stock up on food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 49, is married to Daniel and supports a family of five people. She has had her business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more potatoes for resale. The profits will be used to transport her goods to various places in search of a better market. This is her first loan and she hopes to pay it well.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sokheoun

texts.en: Sokheoun, 51, is a fisher and fish seller who earns $2.5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter and earns $3 per day. They have five children - one is studying and the other four work, earning $10 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $88 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on school fees and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work. Her husband has been a carpenter for about five years and he can have a lot of customers. She wants to buy more fishing equipment to make more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom, 54, is a grocery seller who earns $1.5 per day. She is a single mother and lives with her one daughter, who works in a garment factory earning $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy more grocery goods to sell. She hopes she can have enough money to extend her career to sell more kinds of products.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married and she and her beloved husband are blessed with four children. She is 49 and lives in San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Sur.

Thelma sells her own harvest vegetables, such as eggplant, okra and others, to earn a living, a business she has been doing for three years. The profit helps a lot with her family's day to day living expenses, to purchase daily basic needs. Each month, Thelma earns 4,500 PHP from her business. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizer to make her vegetable garden more productive. 

Thelma became a member of GDMPC this year. She is in her second loan cycle. Her future plan is to buy a vehicle, even if just a motorcycle, in order to deliver her products to the public market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 28 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and has four children.  She is married and all four of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mary Jane would like to save enough so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a trisikad (cycle rickshaw/ pedicab) transport business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 2 years.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (cycle rickshaw/ pedicab)

loans.name: Kim Eng

texts.en: Kim Eng, 30, is a worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairer and earns $5 per day. They have five children, three of whom are studying, while the other two are too young for school. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $16 on school fees, and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy wood to repair her house. This loan will help her family to have a better house to live in. Kim Eng wants to support her children to study in university.

loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 39 years old, married with 2 children. One child is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merla has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Merla requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

Merla has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Merla would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 43, is married with four children. She has a retail business selling a variety of products in her community.

Margie is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She dreams of someday having her own stall so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts and blouses for her store.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икромджон  умный и ответственный водитель. Он водитель со стажем, вот уже 10 лет занимается  перевозкой пассажиров. На прибыль от своего дела Икромжон покупает  запасные части для авто. Он  женат, у него 2 детей. Он хочет купить машину, так как  впереди зима. Икромжон знает, что  количество клиентов в зимний период возрастет, если машина будет комфортной, этим он принесет пользу и пассажирам и принесет прибыль в бюджет. Ему для приобретения машины нужны средства, которых у него нет. Икромжон просит вас предоставить ему возможность в получении займа на сумму 8000 сомони и надеется на ваше понимание.
texts.en: Ikromjon is a smart and responsible driver. He is married and has two children. He is a driver with experience as it has been ten years that he transports passengers. Ikromjon uses the profit from his business to buy spare parts for the vehicle. He wants to buy a vehicle because the winter is approaching soon. Ikromjon knows that the volume of customers grows during the winter and if the vehicle is comfortable he will benefit the passengers and make profit in his budget. He needs financial support to buy the new car which he doesn't have. Ikromjon is asking everyone to provide him with the opportunity to get a loan in the amount of 8000 somoni and he hopes for your understanding.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 38 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Саломат уже пять лет как занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном занимается торговлей золотых украшений. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов золотых украшений.
texts.en: Salomat lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 38 years old, divorced and has one child.  Salomat has been involved in retail sales at the market for five years.  She primarily sells gold jewelry.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of gold jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of gold jewelry

loans.name: 03.12.96 Thiệu Dương  Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Sáng operates a food stall selling fruit and is requesting a loan to purchase fruit for resale. She is 48 and married with three children. Sáng is the group leader of the 96 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Sáng lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province and has one dependent. In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Since joining, she has successfully repaid six loans.

Sáng has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Sáng hopes for her children to find a good job, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who operates a shop selling spare auto parts. He will use the loan to buy different kinds of auto parts in order to increase his sales and profits.

Asia is an expert seamstress and sews beautiful looking clothes, which allows her to financially contribute to her family. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. She has given birth to three sons and two daughters. All her children are getting their education except for the youngest son who is only four years old.

She has a great level of trust in her husband and is very much sure that after the loan investment, her husband will be successful in getting good financial results from his business. Her husband has been operating his business for the past 10 years.

Asia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record in her previous loan year and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Asia.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma mentioned that the only way to survive poverty is through "patience and hard work". She is now 55 and has two adult children. Her husband is a farmer who manages their farm lots while Emma sells meat in the market to earn additional income. She has operated this business for almost 33 years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 PHP per month, which they use to acquire their daily consumption and for the allowances of their children.

Due to financial difficulties, she is asking for additional capital of 13,000 PHP to buy fresh meat and pork sausages to sell in the market. She hopes that through this loan, she will improve her business. Emma hopes that in the future, she will see her business grow and that her children will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat and pork sausages to sell in the market.

loans.name: Argin

texts.en:
Argin, 28, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

Argin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия занимается откормом скота на протяжении 10 лет. На воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Занятие бизнесом помогает ей в содержании семьи. Откорм скота приносит хорошие доходы. Зулфия просит займ для покупки крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыль. Она заранее благодарна всем вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya feeds cattle for the last ten years. She is raising one child. This business helps her to support her family. Feeding of the cattle gives her good income. Zulfiya is asking for a loan to buy large and small horned cattle to expand her business and receive maximum profit. She is thankful in advance to everyone for help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal, 34, is married and has three sons and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Jamal has a project  raising sheep and benefiting from the sale of their products. He wants to expand his project by purchasing more sheep in order to increase his income by selling more products. As he doesn't have enough money to pay for them, he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Jamal gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more sheep and sell more products, thus increasing and improving his income to provide his family with better living conditions. Jamal is photographed in the picture.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep to benefit from the sale of their products.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 34, is married and has three school age children. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in supplying for their needs, especially with their daily food. 

Rowena has a general store, a business she has been in for three years. She sells different kinds of products, such as sugar, shampoo, eggs, cooking oil, noodles and other basic needs items to earn an income. She has a monthly income of 3,250 PHP. Now, Rowena wants to expand her business and she has thus requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell. Her products are very salable in their community. Rowena hopes to expand her business so that she can earn more profit and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 55, is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband are both farmers, primarily growing rice crops to sell. Susan's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Susan, on the other hand, runs their sari-sari store business. She sells items like sugar, coffee, detergent, bath soap and canned goods.

Susan has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell at the store, such as canned goods and soap. She hopes for their farm and store to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell at the store, such as canned goods and soap.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, 53, lives in the Philippines and is married with nine children. She has a karaoke shop that provides videoke, where customers pay 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity of the services.

Digna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Digna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity of the services.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Due to the hardships of life, Reynaldo engages in the buying and selling of scrap materials in his community to earn additional income. He is 55 and has four adult children. He aims to improve their standard of living and give his family a better life. He endures the hardships and difficulties he encounters in life for he believes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

To improve his business, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy bottles, irons and plastics to sell in the junk shop. He believes that this loan will help him to improve the business. In the future, he hopes that his business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy bottles, irons, and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 40 years old, married and has 1 child who is in school.

Minerva is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Minerva has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia belongs to a poor family. She is 53 and a housewife who spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. She is still very active and performs her duties with dedication. Her husband is 55 and doesn’t work.

Asia is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are rickshaw drivers. Her daughter is 24 and helps Asia in her routine daily tasks. Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son who wants to pay off the remaining installments of his rickshaw. By doing this, the rickshaw will become his property and he will be able to run his business better and without any problems.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining installments of her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kalyl

texts.en:
Kalyl is 32 years old, married and has 3 children who are all in school.

Kalyl is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Kalyl requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Kalyl has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Kalyl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ilkhom

texts.ru: Илхом целеустремленный и ответственный человек. Он занимается купля продажей лука. Он покупает лук с дехканской поле оптом с низкой ценой, а продает их на рынке. Данный бизнес он научил из своего друга 10 лет назад. Кроме этого он занимается услугами таксиста и имеет много клиентов. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки лука и ремонт автомобиля. Илхом заранее благодарить вас за вашу поддержку и доброты.
texts.en: Ilkhom is a purposeful and responsible man. He buys and sells onions. He buys the onions from the farm fields in wholesale at low price and then sells on the market. He learned about this business from his friend ten years ago. Also he provides taxi services and has many customers. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy onions and to repair the car. Ilkhom is thanking everyone in advance for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase onions and repair the car.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old with one child who is currently going to school. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari sari store.

Alma has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, eggs, etc.. 

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business and send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari sari store

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 38, lives in the Philippines and is married with six children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 26 years old, married and has 2 children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Divina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

Divina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 42, is married to Milka. He runs a butcher which he has operated for twelve years. He was given a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy livestock for slaughtering. He earns an income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

The anticipated profit will be used to expand his business and to support his family by raising their living standards. This is his second loan from KADET Ltd.

He hopes to become a prominent businessman and a stable family man.

loans.use: to boost his existing business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 62, is married and has two children. Her children are already married and she lives with her husband. Rosita has a business selling a variety of products in her "sari-sari store" general store to earn an income. She believes it is better to have her own business, in order to earn her own income. She has been in this business for four years and has monthly earnings of 5,000 PHP. She is doing her best to expand her business.

Rosita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more items to sell. In the future, Rosita wants to save funds through savings, portion of her income to have good life. She hopes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
As a single mother of 4 children, Leni works hard to support her family.

Leni has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Leni requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Leni has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Leni would like to save enough to expand her business and send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn, 32, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Juvelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her fruit stall.

loans.name: Vigilina

texts.en:
Vigilina is 34 years old and married. She has six children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Vigilina is engaged in a fishing business. Her husband, who is a fisherman, operates their fishing boat. Vigilina sells her husband's catch at their town's local market. Vigilina does her best to support her family, especially her children's education. 

She requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help Vigilina and her husband continue earning from their business. Vigilina hopes to buy house equipment.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hameed's Group

texts.en:
Hameed is very supportive lady who operates a cosmetics and bangles selling business. Cosmetics and bangles are very popular among women in her area and she makes a reasonably good income from her business. She purchases bangles and cosmetics on the wholesale market and sells at a profit to her clients.
 
Her husband is a goldsmith who makes beautiful gold jewelry as well as artificial jewelry. He has been operating his business for many years and is known as an expert in his field of work.
 
Hameed is the mother of five children. Her eldest daughter is illiterate but the others are studying. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will purchase bangles and cosmetics in bulk quantity. EID (a Muslim occasion) is very near and she is very confident that she will make great profits on that occasion. 

She has been operating her business for past 10 years and she is very confident about doing even better in the future.

loans.use: To buy bangles and cosmetics for selling

loans.name: Kampala One Group

texts.en:
Paulo, who is in his late 40s, is married and has six children. Four of them are still going to school and two of them are grown and on their own. He also takes care of his mother. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his first motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he wants to use it for buying more maize grains, grinding them and selling flour. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania, given in the middle of the main loan, that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kampala One," which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more maize grains, grind them and sell flour.

loans.name: Danize

texts.en:
Danize is a 35-year-old married woman with nine children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the produce business for four years and with the income generated, she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

Her hardship is high commodity prices and her vision is having a bigger business plus educating her children.

Danize needs the loan to buy rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children. He runs a motorcycle business in Mshomoroni, Mombasa.  

His business has been in operation for the last three years. Said has been a KADET client, and this marks his second borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to repair his motorcycle. 

The profits that will be generated from his business will be directed into the gradual expansion of his business and the repayment of the loan. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 50 years old, married and has five children who are in school. Rosalia lives in Manla, Sapangdalaga, Mis. Occ.

Rosalia is in the food business, selling fresh fish in her community to earn a living. With this line of business, she has a monthly income of 8,500 PHP. Rosalia has been in this business for five years. Her husband is a fisherman.  

Rosalia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through GDMPC to buy fish to sell, and portion of her loan will be used to repair her pump boat. This is her fourth loan to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell and to repair her boat.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 and widowed. She has four adult children and they live happily in a village. Despite being a widow, she has strong faith and determination to improve their status of living and become successful in the future. 

To generate income, she engages in hog-raising and selling soft drinks in their village. She has been in this business for more than 10 years now and usually earns a profit of PHP 9,000 a month, which she uses for their basic necessities.

She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers needs, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages and snack food to sell in her variety store. 

She mentioned that this loan will help a lot to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages and snack foods to sell in her variety store.

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Manyeso

texts.en:
Manyeso is 32 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Manyeso sells fire wood in Mombasa.  Manyeso is a KADET client and she has been in her business for the last one year. It has been a success. 

This marks her second time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more firewood into her business. 

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for grocery distribution and also to purchase more groceries for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 51 years old and is married to Priscilla. The couple is blessed with two children, who both attend school. For the last six years, Julius has run a business operating public toilets and he earns a monthly income of 14,300 KES.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by organization staff. Julius is very hardworking.

Julius is requesting his second loan of 30,000 KES to bring water to his toilets. He has a good credit history with KADET and will use his anticipated profit to build more toilets. In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to bring water to the public toilets he operates

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, she has run a general store and she earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. Nora’s general store is a great help to her family and helps sustain their day-to-day needs. 

Nora is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to expand her business and buy more products to sell. In the future, she plans to be more progressive with the help of GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomotoes

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San is 22 and is a young man who is married with a lovely kid. He is in the marketing business and sells products for the CK Company, located in Kompong Chhnang province. Every day, he travels back and forth to provide wholesale products to general stores around local markets and he also takes some time to find new customers. Mr. San is skillful in using his language to persuade customers to buy his products. He gets a monthly salary; however, he also receives a commission on every product he sells. Typically, he earns around 7.50 USD per day. 

Mr. San wishes to create a business for his wife to sell items such as groceries, foods, and other household products in a local area. He will buy these items in bulk and resell them at a reasonable price. Mr. San hopes this business will provide a high income and a better standard living.

Mr. San is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase the products to start this business for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and household items to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 30 years old. He a hardworking man who has two children. Godfrey owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past four years, he has been selling beans, cassava flour, and ground nuts. Originally, he was only selling maize, but after saving capital he expanded into his current business. Godfrey’s financial hardships are rent and high license fees.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour, a posho mill, and beans to sell. His vision is to expand his business and provide for the education of his family.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, a posho mill, and beans

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
Toch Y. is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Kompong Chhnang Province and is the one resident who is straightforward and conscientious.  She is hardworking so that she can help support her family live a better quality of life and her children can receive a good education at university. 

To upgrade her family's standard of living, Toch has been running a business as a fish and vegetable seller in one market near her village. She has been in this business with her husband since 1995. Toch is successful in this business because she has good relationships with her customers and is experienced in this trade. She is able to earn approximately $5 per day to cover her family’s daily expenses. 

Toch wants to see her business grow and earn more profits. She is requesting a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner, to expand her business. She will use this loan to purchase more fish and vegetables to satisfy her clients. She has chosen HKL because it provides good services, lower interest rates than other banks, and long-term periods for repaying her loan. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to expand her business. She plans on repaying the loan punctually. Toch's dream in the future is seeing her children get a good education and have good jobs. This is her first loan with HKL.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 45-year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for 6 years in which he started with 300,000 UGX and now has 1,000,000 UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuations and his vision is a wholesale shop plus an educated family. Josephat needs the loan to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
To earn a living, Delia owns and manages a variety store in her village. She is 57 years old and was separated from her husband due to problems and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she lives with her mother and decided to take care of her for she is now old and incapable. She aimed to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their necessities and save for their future.

Due to financial constraints, Delia is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy beverages, soaps, candies, shampoos, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her variety store. She believes that through her patience and hard work, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soaps, candies, shampoos, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hut

texts.en: Hut is a housewife. She is a single mother who lives with four children, all of them are working. Together, they earn 10 USD per day for all. Every month, Hut has to spend 120 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, and 10 USD on other expenses. Each of her family expenses is covered by her first daughter because she can make a better income than the others. Hut would like to request a loan of 500 USD to buy construction material for repairing her house. This loan helps her to get a better house to stay in.

loans.use: to buy construction material for repairing her house

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is a 33-year-old single man and thus he does not support any family. He has been a hawker for the past 4 years, selling items like belts, watches, padlocks, pens and other items. He gets a monthly income of 7,000 KES which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Ephantus will use the loan to buy more stock of belts, watches and padlocks. He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy more stock thus expanding the business. 

His future hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will provide for his future family.

loans.use: to buy stock of belts, watches and padlocks

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka is from the village Geguti, West Georgia. He is 24 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents. 

The only source of income for the family is agricultural business. In particular, they own 2 greenhouses, where greens, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. In the period of October – May the greenhouses are used for growing greens and in the summer months they are utilized for vegetable (cucumber and tomato) growing. Harvested greens are sold to local wholesalers. As for vegetables, Beka sells them on the local open market himself. Total average monthly income of the family is 950 GEL (approximately 575 USD).

Beka requested credit to purchase polyethylene material for covering existing iron construction and use it as the third greenhouse. Beka will be able to grow more greens and vegetables and increase the income of the family. They will be able to purchase needed household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene material for covering greenhouses

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She is vested in her responsibility to look after her family and her dream is to educate her children through the university level.

Margret is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Алижон занимается ремонтом автомашин. Он занимается этим ремеслом уже 4 года. Алижон хороший муж и отец, у него 2 детей. Бизнесом он занимается самостоятельно. Алиджон  трудолюбивый, честный мастер своего дела , поэтому имеет постоянных клиентов. У него хорошая репутация. Он хочет получить займ на сумму 7200 Сомони  для приобретения запчастей для  ремонта любых автомашин, так как недостача запчастей останавливает ремонт авто. Полученный кредит поможет ему и принесет хороший прибыль.
texts.en: Alijon repairs cars. He has been in this business for four years. Alijon is a good husband and father, he has two children. He runs his business by himself. Alijon is a hardworking, honest professional in his field and has regular customers. He has a good reputation. He wants to get a loan in the amount of 7200 somoni to buy spare parts to repair any cars because the lack of parts halts the auto repair. This loan will help him get additional profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Elvira has run a shop where she sells used clothing, or ukay-ukay, such as shirts and blouses. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. 

Elvira is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy used clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 38 year old woman who is married with two sons and a daughter. Her husband is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority.  Randa is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead at the FATEN branch.


Randa wants to improve her house so that she may live with her family in better conditions. She is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to make changes to her tiles, windows, doors, etc. When she receives her loan, which is repaid in monthly installments, she will renovate her home to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en:
Honeylyn is from Manla, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental. She lives with her husband and is blessed with three children. Honeylyn runs a fish-selling business. Her husband is a fisherman and she sells his catch to the community. She earns 4,500 PHP each month. Honeylynn also operates a general store at home to earn additional income for her family. 

Honeylyn is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to buy an additional pump boat. She wishes to expand her business and save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a boat

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She used her previous loan to buy a taxi and educate her children. However, she is facing the challenge of increasing fuel prices which are decreasing the income from her taxi business. 

Irene is requesting another loan to buy sugar, soap, and beans to sell at the retail shop that she owns. She wants to boost sales at her shop because it has lower operational costs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, and beans to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 51 years old, is a cake seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband, a policeman, earns $3.20 per day. They have four children, three of whom are working, and one too young for school. Every month, Pov has to spend $150 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rent, and $45 on other expenses.
 
She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to help her children travel to work. She will extend her career when her profits increase.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her children travel to work.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
