Daisy is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. 

Daisy has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Daisy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more animals for slaughtering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase stock for her shop.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra needs another loan in preparation for the Christmas season, when demand is high. She used her previous loan to buy clothing, and with the profits earned she has been able to educate her children. Sandra needs this loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

She faces the challenge of the rainy season when customers don't turn up, so her desire is to operate from enclosed premises.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nzau

texts.en:
Nzau is 33 years old, married, and is the father of one child. He runs a restaurant in Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last 20 years. 

This marks Nzau’s second loan from KADET. With this loan he plans to add more stock of cooking oil, maize meal, cereals, wheat flour, detergents, and soft drinks. He plans to use the anticipated profits generated to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. 

In the future, he would like to own his own hotel.

loans.use: To add more stock of cooking oil, maize meal, cereals, wheat flour, detergents, and soft drinks

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice. Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice to sell

loans.name: Vodacom Group

texts.en:
Dorothea, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with three children who are still going to school. She has had a general store for 10 years now. She works from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fairly good profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase the store's inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to open a wholesale shop (the one she has is a retail shop).

She will share this loan with her loan group "Vodacom," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her store inventory.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a very scrupulous woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over five years. She is 28 years old and married to John, who is also a farmer. They have two children.

She is applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy farm inputs and fruits for selling. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening. She will later resell the cattle, earning money to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Sri, 56 years old, sells cakes and groceries. She earns 12 USD per day. She is a single mother who lives with three children. Two of her children work in the factory; each earns 2 USD per day. One more child stays home. Every month, she has to spend 100 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 20 USD on transportation, and 20 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 800 USD to buy a motorbike for her son to provide motor taxi services. She plans to open a tailoring shop for her daughter when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to provide motor taxi services

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is from the village of Vartsikhe in Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 53 years old, married, and lives with her 35-year-old son and 5-year-old grandson. 

Darejan is retired. She oversees the agricultural business of the family. Her son is a soldier and works for the country’s armed forces. The family has a small dairy farm with four milk cows. Darejan produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Also, she grows maize on one hectare of land. Along with the aforementioned, the family has a vineyard with 800 grapevines. Darejan produces wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income from agricultural activities is 470 laris (GEL), or approximately 280 USD. 

Darejan requested credit for building a house and getting it ready to live in. Also, she will purchase new household goods, which are necessary for the family. Living conditions for all family members will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a responsible housewife who helps her husband manage their rice-farming business in their village. She is now 55 years old and has four adult children. Being parents, she and her husband want to improve their standard of living to give their children a bright future. They endure hardships and difficulties in life, believing that it is a stepping stone towards success.

They aim to increase their yields and income this coming harvest season, to cover their basic needs and save for future emergencies. She wants to ask for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of their rice-farming business. She is hoping that through their patience and hard work they will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her rice-farming business

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is from Lusot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ., Philippines. She is 38 years of age and has three children. Her children are in school. Juditha has an agricultural business producing rice. After the harvest, she sells her rice to her general store. With this business, she earns a monthly return of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Juditha has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her rice farm. 

Juditha joined GDMPC in 2010 and is in her second loan cycle. She hopes to buy her own farm equipment, like a hand "truck-tor," so she won't have to rent anymore.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries such as ingredients, candies, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Seiyantuki

texts.en:
Seiyantuki is 55 years old, married, and the father of eight children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 11 years, earning income that enables him to cater for his family’s needs.

He was initiated into KADET by a KADET staff member, and he has been a good client who has repaid his previous loans well. He is currently applying for his third loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies. He hopes to make more profit, which he will use to educate his children and expand his farming business.

He has dreams of prospering in farming and thus being able to provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Sinat is 26 years old and works in the garment factory, earning $5 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning $4 per day. They have one child who is 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to use traveling to work. Her husband plans to buy a car to run a car taxi service, which can make better income than working in the factory.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a very hardworking man who has operated a motorcycle taxi for the past three years. He is a good client. He was introduced to KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff within the town. 

He has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy spare motorcycle parts. He will use the return from the loan to buy a salon car to operate as a taxi, which earns better income than a motorcycle.

His dream is to be rich and self-sustaining in life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор, возраст 45 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 совершеннолетних детей. Абдусаттор 12 лет занимается в этой сфере деятельности. Он имеет собственную мельницу, в работе которой ему помогают сыновья, они помогают населению получать муку, из которой в дальнейшем изготавливают хлеб для личного пользования. Себестоимость муки производимой таким образом  ниже цены на мешок привозной муки, что положительно отразиться на семейном бюджете и в бизнесе в сельской местности. Абдусаттор хочет получить займ на сумму 10000 сомони  для приобретения  оборудования для мельницы, этим он принесет пользу и населению и развить собственный  бизнес.
texts.en: Abdusattor is 45 years old. He is married and has four adult children. Abdusattor has been running his business for twelve years. He owns a flour mill, and his sons help him in the operation by helping the residents get flour from which they later make bread for own consumption. The price of the flour produced by this method is lower than the price of a bag of flour brought from outside, which makes a positive effect of the family budget and the business in the village. Abdusattor wants to get a loan in the amount of 10000 somoni to buy equipment for the flour mill which will be beneficial to the local residents and growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy mill equipment.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a working woman who supports her family financially through her bangles business. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband has just started a shoemaking business. Earlier, he was involved in a fruit-selling business and on the side started learning shoemaking as well. When he left the fruit-selling business, he went to learn the skill of shoemaking. Now, he is fully trained and gets orders from different factories.
  
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to establish her husband's shoemaking business. With the loan, her husband will buy items like leather, nails, and shoe polish in large quantities to make a lot of shoes and improve his income.
  
Robina is very confident that her husband will be able to establish his shoemaking business, and that his family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living as a result.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: to buy items required for a shoemaking business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is a farmer who grows wheat and maize on her land, and she has been doing this for the last six years. 

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, and she is planning to spend the amount to buy fertilizers, wheat, and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit resulting from this loan to build a permanent house.

Her dream is to be a prominent farmer of wheat and raise the living standard of her family. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, wheat, and maize seeds

loans.name: Joriline

texts.en: Joriline is married with two children and lives with her husband. Joriline is from barangay Lusot, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Nora is in the retail business, operating a general store, or, as we called it in the Philippines, a sari-sari store. She has been in this industry for two years, and she earns a monthly revenue of 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP). She is requesting a 5,000-PHP loan to buy supplementary goods to vend. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year. She is now on her second loan cycle. Joriline hopes to expand her business so she'll have more returns for the education of her children and for covering the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Phadarany

texts.en: Phadarany, 23 years old, is a tailor who earns 5 USD per day. The woman standing next to her in the photo is her mother. She lives with three siblings: two are students and one more works in the factory and earns 4 USD per day. Every month, she has to spend 100 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 1,200 USD to buy a motorbike for herself to travel to work. She plans to open a tailoring shop at home so she doesn’t have to travel far from home to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 38 years old. He is married and has four children who are in school. He does mixed farming, including rearing sheep and farming wheat, which he has been doing for the past seven years.

Henry learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He is a good client and has applied for his first loan, which he plans to spend partly on farming and partly to purchase more sheep for fattening.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated income to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farming business.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma believes that "success is the fruit of patience and sacrifices." She is now 57 years old. She is married and has five children. Norma and her husband live happily in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Through their patience and sacrifices, they educate their five children to give them a better life. They say that this is their big accomplishment in life. 

Norma and her husband want to continue managing the business so they can earn and save for their future. She wants to ask for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for their rice-farming business. She believes that through patience and hard work, they will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her rice-farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is 22 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines.  He has a shop that sells bananas and firewood. He has had this business for two years. 

Ronel is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which he will use to buy bananas and firewood to sell.  Ronel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and firewood to sell

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 59 years old, married, and has two children.  His mother also lives with him.  He is from the village of Khomuli, Imereti Region, West Georgia. 

Josef is leading the agricultural business of the family. His wife is a teacher in the village. One of Josef’s son’s is painter and works locally. The second son helps Josef with the family farm. They own a small dairy farm with three milk cows. Family members produce cheese and sell it in nearby Kutaisi. They also have a pig and sell piglets. The total average monthly income of the family, including salaries and pension, is 1200 Laris. 

Josef is requesting a loan, which he will use for the construction of a new cattle shed. With a larger cattle shed, he will be able to purchase additional cows and increase the amount of cheese sales, which will improve the family income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cattle shed construction

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Машхурахон трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она 11 лет занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Машхурахон мать 4-х детей и любящая жена. Ее муж помогает ей в бизнесе. Машхурахон  два раза в месяц едет за товаром и продает на местном рынке, она продает ткани для женских платьев. У Машхурахон много клиентов, которые довольны ее обслуживанием. Свой бизнес она считает прибыльным. Она заботливая мать, и постоянно помогает детям и близким. Для развития бизнеса ей нужна сумма в размере 13500 сомони, после получения, которых она  купит новые ткани для женщин. Машхурахон  надеется этим принести пользу и женщинам и в семейный бюджет. Она надеется, что вы поддержите ее и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Mashhurahon is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She has been involved in an entrepreneurship for 11 years.  Mashhurahon is a mother of four children and is a loving wife.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Mashhurahon travels for her merchandise twice per month and sells it at the local market.  She sells fabrics for women's dresses.  Mashhurahon has many customers, who are satisfied with her service.  She considers her business to be profitable.  She is a caring mother and always helps her children and relatives.  In order to develop her business, she needs a sum of 13500 somoni, which she plans to use to buy new fabrics for women.  Mashhurahon hopes to bring good to both women and to the family budget.  She hopes that you will support her and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is 45 years old, married and has five children.  She is from Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. 

Jennie is in a food business, selling fresh fish in a food stall in the market. She has been in this business for six years. Jennie has a monthly income of 12,000  PHP. 

Jennie is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fish to sell.  Jennie joined GDMPC in 2010. In the near future, Jennie wishes to expand her business with another food stall.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lutaso Weyonga Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Lutaso Weyonga Group in Western Kenya, Fred being the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Fred is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund due to the firm offering the best prices for farm inputs, like fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and ensure food security for his family. In the 2011 season, Fred had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Fred will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Lutaso Weyonga group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

Fred is picured with his group members in the photograph, with the Field Officer at the far right in yellow T-Shirt.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is in her mid 30s, married, and has one child who attends school. She has been selling clothes, fabrics, and sarongs for five years.

Rosemary is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs.  She used the previous loans to increase her clothing sales and take her mother to the hospital.  Rosemary has paid back all her loans successfully.   Her dream is to one day buy land.

Rosemary will share this loan with her loan group Riziki, which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Berlista

texts.en: Berlista is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has four children. Berlista has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and viands such as afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages and raw ingredients needed for viands. Berlista has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Berlista hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and raw ingredients needed for viands.

loans.name: Roscon

texts.en:
Roscon is 29 years old and single. He has owned and managed a rice-farming business for almost five years. He usually earns a profit of P20,000 in every harvest season. He aims to increase his yield and income to satisfy his needs and save for his future. He says he needs to be well-prepared before he gets married because nowadays life is very difficult. 

Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and pay labor costs required in planting rice. He is hoping that he will increase his yield and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and pay labor costs required in planting rice.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is married and has three children. She is 43 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. Maribel has a vegetable garden in her backyard. To earn a living, she trades vegetables with a contract buyer. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. Maribel has requested a loan for 9000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her garden. Maribel has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is now on the third cycle. In the future, Maribel hopes to expand her vegetable garden in order to produce supplementary vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her garden.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en: Dexter,  26 years old and engaged in a hog-fattening business, is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy two more hogs and feed. He hopes to eventually earn enough income to build his own beauty parlour. In order to reach his dream, Dexter is working hard to care for his hogs, and hopes to steadily expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, a wheat farmer for the last five years, is 32 years, married to Beatrice, a housewife, and blessed with three children. Having learned about KADET from KADET staff marketing done in the area, Joshua is requesting his first loan to purchase farm supplies and seedlings for the next planting season. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

An industrious man who can do well if funded, Joshua aspires to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima, a 41-year-old mother of two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school, is married to a driver who provides transport services to his customers.

A seamstress by profession, Halima learned the art of sewing from her mother before marriage and now earns regular income from her five-year-old business through orders from her neighboring clients. A caring housewife and mother, Halima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine to replace her old one. The new machine will enable her to complete orders on time and increase her profits.

Known amongst her clients for the good quality of her work, Halima is confident that the loan will result in more profits and help her family to live better lives.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Halima.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Darlene Mae

texts.en:
Darlene Mae is 26 years old and is raising her family in their community. She aims to educate her child and give him a bright future. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving hard to earn income for the improvement of their lives. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for almost a year and usually earns a profits of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month, which she uses to purchase her family's daily necessities. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks and bread as additional goods to sell. She hopes that through this loan, she can continuously acquire a better income, which will give her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks, and bread

loans.name: Lutaso Inyokha W Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lutaso Inyokha W Group in Western Kenya! Eunice is the facilitator of the Lutaso Inyokha W group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Eunice is the mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. During the 2011 season, Eunice had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Eunice will educate her children and ensure food security. 

In 2012, the members of Lutaso Inyokha W group will have a mixture of very land-limited farmers (taking loans for one acre) and farmers who are taking on larger loans, including Eunice. The larger loans (for two acres or more) fall under One Acre Fund's "Superfarmer" program, which provides additional advice and training to farmers who plant larger plots of maize. 

Eunice is pictured in the photograph together with her group members and the Field Officer at the far left in white.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Josephine has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid cell phone minutes) of several networks like GLOBE, SMART & SUN CELLULAR. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy electronic loads from several networks. 

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads (cell phone minutes) from several networks

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 58 years old. She lives in the village of Kumistavi, West Georgia. She lives alone and earns a living through agricultural activities. She has two milk cows and produces cheese, which is sold at a local market. Also she has a garden with 50 tangerine and 50 nut trees. She sells harvested tangerines and nuts at the same market. Her total average monthly income is 300 Lari (GEL) (approximately 180 USD). 

With the requested 1000 Laris Ketevan plans to purchase a milk cow. She will produce 50% more cheese and increase her income, which will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
Aly is 42 years old and has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for 18 years. Within these years of operating this occupation, she often experiences a lack of the feeds that are fed to her pigs. This causes her to ask for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feeds and vitamins. She wants her pigs to be healthy and nourished in order to sell them for a higher price.

She is aiming to save enough money for the educational purposes of her four children. She trained well in this occupation and yet, she feels difficulty, especially when she lacks money to finance the needs of her pigs. Thus, borrowing working capital is a big contribution to her as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.ru: Зулайхо предприимчивая женщина. Она предприниматель со стажем, более 11 лет занимается куплей и продажей овощей и фруктов. У  Зулайхо дружная семья муж и 4 детей. На накопленные деньги  она построила дом. Зулайхо продает  качественные продукты, поэтому у нее много клиентов. Зная, что бизнес востребован  Зулайхо хочет расширить бизнес, но у нее нужной суммы, поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони и  надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку
texts.en: Zulaikho is an entrepreneurial woman.  She is an entrepreneur with experience and has been involved in buying and selling vegetables and fruits for over 11 years.  Zulaikho has a friendly family of a husband and four children.  She used her savings to build a house.  Zulaikho sells quality products and, thus, has many customers.  Knowing that this is a demanding business, Zulaikho wants to expand it, but does not have the necessary funds.  This is why she is requesting a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni and hopes that you will help and support her.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор женат и ответственный отец двое сыновья. Его жена домохозяйка. Он занимается купля продажей DVD дисков на рынке. У него много постоянные клиенты. Абдусаттор хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и поэтому старается максимизировать свою прибыль. Абдусаттор хочет расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2500$ США. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Abdusattor is married and is a responsible father of two sons.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in buying and selling DVD disks at the market.  He has many loyal customers.  Abdusattor wants to provide a good quality of life for his family and, thus, tries to maximize his profit.  Abdusattor wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan in the sum of $2500 to achieve this goal.  He thanks all of you in advance for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase DVD disks

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Umoja group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joan will repair her home and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Joan is pictured in the photograph together with her group members and the Field Officer at the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a home-based general store located in the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. She has been in this business for four years, and she also earns additional income from her hog-raising business. She is raising four for fattening and one sow. The couple works hard to provide the financial needs of her children. Gloria's husband is welder, farmer and tricycle driver.

Gloria has requested a loan amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more items such as biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and soft drinks for her store. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her store and raise all the piglets of her sow. In this way, she could improve her hog-raising business, increase her sales and support her five children until they could finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives now with her beloved husband. Jocelyn sells a variety of products in her general store to earn a living, and she has been in this type of business for two years. Each month, she is able to earn revenue in the amount of 3,500 Philippines pesos (Php). She requested a loan in the amount of Php 7,000 to buy additional goods to vend. 

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. She is now in her second loan cycle. Jocelyn hopes to expand her business to earn supplementary revenue for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soya beans to plant.

loans.name: Kiabii Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kiabii SHG Group in Western Kenya! George is the facilitator of the Kiabii SHG group. Many farmers in this group have been part of One Acre Fund since 2008 and, having benefited from the products and services, have decided to re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, George will pay school fees for his children and provide for general household maintenance.

In 2012, the members of Kiabii SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

George is pictured with his group members in the photograph with their Field Officer on the far left in Black and Red.  In front of the group, a young calf is resting.  Many farmers invest in livestock with profits from their harvests.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vasya

texts.ru: Вася просит выдать ему кредит на приобретение дополнительных рыбацких снастей для приближающегося зимнего сезона. Он хочет приобрести снасти, необходимые для зимней рыбалки, чтобы удовлетворить возрастающий спрос рыбаков. Предыдущий кредит был потрачен на увеличение товарного запаса и помог Васе открыть еще одну торговую точку на рынке. Вася - сам заядлый рыбак, поэтому ему очень нравится его бизнес и он намерен развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Vasya is requesting this loan for the purchase of additional fishing gear for the upcoming winter season.  He wants to buy gear, necessary for the winter fishing, in order to satisfy the increasing demand of fishermen.  The previous loan was spent on increasing merchandise inventories and helped Vasya to open one more retail outlet at the market.  Vasya himself is an avid fisherman, and this is why he loves his business very much, and intends to develop it further.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of gear for winter fishing

loans.name: Taikoh

texts.en:
Taikoh is 36 years old and married to Sipanto.  They are blessed with three children.  Taikoh is a livestock trader in the area of Bissil where most of his clients are men.  He has been in this business for the last five years and earns an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Taikoh was introduced to Kiva partner KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff person.  He has a good credit history with KADET and is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000.  Taikoh plans to use KES 70,000 to purchase livestock and the remaining 10,000 to pay school fees.  He will use the anticipated profits to start a butcher shop.

Taikoh hopes to start a ranch.  He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and pay school fees.

loans.name: Wazekese Y/g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wazekese Youth Group in Western Kenya! It's headed by David as its facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David is a father of four children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, David was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, David will save for future use and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Wazekeze Youth group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

David is pictured with his group members in the photograph above, with their Field Officer Maxwell in Red and Black at the left side.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
To be successful in life is a main goal of every individual.  Marifi is a responsible housewife who helps her husband to manage their rice farming business.  She is blessed with six children and they live happily in a village.  Due to high cost of school fees and commodities, she and her husband need to earn more income to satisfy their basic needs and finance the education of their children. 

Marifi and her husband aimed to increase their yields so that they could earn a higher income.  However, due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay the labor costs required for planting rice.  Marifi and her husband believe that through patience and hard work, they will have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay the labor costs required for planting rice

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.  Alfonso has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had his business for five years. 

Alfonso requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell at his shop.  In 2011, he became a member of Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI). In the future, Alfonso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell at his store.

loans.name: Dilhumor

texts.ru: Дилхумор трудолюбивая и честная женщина, и заботливая мать 4 детей.  Она занимается  куплей и продажей  сухофруктов. За плечами Дилхумор имеет 13 летний  опыт предпринимательской работы. За полученных доход от бизнеса она самостоятельно  вырастила детей и женила сына. Дилхумор много работает и хочет развить бизнес  и этим  обеспечить детей всем необходимым. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для развития и расширения бизнеса, что принесет пользу и бизнесу и семейному бюджету.
texts.en: Dilhumor is a hard-working and honest woman and a caring mother of four children.  She is involved in buying and selling dried fruits.  Dilhumor has 13 years of experience in entrepreneurial work behind her.  She used the income from this business to raise her children on her own and married off her son.  Dilhumor works a lot and wants to develop her business and provide her children with everything that they need.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni to develop and expand her business in order to benefit the business and the family budget.

loans.use: to develop and expand her business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is the mother of six children, three of whom are studying while the others do different kinds of work to provide financial support for the family.  Mariam is very supportive in nature and she spends most of her time at home performing her household responsibilities.   In her spare time, she supports her husband in his animal husbandry business by taking care of the cattle.  She gives them their food and water in a timely manner. 

Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who sells animal for a living.  He buys young goats and sheep, raises them with good quality food and then sells them to butchers for a profit.  Mariam’s husband has been operating his business for the past ten years.  She is very confident that her husband will make a good profit during this EID (Muslim holiday) that is only a month away. 

Mariam is a regular Asasah loan client and this is her second loan application.  In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mariam”.

loans.use: To buy animals for her husband's business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and a hardworking mother of three children.  She is engaged in the making and selling of rice cake, puto and suman.  These products are Pinoy (Filipino) recipes.   Filipino rice-farmers have always believed that there is nothing better than rice grown and tended by one’s own perseverance to fill one’s stomach.  Whether it is simple boiled rice, rice gruel or rice cake, it is prepared carefully in appreciation of the farmers’ hard work.  Yolanda aims to have a comfortable life.

Yolanda uses various methods to cook malagkit (glutinous rice) to provide her customers enough choices.  Most of her customers are looking for new food recipes and for this reason Yolanda requests a loan of PHP 5,000.  She will use the loan to buy malagkit rice, coconut milk, sugar, and milk to make her food products.  Yolanda wants to satisfy the tastes of her target market.  She offers her products by walking in her community every day and selling from house to house.   Yolanda hopes to earn a higher income to support the education of her three children.

loans.use: to buy malagkit (glutinous) rice, coconut milk, sugar, and milk to make her food products to sell.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales,Mary will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her husband in Manla, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental.   Marites sells fish in the community.   She buys fish from the fisherman and she sells it by foot in the village and sometimes in the nearby district.  After her marriage in 2008, Marites began to work in this line of business to earn an income.  She earns PHP 4,500 per month. 

Marites is requesting a PHP 6000 loan to buy more fish to sell.  With this loan, she can earn more income and abide by her husband’s desire for her to find a source of income for her family. 

In 2010, Marites joined Kiva partner Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). In the near future, she hopes to increase her income to meet the primary needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase  chickens that lay eggs

loans.name: Taraiya

texts.en:
Taraiya is 63 years old and married to Nchoonga.  He and his wife are blessed with three children. Taraiya is a livestock trader in the area of Bissil where most of his clients are female.  He has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of KES 4,000 per month.

Taraiya was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by KADET staff.  He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET.  Taraiya plans to use the entire loan to purchase livestock.  He will use the anticipated profit to start a ranch. 

Taraiya hopes to become the best livestock businessman.  He is very focused.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his trade business.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 72 years old . She is widowed with 4 children.  Pedrita has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has had this business for ten years. 

Pedrita requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.  She is a new member of Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI).  In the future, Pedrita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muungano Group in Western Kenya! Esnas is the facilitator of the Muungano group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Esnas takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esnas had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Esnas was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esnas and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Esnas will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Muungano group will each plant  between 3/4 and 1 acre of maize.

Esnas is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cleaning products.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is married with four children. Felicidad is 56 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Felicidad has a general store to earn a living, and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase stock for her general store.

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to have a number of general stores in the town.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Simana Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana Group in Western Kenya! Rosemary is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rosemary takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Rosemary had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest 2 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rosemary will ensure food security and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Simana group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Rosemary is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 45 years old and married to Francis.  She supports a family of five people by running a retail shop.  She has been in business for 10 years, and right now her monthly income from the business is KES 10,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase cooking fat, bar and bathing soap, and one bag of of sugar to sell in her store.

Serah plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business.  This is her second loan; she successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: add stock to her business.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with no children.
 
Rogelia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase pigs for her farm.
 
Rogelia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm and become a supplier of pork in the province.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig farm.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Ana Maria provides karaoke services for which customers pay 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity of the service.

Ana Maria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ana Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her karaoke service.

loans.name: Lary

texts.en:
Lary is 43 years old and married with three children. (Lary is female, though her name sounds male.)  She lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lary operates a business in the agricultural sector, specializing in rice production.  She has been in this trade for six years.  Each month, Lary earns PHP 6,800.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000.00 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. 

Lary joined GDMPC in 2009. Lary hopes that, in the future, she can buy another plot of rice field.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a 47-year-old, still single man who owns a sari-sari (variety) store business. He sells canned goods, instant noodles and breads. He has been doing this business for five years and slowly expanding it through his patience and perseverance. He hopes to continue this operation so that he can help his parents.

Fernando was a high school graduate, but has the ability to operate his own business. In fact, his business is doing well. However, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy groceries for his store, such as candies, soft drinks, biscuits, and catsup, and to buy equipment to expand his business, such as hollow blocks and cement. He hopes that he can earn more than his usual income, for the betterment of his own life as well as his parents'. He hopes that Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc. will always be generous enough to help them.

loans.use: to buy products for his store such as candies, soft drinks, biscuits, and catsup and to buy equipment for expanding his business, such as hollow blocks and cement.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 24 years old. She is single and blessed with two children who are twins. She is a green grocer in Kajiado, where most of her clients are females. She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of 2,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Jeniffer was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. She has a good credit history with KADET, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 35,000. She plans to use it to purchase vegetables and fruits like onions, tomatoes, mangoes, oranges and avocados. She will use the extra profit to open another store in Maili Sita.

Jeniffer hopes to become a wholesaler in Kajiado, as she is ambitious and very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Mwenda Pole Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mwenda Pole Group in Western Kenya! Martin is the facilitator of the Mwenda Pole group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Martin was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Martin's group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
In the picture the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Carmeliselda

texts.en: Carmeliselda is 30 years old and has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for almost a year. She needs to buy grocery items to sell or it is going to be empty. For this reason, she is asking a loan of P5,000 to buy eggs, cooking oil, bottled anchovies and canned goods as additional goods to sell. She hopes, through the help of this loan, she will accumulate enough money to repair her store and provide the necessities needed by her only child -- her usual companion in her store. In the future, she hopes for the improvement of their status of living.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cooking oil, bottled anchovies and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Cherry Gay

texts.en: Cherry Gay is 31years old, a mother of two children. She is a college graduate but cannot find a better job so she engaged herself in a sari-sari (general) store business. She sells candies, canned goods, sugar, coffee and bread to finance the needs of her family such as electric bills, allowances and foods. She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy cooking oil, patis, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent. She will put these goods in her store as additional commodities as the people in the community are always looking for these goods. She hopes that her business will succeed so that she can answer all the needs of her children, especially their education.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, patis, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 36, is a hard-working mother of four school-age children who aims to become successful someday. She wants to continue sending her children to school and earn degrees to become professionals in the future. To generates income, the family members help each other in managing their rice farming business within their village. They have operated this business for more than 10 years and usually earn a profit of P26,000 every harvest season. They want to increase their yields and income to satisfy their needs, and finance the childrens' education. Elena wants to ask for additional capital of P10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the maintenance of their farm. They hope that they will be able to increase their yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farming business

loans.name: Laure Nougnimè

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans Laure Nougnimè est marié à un cuisinier du nom de Célestin. Le couple à deux enfants,tous scolarisés et n'étant plus à leur charge.Laure Nougnimè n'a jamais été à l’école Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille Laure Nougnimè prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend dans une cafétéria.Laure Nougnimè exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans environ.Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité Laure Nougnimè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille.Laure Nougnimè s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Laure Nougnimè Rosine sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus par Laure Nougnimè ont été bien remboursés.Laure Nougnimè ambitionne dans l'avenir équiper d'avantage sa cafétéria.
texts.en:
36-year-old Laure Nougnimè is married to a cook called Célestin.  The couple have two children who are both in school and no longer dependent on them.  Laure Nougnimè never went to school.  In order to cover her own needs, as well as those of her family, she prepares food which she sells in a café.  She has been in this business for approximately 13 years.  Thanks to the income that she makes in this business, she contributes towards her family's expenses.  She stocks up in one of the markets in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customers and improve her standard of living and income, Laure Nougnimè is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Her first two loans were repaid on time.  In the future, she plans to further equip her café.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned food, sauce seasonings and Dinor-brand oil

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en: Marlina is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children and has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Marlina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a butcher shop.

loans.name: Bidii Kazini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Kazini Group in Western Kenya! Annah is the facilitator of Bidii Kazini group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Annah takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Annah had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Annah was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Annah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Annah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii Kazini group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture the Field Officer is featured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella is a female motorcycle operator. She is 34 years old and blessed with four children. She has already been working in this occupation for one year and is earning PHP 300 per day, which is usually deficient given the expenses to put her children through school.

As a woman, it is difficult for her to be a tricycle operator. However, she still pursues it rather than stay at home. To maintain the strength of her motorcycle to travel, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy paint, new reserve tires and oil.

She hopes through this loan that she will be able to generate more income so she can better meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy paint, new reserve tires and oil

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 58 years old. She is married with five children.  Elda has a food shop that makes and sells snacks like siopao, suman and hotcakes.  She has had this business for six years. 

Elda requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make snacks.  Since 2010, Elda has been a member of Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI).  In the future, Elda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make snacks for sale.

loans.name: Muungano Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muungano OAF Group in Western Kenya! Joab is the facilitator of the Muungano OAF group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joab takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joab had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joab was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joab and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joab will  pay for school fees and other household expenses. In 2012, the members of Muungano OAF group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is featured standing on the left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 years old and married to Nelson.  Together they have two children who both attend school. Pauline operates a dressmaking shop. She has been in this business for the last ten years and earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Pauline has a good credit history with Kiva partner KADET.  She is applying for a second loan of KES 80,000 that she plans to use to purchase pieces of cloth to make more dresses.  Her efforts will allow her to offer more variety for her clients. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Pauline hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase pieces of cloth to make more dresses for sale.

loans.name: Balikyewuunya Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 50-year-old, single mother of four children who lives in Kyenjojo,Uganda.  She bears the responsibility of looking after her family.  Teddy's dream is to educate her children to the university level.  For eight years she has been selling local brew.  The income she has earned has enabled her to pay the school fees for her children.  Her challenge is price fluctuation and her dream is to own a store that can supply the whole region.

Teddy requests a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew for to sell.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда умная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и у неё трое детей. Она живет со своей семьей вместе со свекрови. Она занимается купля продажей женских нижних белья более 3 лет. Она работает усердно для того чтобы содержит свою семью в хороших условиях и обеспечить своих детей во всем. Она хочет, чтобы её дети учились в хороших университетах и школах, поэтому она старается расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и поощрение.
texts.en: Mavchuda is a smart and conscientious person.  She is married and has three children.  She lives with her family together with her mother-in-law.  Mavchuda has been involved in buying and selling undergarments for over 3 years.  She works diligently in order to keep her family in good conditions and provide her children with everything.  She wants her children to attend good universities and schools, and this is why she tries to expand her business and maximize her profit.  She thanks all of you for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to purchase women's undergarments

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy, a 22-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a food shop or carenderia selling viands such as adobo and pancit bihon for 5 years. A new member of HSPFI, Mary Joy is requesting  a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 24 years old and lives in the village of Geguti with his parents and two sisters, aged 31 and 28 years old, the eldest a hairdresser. The rest of the family is involved in family agricultural activities, using their greenhouse to grow greens from October through May, and cucumbers and tomatoes during the summer months. The harvested greens are sold to local wholesalers, while Otar sells the vegetables at the local open market. Total average monthly family income is 570 Laris (approximately 340 USD).

Otar has requested a loan to purchase wooden materials for the construction of a second greenhouse, an addition that will increase the income of the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 53-year-old single lady. She sells cereals and lesos (African fabric) in Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last two years. 

Florence was recently introduced to KADET, and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. Her business is doing well, and with this loan, she plans to add more stock of a variety of cereals and lesos into her business. The anticipated profits generated from the business will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To add more stock of a variety of cereals and lesos (African fabric).

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.   Analou has a retail shop that sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. 

Analou  requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more green & yellow bananas to sell.  Analou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,  she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Bidii Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii OAF Group in Western Kenya! Ahmed is the facilitator of Bidii OAF group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ahmed takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ahmed had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Ahmed was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ahmed and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ahmed will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii OAF group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is from Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has two children. Anecita is engaged in an agricultural business, specializing in buying coconut to make copra and selling it to her contract buyer.  With this business, she is able to earn PHP 4000 a month. She requested a loan for PHP 6000 to buy more coconut for copra.

Anecita join GDMPC in 2010.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a vehicle for copra delivery.

loans.use: buy coconut for copra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a DVD player and a UPS

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Маъмурджону 46 лет. Он  начал свой бизнес с 2000 Сомони. Он женат, у него 2 совершеннолетних детей. Маъмурджон имеет магазин площадью 203 кв.м Он занимается куплей и продажей обуви, одежды и парфюмерии. Маъмурджон  является владельцем этого бизнеса. В бизнесе участвует его жена. Он хочет расширить бизнес, но не имеет достаточных средств. Ему нужен займ на сумму 13000 Cомони, это поможет ему расширить и развить бизнес, что принесет пользу и семейному бюджету.
texts.en: Mamurjon is 46 years old.  He started his business with 2000 Somoni.  He is married and has two adolescent children.  Mamurjon has a 203 square meters store.  He is involved in buying and selling shoes, clothing and perfumery.  Mamurjon is the owner of this business.  His wife participates in this business too.  He wants to expand his business, but does not have sufficient funds.  He needs a loan in the sum of 13000 Somoni, which will help him to expand and develop his business and benefit the family budget as well.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and expand his business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is from Magsaysay, Balingao Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years of age, married, and has six children.  Leonida is in  the general store business, operating a specialized retail store to earn a living.  She sell a variety of products and has been engaged in this business for six years. Each month, she has a return of Php 4,500. 

Leonida requested a loan for Php 6000 to buy supplementary goods to vend.  She joined GDMPC in the year 2010. She is now on the fourth loan cycle. In the future, Leonida wants to increase her business to have more return to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second hand and new clothes to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a loving mother of two. She is married and her children are now attending school. Because of difficulties in providing her children their needs, Jocelyn’s husband goes abroad and works as a driver. Her husband's remittances are used for the household expense of their family in the Philippines.
With the determination to help her husband provide for their children's expenses, Jocelyn started a hog-raising business one year ago. Because of delayed remittances from her husband, she is not able to meet the maintenance of her hogs on time. Jocelyn made a decision to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She looks forward to the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of body lotions, hair food, beauty creams and hair extensions

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина умная, самостоятельная . Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем. Зарина уже 5 лет  занимается продажей тканей. Она одна в бизнесе, никто из членов семьи ей не помогает. У Зарины есть торговая точка на рынке. Она решительная и смелая и старается всегда идти вперед. У  Зарины много клиентов, потому что ее товар качественный и  имеет спрос. Она хочет получить кредит для покупки товаров, чтобы развить бизнес и пополнить капитал.
texts.en: Zarina is smart and independent.  She is 25 years old and single.  Zarina has been involved in selling fabrics for five years.  She is alone in this business, and none of her family members help her.  Zarina has a retail outlet at the market.  She is decisive and smart and tries to always move ahead.  Zarina has many customers because her merchandise is of high quality and is in demand.  She wants to obtain a loan to buy merchandise in order to develop her business and refill the capital.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in order to develop business and refill capital

loans.name: Wolfat

texts.en:
Wolfat is a conservative woman, so her husband, Ashraf, is photographed instead.

Wolfat is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and her husband is a carpenter and has his own workshop. Wolfat wants to help her husband in purchasing a new carpentry kit to improve the quality of his work, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of 1,500 USD from FATEN. When Wolfat gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband in purchasing his new carpentry kit. This will improve his work and increase his income and offer to his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new carpentry kit

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 32 years old, married to Morris, and together they are blessed with four children. She is a green grocer who mainly sells tomatoes at a market in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last 8 years and gets an income of 4,600 KES per month.

Mercy has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her third loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD which she plans to use to purchase crates of tomatoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest back to the business and educate her children.

Mercy hopes to expand her business, improve the living standards of her children and educate them to college. She is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр честный и трудолюбивый мужчина. У него замечательная жена и 3-е несовершеннолетних детей. Он занимается куплей и продажей скота более 20 лет, то есть имеет большой опыт в этом деле. Торгует скотом на рынках региона. Этот вид деятельности  приносит  хорошую прибыль и бизнесу и семейному бюджету. Бахтиёр хочет получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки скота и расширения бизнеса. Он  надеется, что вы поддержите его и заранее благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is an honest and hard-working man.  He has a wonderful wife and three adolescent children.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 20 years and has an extensive experience in this business.  He sells livestock at the district markets.  This business bring in a good profit both to the business and the family budget.  Bahtiyor wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock and expanding his business.  He hopes that you will support him and thanks you for the understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is divorced and has 5 children. Theresa sells drinks at Kufur near Elmina, which she has done for 12 years. She also sells red-peppers (on the floor in the photo). It has not been easy as a single parent having to take care of 5 children and so Theresa needs a loan to expand her business to be able to take care of her family. The loan will be used to procure drinks to sell.

loans.use: to procure drinks to sell

loans.name: Muchakata Group

texts.en:
Lovemore is 30 years old and lives in Masvingo with his wife and only child, who is seven years old and attends school.  

Lovemore works in the local market selling matemba, a small dried fish. His wife helps him. They have been doing this for 4 years. The main limit to growth is a lack of capital. Lovemore will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. He will use the profit to ensure a better future for his child and pay school fees.  

In the future, they would like to wholesale and package matemba as well as sell them retail.

loans.use: to buy matemba (dried fish)

loans.name: Ndania

texts.en:
Ndania is 52 years old, married to Aaron, and together they have three children ages 25, 17 and 15 years old. Ndania sells poultry and also eggs. She has been in the business for the past 6 years. She gets a monthly income of 3,500 KES from her business.

This is her third loan term from KADET. She paid her previous loans successfully. Ndania will use the loan amount to buy more chicks and also buy eggs for resale. She will buy more poultry with extra profits she will get. Her dream is to sell eggs on a large scale.

loans.use: purchase chicks and eggs

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida has completed her education to 8th standard and is a married lady. She operates a grocery store to supplement the income for her family. Her grocery store is very famous among the customers due to her quality products and reasonable prices. Her husband is a loader and operates a loading and unloading business. He has a donkey cart on which he loads goods and delivers to the designated places.

Zahida is the mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Her daughter reads in 8th standard, her elder son is in 6th standard, and her younger son is in 5th standard.

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk to stock her store. She is confident that with the increased stock she will increase her sales and earns better profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
