Paul is 37 years old. He and his wife Jane have two children. He is a shopkeeper and has been in the business for the past 12 years. He gets a monthly income of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from the business.

This is his third loan term in KADET. He repaid his previous loans successfully and he will use this loan to buy more stock of sugar, wheat flour, and maize meal for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to increase stock in his business. His dream is to expand his shop to a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat). She also sells soft drinks such as malt, Fanta, Sprite, and others. She is married to a teacher and together they are blessed with five children. She assists her partner to provide the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook to sell, and drinks to sell. She anticipates renovating the chop bar.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook to sell, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes, plates, shoes, and blankets.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Шоисте 55 года. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Шоиста 13 лет занимается  предпринимательской деятельностью. Она  занимается продажей  овощей, таких как картофель, лук, капуста, морковь. Этим видом деятельности она занимается самостоятельно. Она продает свежие и отборные овощи, поэтому у нее много клиентов. Шоиста хотела бы получить займ для пополнения оборотных средств, она надеется, что вы не откажете в поддержке.
texts.en: Shoista is 55 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Shoista has been involved in an entrepreneurship for 13 years.  She sells vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, cabbage and carrots.  She runs this business independently.  Shoista sells fresh and selected vegetables and, hence, has many clients.  Shoista wanted to obtain a loan to refill her revolving capital and hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to refill the revolving capital

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells "banku" (a local dish made of maize), provisions and food items at Elmina. The small display case/shop beside her has food items displayed in it. Items she sells are okra, tomatoes, garden eggs (small eggplants), salted fish and others. She wants a loan from Kiva to expand range of food items she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better shop.

loans.use: to expand the range of food items she sells.

loans.name: Papanggo Merdeka 1 Group

texts.en:
Entin is 46 years old and married with three children. She is pictured in the middle wearing the white shirt. Her business is selling clothes on credit and she has been doing this for four years. Her business is doing well but she wants to take the loan to increase her customer base by having more inventory. She sells clothing door-to-door around her neighborhood.

She uses the income from her business to help pay the school fees for her children. Her hopes for the future are that her children will have the education to get a better job that she has had.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell on credit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, cassava, bananas, sugar, oil and vegetables to be cooked and sold in the food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure more food items such as tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rodiena

texts.en: Rodiena is a 35-year-old woman who is married with two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. Rodiena wants to complete some finishing parts of her house, mainly one room and a bathroom. However, she doesn't have enough money to pay for them, so she needs to take out a loan of $3,000 from Kiva's partner, FATEN. When Rodiena gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to complete her house and live in better and healthier conditions with her family. Rodiena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN office.

loans.use: To pay for finishing parts of her house.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддину  52 лет. Он женат у него 5 детей. Камолиддин предприниматель со стажем, уже 14 лет он занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. У Камолиддина  5 га земли, на котором он выращивает  лук, пшеница, кукуруза, зерно и другое.  Полученный урожай он продает на  местном рынке, у него качественный, отборный урожай, поэтому у него много клиентов.  Камолиддин  хочет получить займ на сумму  $3000 CША, чтобы  расширить свой бизнес, это принесет доход семье и населению, чем больше продуктов, тем ниже будет цена.
texts.en: Kamoliddin is 52 years old.  He is married and has five children.  Kamoliddin is an experienced entrepreneur; he has been involved in growing and sales of agricultural products for 14 years.  He has 5 hectares of land, where he grows onions, wheat, corn, crops and others.  He sells his harvest at the local market.  Kamoliddin has a quality, selected harvest and, hence, has many clients.  Kamoliddin wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 in order to expand his business, which will benefit the family and residents because the more products he has, the lower the price will be.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi operates a shop stocked with provisions at Kufur, near Elmina in Cape Coast. Esi has 3 children. She is responsible for the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell in her shop

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa acquires fresh fish from the market and sells them in the community of Elmina. She has 5 children and is married to a driver. Adjoa has been a fish monger for 8 years. She helps her companion to take care of the home. Her loan will add to her capital to buy fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy land.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Matahari Terbit Iv Group

texts.en: Endang has two businesses: one selling snacks and one washing laundry. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She has had her businesses for two years now. Already the income from her businesses has enabled her to buy a refrigerator for her family. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she will use it to improve her snack business. She hopes that in the future she will have enough savings from her businesses to buy a washing machine. Her hope for her family is that she will have enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make a greater variety of snacks to sell

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa is 51 years old. She is married and has two children below 15 years of age. She lives in a seven bedroom apartment in Ntamulung, in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The major challenges she has faced in her life have been the lack of capital to start up her business, sicknesses in her family, the death of some close relatives like her elder sister and her aunts and uncles, and also when thieves broke into her house and made away with some of her valuables.

She joined Kiva's partner, GHAPE, in 2005 and has received and successfully repaid empowerment credits (ECs) four times. She invested her past ECs into frying and selling gateaux and also into poultry farming. She used the profits from these past loans to cater to her family, sponsor her children in school and to support her husband in the construction of their family house.

With the requested loan, she will stock up on red oil and vegetable oil, as well as buy fowls and pigs for her poultry and piggery. She strongly believes this business will be a success because she has so many customers already. This business activity will also be of great help to the community because it will increase the availability of ready-made food to the people in her area and their distance to the market will be reduced.

With the proceeds from this loan, she will be able to provide for her family, pay her children’s school fees, and support her husband financially. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate is relatively lower and also because the monthly installment method of repayment is convenient to her.

loans.use: to buy oil, fowls and pigs

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells aluminum pans, coal pots and charcoal in Elmina. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband with taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more pans to increase the variety of her stock. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to acquire other varieties of pans to expand her business

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is married and has 2 children. She is a fish monger in Elmina. In the photo, Marian is standing close to the traditional oven she uses to smoke the fish. Her husband is a mason. Marian helps her husband to educate, feed and clothe their children. Marian will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Abdurafik

texts.ru: Абдурафик является отцом троих детей. Женат. Он занимается предоставлением транспортных услуг. Он любить свою семью и хочет содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Он запрашивает займ для установления газового оборудования. Так как расходы по ГСМ- бензину слишком дороги и не оправдывают услуги такси.
texts.en: Abdurafik is a father of three children.  He is married.  He is involved in providing transportation services.  Abdurafik loves his family and wants to provide a good quality of life for them.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $325 in order to install gas equipment.  Petrol gasoline expenses are too high and do not justify a taxi service.

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow taking care of 7 children.  Ama is a fish monger in Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. In the photo, she is showing some of the fresh fish she will prepare to be smoked. Ama will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest for further growth and to take care of her home.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 31-year-old man, married with one son. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Rami wants to make some necessary repairs to his house, such as changing tiles, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for it, so he needs to take out a loan of $1,200 from FATEN. With the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for making the repairs he needs in his house. This will enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. 

Rami is in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for repairing his house.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana cooks a variety of foods to sell in Kufur near Elmina. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a security man. She helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook and sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a restaurant one day.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fish for stock

loans.name: Kebon Bawang 3 Group

texts.en:
Rini has been selling clothes on credit for four years. She wants to now start selling electronics on credit. Rini is 37 years old and married with three children. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She hopes she can increase her customers and her profits by switching to the electronics business. She uses the income from her business to help pay the school fees for her children. Her hope for her family is that someday they will have enough money to build a house.

Rini is pictured standing in the middle back wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy electronics to resell on credit

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is divorced and has eight children. Theresa sells gari, beans, and other types of cereals. She sells the cereals at the Market and at the time of the visit, she was at home and had just this quantity to show. The loan, when obtained, will serve as additional capital to buy more cereals to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy health product supplements

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан женат, возраст 26 лет, образование высшее.  По специальности Хусан преподаватель,  кроме этого он занимается агробизнесом, то есть занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. В этом бизнесе ему помогает жена, вместе они хотят расширить бизнес. Хусану  нужен займ  на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Husan is 26 years old, has a higher education and is married.  Husan is a teacher and besides that, is also involved in agricultural business, more precisely, he is involved in growing agricultural crops.  His wife helps him in this business, and together, they want to expand this business.  Husan needs a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni to buy fertilizers in order to get a good harvest.  He hopes to get your support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Maryam operates an animal sales business. She has been operating her business for the past 10 years. Her father was also involved in this business and she got knowledge about animals from him. She buys animals from the animal market and sells to the required customers for a good profit. Her husband is involved in an agriculture profession. He is a farmer who grows different seasonal crops and sells for a good profit. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan, she will buy animals like goats & sheep to sell. She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business.

loans.use: To buy animals to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his market garden activity

loans.name: Koihan

texts.fr:
Mme KOIHAN est veuve et mère de 07 enfants Le plus âgé a 36ans et le moins âgé a 22ans. Un va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des habits depuis 18ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 complets pour enfants, 10 douzaine de soutien –gorge et 15 complets de sous vêtements.

Mme épargne ses bénéfices et paie la scolarité de son enfant. Elle ambitionne agrandir sa boutique en ajoutant des pagnes et des chaussures.
texts.en: Koihan is widowed and has seven children. Her eldest child is 36 and her youngest is 22. One of her children attends school. She has one dependent. Koihan has been selling clothes for 18 years. She stocks up at Sector 10 Market. Her customers are men and women. Koihan would like to buy 20 children's outfits, 10 dozen bras and 15 sets of underwear. Koihan saves her profits and pays for her child's education. She plans to expand her store by adding pagnes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy 20 children's outfits, 10 dozen bras and 15 sets of underwear

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa has operated as a coconut seller for the past one year. Her potential clients are people around the market area. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. 

Nadzuwa is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school, while one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who helps provide for the family's basic needs. Nadzuwa has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

With this loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, Nadzuwa wants to purchase three sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities which have low interest rates. She dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 45 years old and married to Margaret. He is a father to six children aged between 14 and 3 years. He runs a business producing and then selling charcoal. He has been in business for 11 years and right now his monthly income from the business is KSHS 80,000. 

He is borrowing a loan of KSHS 25,000, which he intends to use to buy more trees for charcoal production. This is his first loan and his dreams and hopes are to continue with his charcoal business and to build rental houses on his small piece of land as well as educate his children.

loans.use: To buy one acre of trees to burn to produce charcoal

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella est une couturière de profession, elle vie dans une ville du Sénégal. Elle fait ce métier depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tissus comme (des basins, des sois, des lins) qu'elle va confectionner pour les revendre comme des habits de prêt à porter.  Une parti de ce crédit est utilisé pour l'achat d'un nouveau machine a coudre qui va lui permettre d'être plus efficace et plus rapide dans la confection. Elle veut aussi avec les profits qu'elle aura acheter d'autres machines pour mieux répondre à la demande
texts.en: Ndella is a dressmaker by profession.  She lives in a town in Senegal.  She has been in this profession for more than 15 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics such as damask, silk and linen which she will make up and sell as off-the-peg clothes.  Ndella will use some of her loan money to buy a new sewing machine which will enable her to make her clothes more efficiently and quickly.  She would also like to use the profits that she will make to buy other machines so that she can better respond to the demand that she has.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Suh

texts.en:
He is 53 years old. He is married and has 12 children with one of them younger than 15 years old. The major challenge he has faced in his life has been sicknesses and the death of some of his children.

He joint GHAPE in 1998 and has successfully received and repaid empowerment credit seven times. He invested his past loans in his motorbike transport business and used the profits to sponsor his children in school, and to feed, clothe and provide medication for his family.

Given a loan, he will buy a new motorbike, which will be used in transportation. He believes that this business will be a success because he is has had this business for a long time. He has a good driver who is his son, and he has enough customers. This business will be of great help to the community in that it will provide transportation services to the people in his locality, making movement easier. It will also ease the transportation of farm produce from the farms to the markets.

He will use the proceeds from his loan to open a workshop for his daughter, pay school fees for his children and feed and provide medication for his family. He prefers a GHAPE loan because he likes the repayment method, the training he constantly receives and the aspect of group support.

loans.use: Purchase  a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en:
Tsiuri is 52 years old. She is from the village of Geguti, Imereti Region, West Georgia. Tsiuri is married and lives with her family: husband,Grigol; two sons (26 and 34 years old); daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (14 and 12 years old). 

All the family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, led by Tsiuri. It is the only source of income for them. They have four milk cows and sell cheese at the local market. Along with the dairy farm, the family has two greenhouses where greens, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. From October to May, the greenhouses are used for growing greens, and in the summer months, they are used for growing vegetables (cucumbers and tomatoes). Harvested greens are sold to local wholesalers. As for vegetables, Tsiuri sells them at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,300 laris (approximately $780 US).

Tsiuri requested credit to purchase wooden materials for renovation of a third greenhouse. After it is renovated, Tsiuri will use it for growing greens and vegetables. She will sell more products and increase the income of the family. It will allow them to improve the living conditions for all family members, especially the children.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for greenhouse renovation

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Shamim owns & operates a boutique business. She operates her business from her home. She prepares beautiful looking clothes and sells them to different shops and also to her community clients thus earning good profits. 
Her creative & high-quality work allows her to receive good orders every month along with good profits. She does this work to supplement the family's income. 
She is not very educated but her business sense is very good and she confidently handles her clientele base. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes, lace, beads, and tussles in larger quantities to prepare beautiful looking dresses. 
She is confident that her business will expand further after the investment of the loan funds.

loans.use: To buy materials like clothes, lace, beads, and tussles for her boutique business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes

loans.name: Noonkokua

texts.en:
Noonkokua is a 36-year-old married lady. She has three children who depend on her. She has been a farmer in Narok, Kenya for a period of six years with an income of about KES 6,000 per month.

Noonkokua learned about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. She accessed a previous loan, which she repaid successfully without any complications. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizers. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Zarina Mai's Group

texts.en:
Zarina mai is married with five children: two boys and three girls. Her elder son operates a grocery store in the community market to financially contribute to the family. Her younger son is in 8th standard while her eldest daughter is in 4th. The one younger to her is in 3rd and the youngest one is in 2nd standard. Her husband is an employee of the Pakistan railways on a monthly wage. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to be able to fulfill the demands of his clients on time and earn good profits. Zarina is hopeful that her son's business will return good profits after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk to resell

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman with five children who have all completed their studies. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a charcoal buying and selling business for the past six years; in addition she also offers phone charging (prepaid credits) services. Her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of improving her living standards.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is 51 years old. He is married to Virginia and together they have two children aged nine and 17 years. He is a horticultural farmer, farming watermelons and tomatoes. He has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the business.

This is his third loan from KADET. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to buy melon and tomato seedlings. 

The anticipated profits will be used to expand his business. He hopes to be the best supplier in his area.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon and tomato seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 37 years old. He is married to Anastaciah and together they have six children between 17 and 2 years old. He sells poultry and he has been in the business for the past 14 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 3,500.

This is his second loan from KADET. He paid his previous loan successfull and he will use half the loan to cultivate his farm and the rest to buy chickens as stock for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to improve the living standards of his family and educate his children. 

His dream is to educate the community about poultry keeping through the KADET financial group and have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to cultivate land and purchase chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spools of fabric and pay school fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years old, married to Charles. She sells poultry and has been in the business for the past eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 3,500.

This is her third loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy poultry. She will buy dairy cattle with the anticipated profits. Her dream is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old, married to Kariuki, a retired teacher. Together they have four children aged 35, 30, 27 and 24 years. She is a charcoal seller and has been in the business for the past 12 years getting a monthly income of KES 24,000.

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal to add stock to the business. She will add more charcoal stock with the extra profit she will get.

Her dream is to open another shop for her husband to increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old. He is married to Caroline, who runs a kiosk in order to add some income to the family. He has four school-going children.

He has been in business for six years, and right now, his monthly income from the business is 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is borrowing a loan of KES 5,000 to purchase more goats for sale. This is his first loan, and his dreams and hopes are to buy a plot of land and construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and is married with two children. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has employed four people. Previously, she used to run a grocery. She has been able to grow her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  

She has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, washing detergents and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Jerald

texts.en:
Jerald is a 34-year-old single man. Jerald was recently introduced to KADET. He runs a cosmetics shop in Mariakani. 

He has been running this business for the past one year. This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD., and with this loan he plans to purchase a variety of body lotions, hair food, beauty creams and hair extensions.

The anticipated profits that will be generated will be plowed back into the business and the repayment of the loan. His dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of body lotions, hair food, beauty creams and hair extensions.

loans.name: Nafees Begum's Group

texts.en:
Nafees Begum has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to be able to fulfill the orders on time and increase her sales. 

She has been operating her business for past 10 years. She does this work to supplement the income of her family.  

Nafees is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son works in a private company and the younger one is in class one, while her younger daughter is in 4th standard. 

Nafees is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao is a 33-year-old married man. He runs a retail shop in Kilifi. He has been running this business for the last four years. 

Kitsao has been a KADET  LTD client and this marks his second borrowing from KADET. With this loan, he plans to add more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize meal into his business. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business. In the future, he would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to add more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize meal.

loans.name: Matiasi

texts.en:
Matiasi is married. He has three children, aged eight, 11 and 18 years. He is a livestock trader and has been in the business for the past 15 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 30,000 from his business. This is Matiasi's first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to buy more livestock for resale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to upgrade his family`s living standard and to educate his children. His hope is to have a sustainable income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan to expand his business premises. With a more spacious business premise, he was able to stock more goods in his shop. He improved his business, hence raising his standard of living.

Now, Peter has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, to buy iron sheeting.

loans.use: to buy iron sheet.

loans.name: Mbi

texts.en:
Mbi is 28years old. She is married and has five children, three of these children are younger than fifteen years of age. The major challenge she has faced in her life was the death of her husband and father, which led to a lot of difficulty involving in bringing up her children.

She joint GHAPE in 2008 and has successfully received and repaid Empowerment credit two times. She invested her last loans in the business of poultry sales and the sale of drinks. She used the profits to pay for her children’s school fees and also to expand her off-license business.
 
Given a loan, Mbi will indulge in the buying and selling of raw food stuff like maize, beans, palm oil, and also in the sale of drinks. She believes that this business will be a success because she has experience in it. This business will be of great help to the community in that the fowls will increase protein intake of the people in her community, the fowl’s droppings will be a source of manure, which will lead to improved yields. It will also increase the supply of readymade food, thereby saving time for people who do not have enough time to cook in their houses.

With the profit from her loan, she will buy school needs for her children. Part of the loan will be invested back into the business to increase capital. She prefers a GHAPE loan because GHAPE encourages and follows up their members, the interest rates are lower and also because of the group system.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, palm oil, drinks, fowls and fowl feed.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 51 years old. She lives in the village Alambari, West Georgia. Nunu is married and lives with her family: husband – Osman, three sons (30, 26 and 23 years old), daughter in law and mother in law. The family receives social assistance from the country. They earn their living through agriculture. The family owns 1 milking cow. Nunu produces cheese and sells it locally. They also grow tangerines and maize on 5000 sq meters of land. Harvested tangerine and maize are sold on the local open market. Though all family members work hard, their total average monthly income, including the social assistance, is 605 Laris (approximately 365 USD). 

With the requested credit, Nunu will purchase hay in Kakheti Region, where the price is relatively low. She will resell the hay in her village for a higher price and earn a profit. Nunu will spend the additional profit on the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hay for resale.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret is 28 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Magaret is a poultry farmer in Kilifi. Her business has been in operation for the last four years. 

Magaret was recently introduced to KADET LTD. by one of KADET's client and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more chicks for rearing and selling. 

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful business entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a businesswoman who sells clothes.  She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  Besides, she does farming to boost her income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her business, hence more income. She desires to open other outlets of her business in five years. She has requested for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes. Jenifer is married and a mother of three.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Wanyoike

texts.en:
Wanyoike is 43 years old, married and has three children in school. To earn a living, he does welding.  He mainly makes metallic doors and windows.  He has been in the business for five years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business, and therefore improved his standard of living. He also does farming to supplement his income.

Wanyoike hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Abong

texts.en:
She is 46 years old. She is single and has four children, three of whom are younger than 15 years old. She lives in a 10-bedroom apartment with her children at Ntamulung in Bamenda, Mezam Division in the North West Region of Cameroon. The main challenge she has faced in her life has been the death of her father, sicknesses and the lack of capital to start up a business. 

She joined GHAPE in 2005 and has since then received and repaid Empowerment Credit four times. She invested her past loans in farming, neathing and in the retail of some Tianshi products. She used the profit from these activities to buy books, pay school fees and to feed and clothe her family. Given a loan, she will invest in the retail of Tianshi food supplements, in farming and to buy and sell raw foodstuffs. She believes that this business will be a success because her prices are moderate and she already has a good number of customers. This business activity will be of help to the community in that it will reduce the distance they would have traveled to the market to get foodstuff. Her farming activity will increase the quantity of food available in the market for the people in her community.

She will use the profit from this business to pay fees for her children and to dress them. In addition, she will use part of the profit to buy a plot and build a good house for the family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate is lower and she likes the method of repayment.

loans.use: to buy Tianshi food supplements, foodstuffs and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Mwinza

texts.en: Mwinza is married and blessed with two children. For the last five years, she has been managing a grocery to bring up the family. She has retained the business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy potatoes and tomatoes for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 23 years old and married. His spouse is Phyllis who is just a housewife. They are blessed with two children who are seven and two years old. 

He owns a food store in Murkurai trading center where he buys and sells cereals. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000. He has applied for his first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD and hopes to use the money to purchase more cereals for his store.  

The profits will be used to pay school fees for his children and to purchase more cereals for his business. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last 11 years, he has been selling timber to earn a living. He also operates a transport business to increase his savings. He has employed three people to help him to manage the business. Peter is able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become a good saver. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more timber for resale.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
The borrower is 39 years old. She is a widow with two children: one is younger than fifteen years. She has gone through very difficult times in her life like the death of her children and difficulties in single handedly caring for her children, theft and lack of capital with which to start a business of her own.

She joined GHAPE in 2010 and has received and repaid empowerment credit just once. She invested this loan in the sale of wood and the making of traditional dresses. She used the profits to feed, cloth and provide medication for her children.

Given a loan, she intends to buy and retail maize and also invest in her dress-making business. She believes that this business will succeed because it is well located and she has a good knowledge of this business. This business activity will be of great help to the community: her products will be  accessible to locals thereby saving the time it would have taken to buy them from the market. 

With the profit from her loan, she will open an account in the credit union where she will save some money. She will take care of her family and and also support her extended relatives. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the method of repayment is easier and because of the training that GHAPE gives its members.

loans.use: to buy maize, thread and fabric

loans.name: Nkel Group

texts.en:
Fabiola, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school. The oldest one is independent. She has been a food vendor for four years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy land, a fridge, plastic chairs and food stock. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to renovate the place where she sells food by laying floor tiles and also to buy items missing from her food stock. Her dream is to, one day, be able to buy a car.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Nikel" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food stock and floor tiles for her workplace.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 25 years old and supports a family of three. He owns a farm in Mukururai location where he practices dairy farming. 

He has been operating for three years earning a monthly income of KES.5,000.
Sammy joined KADET LTD and has applied for a loan of KES.10,000 as his first term loan. He hopes to use this money to buy another dairy cow.

His dream is to improve his dairy breed to be the best.

loans.use: To purchase another cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking business woman aged 52. She is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. She has been selling scrap metals for recycling for the past three years. She also does farming to earn extra income. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy more scrap metals for resale.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Gvara, Adjara Region, West Georgia. Revaz lives with his family: wife – Mzia, 24 year-old-son, daughter-in-law and 5 year-old-granddaughter. Mzia works as teacher in the village. The rest of the adult family members are involved in family farming activities.

Revaz is leading the agricultural business of the family. They grow tangerines, lemons, oranges and nuts on 0.25 hectares of land. They sell their produce at the local market. Revaz and his son work hard in their garden during the year to get a good harvest in the fall. The total average income of the family is 550 Laris (approximately 340 USD). 

Revaz requested credit for a new business venture. With 1500 Laris he will purchase hay in Kakheti at a lower price and sell it in his village at a higher price. The profit will be used to purchase needed household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hay for resale

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 51 years old and an enterprising business man. He is married to Margaret who is also a business lady. He has had a quarry business as his primary business, and a farm as his secondary business, for the past three years. Together they provide a monthly income of KES 5,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Benson will use the loan to buy another quarry plot and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be a contractor which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy another quarry plot, and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. She also does farming for more income. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and eggs for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and eggs for resale

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He has been practicing farming for the last five years to support his family.  He also sells timber for more income. He has employed four people to assist him to manage the business. Geoffrey has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water pump machine for watering his farm.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for watering his farm

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is single and blessed with six children. For the last five years she has been selling charcoal to earn a living. She also does farming to earn extra income.  

In the next 5 years she wants to become the supplier of charcoal in her region. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ngina

texts.en:
Ngina is 41 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is a single mother of seven children age between 24 and 13 years. She has been operating a green grocer business in an open air market for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her children.


She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET staff member. Ngina will use the loan to buy green vegetables, fruits and potatoes to add to her stock.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes are to educate her children up to university level and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables, fruits and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is married and blessed with three children. For the last two years, he has been selling mobile phone accessories to earn a living. He also farms to earn extra income. In the next five years, Dominic wants to manage a big electronic shop. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy mobile phone chargers and batteries for resale.

loans.use: to buy phone batteries and chargers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. For the last three years, she has been practicing poultry farming to make a living. Previously, she sold vegetables. In the next five years, Florence wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seats for her house.

loans.use: to buy seats for her house.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito, tiene 32 años y es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años. 
Elva se dedica a la ventas de cereales en las ferias, y tiene 2 moto taxis, en el tiempo que esta en FINCA Peru ha podido ver todo lo que ha progresado económicamente y como persona gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal, con su mamá empezaron el negocio, ahora ella ya tiene su propio capital.
Con el préstamo que esta solicitando ella comprará cereales para llevar a las ferias, su meta es poder terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Elva is a member of the San Benito communal bank.  She is 32 years old, and she has been a member of FINCA for three years.

Elva sells grains at the fairs, and she has two “moto taxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles).  In the time that she has been with FINCA Peru she has been able to see all of the progress she has made financially and as a person.  This is thanks to the trainings she has received in her communal bank.

Elva and her mother started the business, and now she has her own capital.

She will use the requested loan to buy grains to take to the fairs.  Her goal is to be able to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy grains wholesale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and blessed with one child. He has been operating a motorbike transport business for the last three years to earn a living. He also runs a retail shop to increase his income. He has employed one person to help him to manage the business. Moses has retained this because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income. He has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, 38, is married with three children. She owns a general store selling beans, rice, maize, sugar, etc. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m until 6 p.m every day except weekends. She currently employs two people to help her.

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase the stock in her general store, such as beans, rice, maize, sugar, etc. With the profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family and will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food, such as rice, beans, maize, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito, tiene 64 años tiene 8 hijos, esta en Finca hace 2 años 
Alejandra es feriante, lleva cereales como maíz, trigo y demás cereales que encuentre, esta muy agradecida por todas las cosas que pudo aprender y también porque gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido ha podido educar a sus hijos, las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal le ayudaron a poder mejorar su negocio y el ahorro le ayuda a poder aumentar su mercadería, ahora con el préstamo comprara quinua, trigo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the San Benito communal bank.  She is 64 years old, and she has eight children.  She has been with Finca for two years.  Alejandra is a merchant, and she takes grains like corn, wheat, and other grains that she finds to sell at the fairs.

She is very grateful for all of the things she was able to learn.  She is also grateful because thanks to the loan she has received, she has been able to educate her children.  The trainings she has received in her communal bank helped her to be able to improve her business.  The savings help her to be able to increase her merchandise.

She will use the current loan to buy quinoa and wheat.

loans.use: to buy various grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes and kapenta

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 26 years old and single.   She owns a video library and has been in business for one successful year.   Angelique currently employs one person to help her run the video library. The hours of operation are from 7 a.m until 9 p.m every day. 

Angelique has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, in order to improve her business, by buying more equipment, DVDs for sale.   With any profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To expand her video library business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Fe, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años. 
Felicitas tiene dos carros y siembra papa, recuerda que el primer crédito lo invirtió en papa seca para poder vender, a ella le encanta las capacitaciones, le ayudan mucho en su vida personal como en su negocio, esta muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que recibe en Finca, ahora su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abono y llantas para sus carros, ahora su meta es poder sacar a delante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Fe” (Faith) communal bank.  She is 44 years old and has three children.  She has been a member of FINCA for two years.

Felicitas has two cars, and she grows potatoes.  She remembers that she used her first loan to buy dried potatoes to be able to sell.  She loves the trainings.  They help her a lot personally as well as in her business.  

She is very grateful for all of the support she gets from FINCA.  She will use her current loan to buy fertilizer and tires for her cars.  Her current goal is to be able to get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 47 years old, married, with two children 14 and 15 years old.  Thacienne owns a business selling charcoal. This is her 18th successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 6 a.m until 6.30 p.m every day except on Sunday. 

Thacienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her charcoal business. This will allow her to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. With any profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.  She hopes to renovate her house and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old and is single. He makes a living by selling various goods such as: lotions, biscuits, toothpaste, sugar etc. in his general store.  This is his second successful year in this business.  His store is open from 6 am until 10pm every day and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Joseph has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more inventory like cosmetics, sugar, biscuits, toothpaste, rice, soft drinks like Fanta, juice etc for sale at the store.  With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase lotions, biscuits, sugar, toothpaste etc for resale.

loans.name: Eutropia Teodosia

texts.es:
Eutropia es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 9 años.
Eutropia venda ropa a las provincias de Ayacucho, siempre tuvo el negocio de ropa y el primer préstamo lo utilizó para poder comprar ropa en cantidad, empezó con 700 soles, con los préstamos recibidos ha podido progresar, pudo hacer su casa, ahora con el préstamo que esta solicitando invertita en la compra de ropa variada de la estacion para llevar a las provincias, la meta que tiene es poder comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Eutropia is a member of Kusikuy Communal Bank.  She is 40 years old and has four children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for nine years.

Eutropia sells clothing in the provinces of Ayacucho.  She has always had the clothing business, and she used her first loan to be able to buy clothes wholesale.  She began with 700 PEN.  She has been able to make progress with the loans she received.  She managed to build her house.

With the loan she is requesting now she will buy a variety of seasonal clothes to take to the provinces.

Eutropia's goal is to be able to buy herself a car.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old and is married with six children, between the ages of 8 and 28.  Marie owns a business selling second hand clothing. This is her seventh successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day except on Saturday. 

Marie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to improve her second hand clothing business. This loan will allow her to purchase a variety of clothes for resale. With any profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business, as well as for her family.  She hopes to buy a house in future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 46 years old and is married with six children aged between 10 and 28 years. Julienne owns a business selling second hand clothing. This is her twentieth successful year in this business, and she currently employs one person to help her. The hours of her business are from 8 am until 6 pm every day, except on Saturday. 

Julienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase her second hand clothing business. This will allow her to purchase a variety of clothes for sale. With any profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.  In the future, she hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Haïgui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Haïgui est créé le 3 décembre 2007 et est composé de seize femmes qui sont issues du même quartier; elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Alima Dame la responsable est âgée de 39 ans,mariée elle est mère de trois enfants et en a quatre en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de chaussures, pagnes et fruits et a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en robe blanche-mauve avec un bonnet noir sur la tête.


Elle achète ses marchandises dans les grandes villes, la capitale et revend au marché central de la ville.  Elle  souhaite avec son prêt renforcer son activité afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille surtout sur le plan scolaire et habillement.
texts.en:
The Haïgui cooperative group was created on December 3, 2007, and is made up of 16 women from the same neighborhood; their main activity is small-scale sales.

Mrs. Alima Dame, the group leader, is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children, with a total of four children under her care.  She sells shoes,  cloth, and fruit, and has a good amount of experience.  In the photo she is standing at right in a white-and-purple dress and black cap.

She buys her products in big cities and the capital, and resells them in her town's central market.  With her loan, she wants to strengthen her business in order to earn more money.

She helps pay her family's expenses, especially schooling and clothing expenses.

loans.use: to buy products to resell.

loans.name: Kassafor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 mai 2001. Il  est  constitué de 14 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Seynabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de balais, netetou, sucre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle a pratiqué depuis plus de 20 ans.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This cooperative group was created on May 8, 2001, and is made up of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their main business is sales.

Mrs. Seynabou, with hand raised at the right of the photo, is the group leader.  She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of eight children.

She sells brooms, nététou (a local spicy seasoning), and sugar.  She has significant experience in this business, which she has been in for more than 20 years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and better develop her business.  The profits will help her improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy brooms, spices, and sugar.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 28 years old and is single. He sells shoes. Gaspard has two years in this business and he works from 7am until 6pm every day. 

Gaspard has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase a variety of shoes for resale.  With any profit, Gaspard would like to save money and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce. 

Madame Aida qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge une belle fille.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Kadiamor solidarity group was created on the 8th of May, 2001. It is made up of 7 women who are all retailers and all live in the same area.

Aida, on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is also raising one stepchild.

Aida is an experienced fish seller who has been active in this area for several years. This loan will increase her working capital and allow her to restock and develop her business activities. She will use the profits from her business to improve her family's standard of living - by buying food and clothing, paying medical expenses, etc. - and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Kayiteuli Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Diocko qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 68 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge sept autre enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de produits pharmacetique locaux. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plus de 15 ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
The Kayiteuli solidarity group was created on the 8th of May, 2001. It is made of up 10 women who are all retailers and all live in the same area,

Diocko, on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 68 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. She is also responsible for 7 more children which her parents have placed in her care.

Diocko is an experienced retailer who has been selling local pharmaceutical products for over 15 years. This loan will increase her working capital and allow her to restock and develop her business activities. She will use the profits from her business to improve her family's living conditions by buying food and new clothing, paying medical expenses, etc.

loans.use: to buy local pharmaceutical products for resale.

loans.name: Khar Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 06 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Adama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle a pratiquée depuis plus de 10 ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
The Khar Yalla solidarity group was created on the 8th of May, 2001. It is made up of 6 women who are all retailers and all live in the same area.

Adama, on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is an experienced retailer who has been selling vegetables for over 10 years. 

This loan will increase her working capital and allow her to restock and develop her business activities. She will use the profits from her business to improve her family's living conditions by buying food and clothing, paying medical expenses, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing and fruit.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Aissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle a pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
The Deggo solidarity group was created on the 8th of May, 2001. It is made up of 10 women who are all retailers and all live in the same area.

Aissatou, on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She is also responsible for 2 more children whom her parents have placed in her care.

Aissatou is an experienced retailer who has been selling vegetables for several years. This loan will increase her working capital and allow her to restock and develop her business activities. She will use the profits from her business to improve her family's living conditions by buying food and clothing, paying medical expenses, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 23 years old and he is single.  Ismael makes a living by selling a variety of goods such as: cosmetics, jewelry etc. at his store.  This is his third successful year in this business and his store is open from 7am until 8.30pm every day.  He currently employee one person to help him. 

Ismael has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more goods such as cosmetics, jewelry etc for sale at his store . With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of cosmetics, jewelry etc for sale at his store.

loans.name: Kawral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 11 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Maimouna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfants confié par son frére.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson sec, lait, café et huitre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plus de 10 ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 8, 2001. It is composed of eleven women who reside in the same district. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Maimouna, who is to the right in the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 47 years old. She is married and a mother of three. Another child was also left in her care by her brother.

She is active in the retail of dried fish, milk, coffee and oysters. She is quite experienced in this business, in which she has been involved for over ten years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her working capital and to better grow her business. The profit will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, milk, coffee and oysters.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
For three years Christine, a 27-year-old single woman, has owned and operated a shop selling clothes. The hours of her business are from 7.30 a.m until 6.30 p.m every day except Sunday.

Christine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes, and the additional profits will help her to build a secure future for both her business and her family.

loans.use: to purchase various clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kandema /dianna Malary Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kandéma  a été créé le 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Malgré plusieurs changements, il compte 14 femmes rigoureuses et travailleuses qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont  comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Sarta (assise à l’extrême droite), est  responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
 
Elle vendeuse d’habits et tissus dans son village et dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires. Elle maîtrise bien son activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de 04 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des articles vestimentaires pour la revente.

Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité serviront en parti à accroître son épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Group Kandéma was created on December 5, 2000, at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" (village bank). Despite several changes, it numbers fourteen diligent and hard-working women, who live in the same village. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Sarta (sitting all the way to the right) is the group's leader. She is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of three.

She retails clothing and fabric in her village and in various weekly markets. She is confident in her abilities, for having been involved in her business for over four years.

With her new loan, she is planning on purchasing clothing articles to retail. The profit from this activity will be used in part to increase her savings and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing articles for retail.

loans.name: Kairaba/ Dianna Malary Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KaïraB.  a été créé en 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Très solidaire entre elles, ces femmes  jouissent d’une très bonne entente, elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Hassatou Cité  (assise à l’extrême droite), est  responsable du groupe et est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est  mariée et a en charge 07 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de fruits dans le village depuis plus de 02 ans au par avant elle pratiquait l’agriculture uniquement en saison des pluies.

Avec son  nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des fruits suivant la saison en vue de les revendre dans le marché de son village.

Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans les charges pour la scolarisation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The KaïraB. group was created on the 5th of December, 2000, on the inauguration day of their "banc villageois". The group is made up of 15 women, all retailers, who all come from the same village. They are a close-knit group who get along very well.

Hassatou Cité (seated on the far right) is the group's leader. She is 52 years old, married and is raising 7 children. She has been selling fruit in her village for over 2 years. Previously, she farmed exclusively during the rainy season.

Hassatou Cité will use her part of the loan to buy seasonal fruit to resell at her village market. She will use her profits to help her husband pay for their childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Tackou Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité tackou liguéye a été créé le 16/06/2009.IL est composé de 20 femmes issues de la même zone.Elles ont pour activité principale  le commerce.

Madame oumou à l'extreme droite sur la photo en position assise,est la responsable du groupement.Elle est âgée de 42 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 06 enfants,en outre elle assure la garde deux autres enfants. 

Son activité consiste à la vente  des haricots  et des fruits.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience par rapport à ce type d'activité.

Son pret lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante de légumes et fruits pour faire face à la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est de pouvoir faire de l'élevage bovine,assurer la scolarité et les frais médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solidarity group "Tackou Liguéye" was established on June 16, 2009. It is made up of 20 women from the same area. Their main business is buying and selling.

Mrs. Oumou, sitting on the right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 42 years old, married, and the mother of six children. In addition, she has custody of two other children.

Her business consists in selling beans and fruits, a field in which she has a good experience. Her loan will enable her to get supplies of vegetables and fruits in sufficient quantities to meet customer demand.

Her goal is to be able to raise cattle, and to be able to pay for her children's healthcare and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nely's Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DE ACCHA”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Pisac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irene; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 12, 7, 3, 1 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la artesanía la socia realiza trabajos de diferentes motivos pero todos ellos recreaciones de la época andina y la llegada de los españoles, la socia realiza trabajos como ajedrez y las fichas, estas fichas son los inkas contra los españoles en la conquista, las fichas son únicas y coloridas, el tablero de madera que encierra las fichas para trasladarlas y es muy solicitada por los turistas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las diversas piezas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la realización de las diferentes fichas de ajedrez.
Los otros socios se dedican principalmente a la artesanía, ellos elaboran y venden diferentes trabajos hechos en arcilla, como ceniceros, tazas, silbatos, adornos para el hogar y la jardinería,  también una socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes, la otra socia vende verduras en el mercado central, otra socia tiene su restaurante y así cada socia con sus negocios.
La foto está dividida porque por acuerdo mutuo un grupo se reunió en una hora pactada mientras las otras dos señoras en la foto sentadas vinieron 1 hora más tarde y la otra señora está en su negocio cerca al local de reunión y no pudo asistir.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Accha communal bank, located in the district of Pisac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.  Irene, the member, is 32 years old and married with four children, ages 12, 7, 3, and 1.  

Irene works making arts and crafts.  She creates work with a variety of motifs, but all are recreations of the Andean period and the arrival of the Spaniards.  She makes artworks like chess boards, and the pieces are the Incas against the Spaniards in the Conquest.  The pieces are unique and colorful.  The wood box to carry the pieces is often requested by tourists.

Irene wants to use the loan to buy materials to make the various pieces.   She is requesting the loan to buy materials to make the different chess pieces.

The other members work primarily in arts and crafts, making and selling various works in clay such as ashtrays, cups, whistles, and home and garden decorations.  One member also has a grocery store, another sells vegetables in the central market, another has a restaurant, and so each member with her business.

The photo is divided because, by mutual agreement, one group got together at a set time, while the other two seated women in the photo came an hour later and the other one is in her place of business near the place of the meeting but was unable to attend.

Irene is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy the materials to make chess pieces.

loans.name: Kambeng/ Dianna Malary Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kambeng  a été créé le 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il compte 17 femmes très dynamiques, elles  vivent dans le même village. Elles ont  comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Alimatou  (assise à l’extrême droite), est  responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle  vend de l’huile de palme à travers les différents marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants. Cette activité elle l’a pratique depuis plus de 10 ans, elle a une bonne expérience de son travail.

Ce nouveau lui permettra de s’approvisionner au prés des fournisseurs pour la revente au détail.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kambeng group was created on the 5th of December 2000 when their village bank was inaugurated.  The group is made up of 17 very dynamic women who all live in the same village.  Their main business activity is selling goods retail.

Alimatou (seated on the far right of the photo) is the group's leader.  She is 29 years old, married, and has four children.

Alimatou sells palm oil in different weekly markets in nearby villages.  She has been in this business for more than ten years.  She has a lot of experience in her line of work.

This new loan will allow Alimatou to stock up with products from her suppliers to then re-sell retail.

With the profits that she will make from her business activity, Alimatou plans to support her husband in covering their children's school fees.

loans.use: to stock up with products from suppliers which she will re-sell retail

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 8 años.
Nelly tiene un cafetín en en Colegio, recuerda con mucha nostalgia que antes vendía en la puerta del colegio y su primer préstamo lo utilizó para poder comprar golosinas para poder vender claro que era muy poco, y así pudo progresar, ahora esta en cafetín del colegio, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a mejorar su vida y su negocio, ahora lo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, arroz y golosinas, su meta es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Florecer” (To Flourish) communal bank.  She is 33 years old, and she has two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years.

Nelly has a snack stand at a school.  She nostalgically remembers when she sold at the door to the school.  She used her first loan to buy sweets to be able to sell.  Cleary, it was very little.  She was able to progress that way, and now she has a snack stand at the school.
