She loves the trainings because they help her to improve her life and her business.  She will now use the loan to buy oil, rice, and sweets.  Her goal is to continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and sweets.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 26 años, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Renee vende golosinas y abarrotes en una carreta ubicada en la puerta de su casa, recuerda que le primer crédito que recibió lo utilizó para comprar golosinas porque antes solo vendía golosinas y de ahí fue aumentando, ahora en su negocio también vende raspadilla, su gran meta es poder terminar de construir su casa, da gracias porque le enseñaron a poder ahorrar, y así se puede trazar metas y cumplirlas. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, carne, arroz.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the Florecer Community Bank. She is 26 years old and has been with Kiva partner FINCA Peru for five years. 

Renee sells candy and groceries from a cart located at the door to her house. She remembers that the first loan she received was used to buy candy. That was all she sold at the beginning. Since then her business has expanded, and she now sells snow cones too. 

Her biggest goal is to finish building her house. She is grateful to her Community Bank which has taught her how to save, how to set goals, and how to reach them. 

With the money from the loan, Renee plans to buy sugar, meat, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, meat, and rice

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité deggo a été créé le 16/06/2009.IL est composé de 22 femmes issues de la même zone.Elles ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Madame Fatoumata est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 23 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.En outre elle s'occupe de deux autres enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de vêtements pour femmes et enfants.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante et en qualité de vêtements pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d'augmenter. 

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants en charge et se procurer un fonds de commerce pour l'ouverture de sa boutique.
texts.en:
The Deggo solidarity group was created on the 16th of June 2009.  It is made up of 22 women from the same area.  Their main business activity is commerce.  

Fatoumata is the group's leader.  She is 23 years old, married, and has three children.  She also cares for two other children.

Fatoumata's business is selling women's and children's clothes.  She has good experience in this line of work.

Fatoumata's loan will allow her to stock up with a sufficient quantity and quality of clothes so that she can meet the demands of her customers who continue to increase in number.

Fatoumata's goal is to cover the school and health expenses of the children she cares for and to obtain business funds with which to open a store.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Nancy Esperanza

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos. 
Nancy tiene una tienda en la provincia de Independencia, también tiene un camión que lleva carga de cualquier tipo, ella actualmente trabaja como secretaria en una agencia de viajes a la Selva, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que le ayudan a poder administrar mejor su negocio, el ahorro le ayuda a poder comprarse algo cada cierre, ahora con el préstamo comprará llantas e invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para la tienda, la meta que tiene es poder comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "Florecer" communal bank. She is 29 and has two children. Nancy has a store in the province of Independencia. She also has a truck that carries cargo of any type. Currently she works as a secretary in a travel agency that arranges jungle trips. 

She really likes the training sessions that help her run her business better.  Her savings help her to buy something she needs after every close of business. Now with the loan she will buy tires, and groceries for the store. Her goal is to be able to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le nom Bokk Jom est choisi pour illustrer leur  solidarité et leur amour pour le travail, le groupe est créé depuis le 4 décembre 2007,il est composé de sept femmes qui sont amies et voisines de longue date.Les femmes ont comme activité principale le commerce.

La responsable madame Yacine est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants et a en charge ses quatre neveux; elle mène une activité de transformation d'huile palmiste avec l'appui d'une société de la place depuis un an mais elle a toujours vendu du couscous et a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à l'extrême droit habillée en blanc et a levé la main droite.

Elle se ravitaille sur place et vend au marché central de la ville.

Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter la quantité à produire pour le couscous et les palmistes afin de gagner plus de revenus.
Elle souhaite aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et soutenir ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins et aussi leur acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
The name 'Bokk Jom' was chosen to illustrate this group's solidarity and their love for work.  The group was created on December 4th, 2007.  It has seven [female] members who are longstanding friends and neighbors.  The women's main business activity is commerce.

The leader of this group is 49-year-old Yacine.  She is married and has two children.  She is also responsible for her four nieces and nephews.  She has been running a business transforming palm oil with the support of a local company for one year.  She has also always sold couscous and has good experience in this line of work.  Yacine is the lady who is standing on the far right of this photo dressed in white and raising her right hand.

Yacine obtains fresh supplies close by and makes her sales in the central town market.

This loan will allow Yacine to increase the quantity of couscous that she produces and the amount of palm kernels she transforms so that she can earn more income.  Yacine hopes to help her husband with their daily expenses and to support their children with their various needs.  She would also like to buy them a plot of land.

loans.use: to transform food products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda de 35 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos menores, convive con su pareja cerca de 11 años. Toda ésta familia vive en una casa propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a las labores del campo. Cuenta con 3 parcelas de su propiedad, en las que siembran café, achiote y yuca, De los cuales, al cosechar el café lo llevan a la ciudad de Pichanaki para su comecialización. Considera rentable este trabajo, pues el kilo de café lo venden de 10 a 12 soles. El principal problema que tuvo que afrontar fue la falta de presupuesto para ampliar sus sembríos y pagar la mano de obra, inconveniente que solucionaron con el tiempo y esfuerzo. Lo que anhela por ahora es mejorar su hogar, y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida y comodidades a sus hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP y su banco comunal, por lo que se siente contenta y esperanzada. Con el dinero del préstamo ella reemplazará el techo de palos de su casa por uno de madera y calaminas, por el momento.
texts.en: Erlinda, 35, has five minor children.  She lives with her spouse of eleven years.  The entire family lives in their own house.  She and her husband work in the fields.  She owns three parcels where they grow coffee, annatto and manioc.  When the coffee is harvested it’s taken to the city of Pichanaki to be sold.  She considers the business to be profitable because the kilogram of coffee sells for 10 to 12 soles.  The main problem she faced was lack of budget to expand planting and to pay labor costs, an inconvenience they overcame with time and effort.  What she wants now is to make some home improvements and provide better conditions and more comfort for her children.  This is the first time’s she’s worked with MFP and her communal bank so she feels happy and hopeful.  She will use the money from the loan to replace her stick roof with wood and plywood for now.

loans.use: to buy lumber and plywood for her roof.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es chofer; trabaja repartiendo distintos productos por menor a  tiendas en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, específicamente para  reparar el motor de su vehiculo. Esta es la única actividad que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Es la primera vez que Juan obtiene un crédito.
texts.en: Juan is a driver; her works delivering various retail products to stores in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle, specifically for engine repairs.  This is the only activity he has to help cover family expenses.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Temladerani zone.  He’s married and has three children.  This is the first time Juan’s gotten a loan.

loans.use: to service his delivery truck.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl con 50 años de edad convive con su pareja cerca de 10 años, ambos tienen 7 hijos pero viven solo con 6 en una casa propia. Saúl es agricultor desde niño, esta actividad la inculca a sus hijos, quienes también ayudan en las labores del campo. Así también prepara “masato” (bebida tradicional de la selva preparada a base de yuca fermentada), para la venta a visitantes. De sus 5 parcelas de terreno solo produce media parcela en la que siembra: café, yuca, achiote y kión. “Tenemos el terreno, lo que nos falta es capital para producir en mayor cantidad”, señala como principal problema. Además agrega que, al obtener ganancias gracias a la explotación de todas sus tierras podrán alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida, materializada en una casa remodelada, un nuevo techo, comprar nuevos artefactos para su cocina, etc. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP y el banco comunal. Comenta que se siente a gusto y espera muchas buenas nuevas de esta estrategia de labores.  Con el dinero que piensa recibir, él ampliará sus sembríos con el cultivo de plátanos y yuca; así como continuar con el kión, café y achiote, para ello deberá pagar la mano de obra, que calcula serán 25 soles al día por trabajador.
texts.en:
Saúl, 50, has lived with his spouse for nearly ten years.  They have seven children but only six of them live with them in their own house.  Saúl’s been a farmer since childhood; he teaches this way of life to his children who help him with field chores.  He also makes “masato” (a traditional jungle beverage made from fermented manioc) to sell to visitors.  Of his five parcels of land he only produces on half a parcel; he grows coffee, manioc, annatto and ginger.  “We own land but we lack capital to produce in larger quantities,” he points out as his main problem.  He also adds that if he could exploit all of his land he’d earn higher profits and attain a better quality of life represented by a remodeled house, a new roof, new kitchen appliances, etc.

This is the first time he’s worked with MFP and in the communal bank.  He comments that he feels good and hopes that many new things will come from this new work strategy.  He will use the money he plans to receive to expand his banana and manioc crops as well as continue with the ginger, coffee and annatto.  To do so, he must pay labor costs which he figures will be 25 soles per day per worker.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: La señora Tania es artesana; tiene una joyería donde realiza joyas en plata. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: plata, oro y otros elementos necesarios. Esta actividad artesanal es su principal fuente de ingresos. Vive en casa en alquiler en una casa la misma que queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Tania solicita un crédito y por el carácter social se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Tania is a craftswoman.  She has a jewelry shop where she makes silver jewelry.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like silver, gold and other necessary elements.  This crafts work is her main source of income.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She’s married and has two children.  This is the first time Tania’s asked for a loan and because of its social nature it’s channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, etc. for her jewelry making workshop.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz Albina tiene 19 años, convive con su esposo hace 5 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, uno de 4 y otro de 1 año de edad. Vive a demás con su hermana de 12 años de quien también cuida en su casa propia. Ella y su familia se dedican a la agricultura, sembrando piñas y plantaciones de café en las 4 parcelas que son de su propiedad. Además de otros productos de consumo personal como la yuca. Luz  después de las labores en el campo se encarga de arreglar su casa, preparar sus alimentos y atender a sus pequeños hijos, con la ayuda de su hermana; mientras su esposo continúa en la siembra y cultivo. “El cultivo de piñas es un poco complicado, por las espinas que rodean el fruto, pero aún así queremos seguir”, comenta Luz. Asimismo menciona que, por falta de la “inducción” (proceso en el cultivo de piñas que mediante abono, mejora su producción en cuanto a calidad y cantidad), la cosecha no tuvo buenos ingresos. Luz, después de esa experiencia espera que la suerte le sonría con obtención de buenos frutos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP y un banco comunal, así que se muestra decida en sus convicciones por el respaldo de la entidad y compañeros. Comprará con el préstamo sacos de abono y fertilizantes para el proceso de “inducción” en sus plantaciones de piñas, que calcula costará 180 soles el costal.
texts.en:
Luz Albina, 19, has lived with her husband for the last five years; they have two children, a four-year-old and a one-year-old.  She also lives with her 12-year-old sister who she also cares for in at home.  She and her family farm; they grow pineapples and coffee on four parcels they own and also grow other products, like manioc, for their personal consumption.  

After Luz finishes with the field chores she tidies up her house, prepares the meals and tends to her small children with help from her sister while her husband continues with the planting and farming.  “Pineapple farming is a bit complicated because of the spines that surround the fruit but even so, we want to continue,” Luz comments.  She also mentions that because of the lack of “inducción” (a process in pineapple growing whereby the use of manure improves production both in quality and quantity) the crops did not produce good income.  After that experience, Luz hopes that luck will smile upon her and harvests will be better.

This is the first time she works with MFP and a communal bank and she’s committed to her goals thanks to the support she has from the institution and from her fellow members.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer for the “inducción” process in her pineapple plants that she calculates will cost 180 soles per sack.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sweet potatoies and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando a sus 57 años, tiene 26 años de conviviente con su esposa, con quién tiene 6 hijos, 4 mayores y 3 a quienes aún mantienen. Fernando vive en su casa propia. Desde niño se dedica a la agricultura, para ello cuenta con 8 parcelas de terreno agrícola, pero solo producen 3 parcelas, ahí siembra achiote, yuca y cítricos, con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos. “El negocio es rentable cuando se siembra en cantidad”, menciona. “Había sembrado tanyelo (una variedad mas jugosas de cítricos), pero una enfermedad destruyó mis sembríos, perdimos mucha inversión”, agrega melancólico. Aduciendo que los factores climáticos y las plagas habían ocasionado este problema. El trabajo con su banco comunal le abre las puertas a seguir creciendo como agricultor, por la confianza y la cercanía que todos ellos tienen. Es la primera vez que Fernando busca en MFP un crédito. Con el préstamo el adquirirá semillas para aventurarse, con buena fe, a sembrar piñas. Además para limpiar sus chacras de achiote, para ello deberá contratar peones para que trabajen en esas jornadas.
texts.en: Fifty-seven year old Fernando has been married for 26 years and he and his wife have six children; four adults and three who they still support.  Fernando has his own home and has been farming since he was a child.  He has four parcels of farmland, but only three are productive, where he raises achiote, yucca, and citrus with help from his wife and children.  “The business is profitable when planting is done in quantity,” he says.  “I had planted tangelos (a juicy variety of citrus), but a blight destroyed my crop.  We lost a big investment,” he added as he explained that the climate and blights had caused this problem.  Working with his communal bank, because of the trust and confidence they have, has opened the door for him to be able to continue growing as a farmer.  This will be Fernando’s first time seeking a loan through MFP.  He will use the money from this loan to buy seed.  With great faith he will take a chance growing pineapples. He will also hire field hands to clear his achiote fields.

loans.use: to buy seed and hire field hands
